BB_1938_title_recto: Two nude youths in attitude of flying, probably for S. Lorenzo
BB_1938_text_recto: According to Clapp more likely for the Loggia at Castello.

Collection_main: Gabinetto disegni e stampe degli Uffizi
BB_1961_title_recto: Nudo virile visto da tergo, ed una testa
BB_1961_title_verso: Torso virile visto lateralmente
BB_1938_title_recto: Male nude seen from behind, and a head
BB_1938_title_verso: Torso seen sideways
BB_1938_text_recto: Latish. Clapp (Life, fig. 134 and 135) correctly identifies the recto as a sketch for one of the figures in the Quirinale tapestry representing Benjamin at the Court of Pharaoh.

Collection_main: Gabinetto disegni e stampe degli Uffizi
BB_1961_title_recto: Giovane nudo che siede verso sinistra, toccandosi il piede sinistro, mostrando il dorso ma girando la testa verso lo spettatore in direzione opposta, in basso, un torso e un braccio. Il dorso è meravigliosamente modellato
BB_1961_title_verso: Nudo mezzo disteso ed uno inginocchiato, della medesima qualità del recto
BB_1938_title_recto: Nude youth, seen from behind but turned a little to left and with head towards us, sits holding his leg. The back is admirably modelled. Also a torso and a arm. Verso: Of same quality, a half-reclining, and a kneeling nude
BB_1938_title_verso: Of same quality, a half-reclining, and a kneeling nude
BB_1938_text_recto: These studies must have been done in connection with the fresco at Poggio a Cajano, although they do not occur there. They are at all events of that date, and among the best drawings of our master.

Collection_main: Gabinetto disegni e stampe degli Uffizi
BB_1961_title_recto: Giovane nudo seduto colle ginocchia accavallate sopra un sedile di pietra, la testa abbassata, il braccio sinistro abbandonato sulla spalliera del sedile
BB_1938_title_recto: Nude youth sitting with knees crossed on stone settle, his head drooping, his left arm drawn back over top of settle
BB_1938_text_recto: Same quality and purpose as last.

Collection_main: Gabinetto disegni e stampe degli Uffizi
BB_1961_title_recto: Giovane nudo seduto sopra un masso, il torso visto quasi di fianco, il braccio destro appoggiato a un'asta, il sinistro sopra un libro, la testa vista di dietro
BB_1938_title_recto: Nude youth seated on block, his torso seen almost sideways, with right arm stretched out and resting on staff, his left on a book, the head seen from behind
BB_1938_text_recto: The modelling is truly splendid, and the effect of colour almost unsurpassable. This also may have been done in connection with Poggio a Cajano.

Collection_main: Gabinetto disegni e stampe degli Uffizi
BB_1961_title_recto: Giovane nudo seduto sulla base di un albero, al quale si appoggia con la mano destra mentre con la sinistra si tiene una ciotola alla bocca
BB_1938_title_recto: Nude youth lightly seated on branch, on which he leans with right hand, while with left he holds bowl to his mouth
BB_1938_text_recto: This delightful nude is of the quality and style of the drawings for Poggio a Cajano, and probably was intended for a Baptist in the Wilderness.

Collection_main: Gabinetto disegni e stampe degli Uffizi
BB_1961_title_recto: Giovane nudo con gli occhi stravolti, seduto con le gambe divaricate, che accenna a sinistra
BB_1938_title_recto: Male nude with mad eyes, lightly seated with legs wide apart, pointing to left. Probably for Poggio a Cajano

Collection_main: Gabinetto disegni e stampe degli Uffizi
BB_1961_title_recto: Nudo virile seduto per terra, con il ginocchio destro alzato e la gamba sinistra flessa sul terreno, sul quale egli si appoggia con la mano sinistra facendo solecchio agli occhi con la destra in direzione capovolta, vago accenno del busto della stessa figura. Il nudo a sanguigna, l'accenno del busto a carboncino
BB_1961_title_verso: Scarabocchio grezzo di un torso
BB_1938_title_recto: Nude squatting on ground, with right leg bent at knee and raised, the left folded back on ground, left hand resting on ground, right shading eyes
BB_1938_title_verso: Rough scrawl of torso
BB_1938_text_recto: Both these are variations upon my 202, and like that were intended for Poggio a Cajano, probably for the shepherd on the ground to the left

Collection_main: Gabinetto disegni e stampe degli Uffizi
BB_1961_title_recto: Giovane nudo di lunghezza favolosa visto quasi da tergo, col dorso della mano destra appoggiato sopra un tavolo
BB_1938_title_recto: Nude youth of fabulous length seen from behind, with back of left hand resting on table, and right hand held out
BB_1938_text_recto: Latish.

Collection_main: Gabinetto disegni e stampe degli Uffizi
BB_1961_title_recto: Giovane nudo seduto in profilo a destra su tre scalini con la mano sinistra tesa (studio per il medesimo San Giovanni che ritroviamo su BB n. 1978) un altro giovane seduto. Ambedue disegnati a carboncino sopra diversi scarabocchi a sanguigna
BB_1961_title_verso: Due nudi visti di fianco seduti sui calcagni
BB_1938_title_recto: Nude youth seated sideways to right with left hand held out, a study for the same composition for a St. John that we find in my 1978. Another seated youth. Both drawn in black chalk over various scrawls in red chalk
BB_1938_title_verso: Two nudes seen sideways seated on their heels
BB_1938_text_recto: All fairly early

Collection_main: Gabinetto disegni e stampe degli Uffizi
BB_1961_title_recto: Cinque nudi virili, michelangioleschi e al tempo stesso antichi, stanno in piedi presso un fuoco: uno tira fuori qualcosa da un sacco tenuto da un altro, come se tirasse a sorte, mentre tiene un libro nella mano destra varie figure gesticolanti nello sfondo
BB_1938_title_recto: Highly finished design for a composition. Five Michelangelesque and at once antique nudes stand by a fire. One takes something out of a bag held by another as if to draw lots, while in his right hand he holds a book. Several gesticulating figures in background
BB_1938_text_recto: It is for iconographers to say what this may mean. As a composition it is beautiful, and exhales delightful suggestions. The date may be about 1535 or later. A comparison with Pollajuolo's nudes helps us to measure the distance travelled by the art of the Renaissance in about 70 years.

Collection_main: Gabinetto disegni e stampe degli Uffizi
BB_1961_title_recto: Giovane nudo virile seduto di lato verso destra e vaghi accenni di un altro nudo
BB_1961_title_verso: Giovane nudo in profilo a destra che si appoggia a un parapetto, mostrando gran parte delle spalle. Di qualità incantevole
BB_1938_title_recto: Youthful nude seated sideways to right, and vaguer nude
BB_1938_title_verso: Youthful nude of most charming quality standing sideways, showing most of back. His hands rest on parapet
BB_1938_text_recto: As Clapp (Life, fig. 6) points out, the sketch on the recto is for a woman seated on the steps to left in the Annunziata Visitation. A most interesting somewhat Raphaelesque version of it used to be in the Geiger Collection.
BB_1903_text_recto: Both were probably for Poggio a Cajano.

Collection_main: Gabinetto disegni e stampe degli Uffizi
BB_1961_title_recto: Nudo virile seduto con la testa e le gambe in profilo a sinistra, su un cubo al quale si appoggia con la mano sinistra, mentre addita con l'altra mano lo spettatore
BB_1961_title_verso: Nudo femminile visto da tergo
BB_1938_title_recto: Nude figure sitting on block pressing it down with left hand while pointing to right, although facing to left
BB_1938_title_verso: Female nude seen from behind
BB_1938_text_recto: The attitude recalls Michelangelo's decorative nudes on the Sixtine Ceiling. The quality is excellent. Perhaps it is Pontormo's best sketch in black chalk. As it is more mannered than the sketches that can positively be connected with the Poggio a Cajano fresco, it may have been intended for the lunette that was not executed.

Collection_main: Gabinetto disegni e stampe degli Uffizi
BB_1961_title_recto: Nudo disteso sul fianco sinistro visto da tergo
BB_1938_title_recto: Reclining nude seen from behind
BB_1938_text_recto: Late.

Collection_main: Gabinetto disegni e stampe degli Uffizi

BB_1938_title_recto: Fat male nude seen from behind with right arm curved around head, and left doubled up from elbow
BB_1938_text_recto: Michelangelesque in motive, and late.

Collection_main: Gabinetto disegni e stampe degli Uffizi
BB_1961_title_recto: Nudo di brutte proporzioni in profilo a sinistra
BB_1938_title_recto: Nude of bad proportions seen sideways
BB_1938_text_recto: Late.

BB_1961_title_recto: Nudo che ne sorregge un altro
BB_1938_title_recto: Nude supporting another. The latter recalls my 2066 and 2069, and this drawing must have served same purpose as those

Collection_main: Gabinetto disegni e stampe degli Uffizi
BB_1961_title_recto: Cristo seduto, in una mandorla di nudi, con le mani aperte a benedire: in basso, l'Eterno che fa uscire Eva dalla costola di Adamo dormiente
BB_1961_text_recto: Same as 1938 and 1938 Title, in Italian
BB_1938_title_recto: Christ seated with hands held out in midst of various nudes, all caricatures of Michelangelo. Below the Christ an old man, representing the Eternal, is calling to life Eve from under the sleeping Adam
BB_1938_text_recto: Certainly for S. Lorenzo. There is a touch of Blake in all this.

Collection_main: Gabinetto disegni e stampe degli Uffizi
BB_1961_title_recto: Giovane nudo che sembra scendere da una roccia, colla gamba sinistra allungata e la destra di scorcio, il braccio destro ricadente lungo il fianco e il sinistro proteso
BB_1938_title_recto: Nude youth seen as if climbing down from rock with left leg stretched out and right foreshortened, right arm falling to side and left stretched out
BB_1938_text_recto: According to Clapp (Dessins, p. 184) about 1520.
BB_1903_text_recto: This was suggested by the dead Christ in Andrea's famous "Pietà" now in the Pitti and doubtless was intended for a similar subject.

Collection_main: Gabinetto disegni e stampe degli Uffizi
BB_1961_title_recto: Studio per un Cristo Morto
BB_1961_title_verso: Piccolo schizzo di un nudo maschile nella stessa posa del recto, schizzo separato della testa e delle braccia per la stessa figura e schizzo per le gambe e l'addome di un torso maschile
BB_1961_text_recto: Same as 1938, in Italian except the reference to BB n. 2486 "da me data a Sebastiano del Piombo"
BB_1938_title_recto: Study for Dead Christ
BB_1938_title_verso: Small sketch of male nude in same attitude as on recto, one for head and arms and another for legs and abdomen of male torso
BB_1938_text_recto: At first sight it might seem as if Pontormo while drawing this interesting sketch had in mind the famous Warwick design for a Pietà (now in the British Museum, my 2486) ascribed to Michelangelo or indeed that master's original jotting for this design. The purpose of the action in the two figures is almost identical, although Pontormo betrays that he does not quite understand what he is doing. If he had, perhaps he would not have drawn back the left leg. This is so uncalled for that I cannot help thinking that what he really had in mind was not the Warwick Pietà or its predecessors, but the attitude and action of Michelangelo's - singular adaptation! - Leda.
BB_1903_text_recto: Same as 1938 and added: Now if really Pontormo drew this sketch in connection with the “Pietà” in the Accademia (with the dead Christ in which it has considerable resemblance), then we should have to grant, what we know was not the fact, that he had never delved deep into the most precious secrets of form and action. In the painting there remains of the motive the silhouette only. The chest, instead of being arched so as to exhibit all the play of bone, muscle and tendon, has become a box. All the ambrosial relaxation has left it, and given place to mere motionlessness, and the fact of death

Collection_main: Gabinetto disegni e stampe degli Uffizi
BB_1961_title_recto: Giovane nudo appoggiato col braccio sinistro a una stampella
BB_1938_title_recto: Nude youth leaning on crutch which he holds under his left elbow. A delightful early study for Poggio a Cajano perhaps, or indeed for a St. Christopher of the same period

Collection_main: Gabinetto disegni e stampe degli Uffizi
BB_1961_title_recto: Giovane uomo seduto a gambe aperte con un drappo intorno alla vita e un rotolo nella mano destra, la sinistra alzata con gesto declamatorio e lo sguardo volto a sinistra con espressione ispirata
BB_1961_title_verso: Nudo in profilo e studi per la parte inferiore di un nudo virile
BB_1961_text_recto: [1957: Quando il Clapp propose di collegare questo schizzo con uno dei Patriarchi, ora distrutti, nella volta della Cappella Capponi in Santa Felicita (1526-28), io non fui d'accordo con lui, perché mi sembrava di data più giovanile; ma oggi gli do ragione e sono grato a Miss Janet Cox per aver dimostrato in Burlington Magazine, Gennaio 1956, p. 17 seg.,  fig. 17, che si tratta proprio di uno studio per uno di quei Patriarchi.];
BB_1961_text_verso: Same as 1938, in Italian
BB_1938_title_recto: Admirable study for draped figure seated on ground with legs wide apart, the right hand with scroll in it resting on parapet, left held up as if reciting. He looks to left with an inspired expression. The attitude recalls my 2089, and like that, this sketch may have been done for Poggio a Cajano but for the lunette that was never executed
BB_1938_title_verso: Nudes and legs, slight
BB_1938_text_verso: Clapp (Life, fig. 98) wants to connect these with S. Felicita but they seem to me earlier.

Collection_main: Gabinetto disegni e stampe degli Uffizi

BB_1961_title_verso: Cristo morto
BB_1961_text_verso: Same as 1938 Title, in Italian
BB_1938_title_recto: Head of youth looking down a little to left
BB_1938_title_verso: Study for Dead Christ, probably for the Certosa Pietà and done under Dürer's influence
BB_1938_text_recto: Loose

Collection_main: Gabinetto disegni e stampe degli Uffizi

BB_1938_title_recto: A bald-headed nude leaning with both hands on a staff. Also a hand
BB_1938_title_verso: Various sketches for arms, shoulder, and hips
BB_1938_text_recto: Late Michelangelesque studies probably for the Adam labouring the earth (see Clapp, Dessins, pp. 187,188).

Collection_main: Gabinetto disegni e stampe degli Uffizi
BB_1961_title_recto: Ragazzo nudo in corsa, dall'espressione intontita una testa piccolo schizzo spiritoso di un ratto
BB_1961_title_verso: Ragazzo nudo in profilo a sinistra
BB_1938_title_recto: Nude idiot boy. A head. Small and spirited sketch of a rape
BB_1938_title_verso: Nude boy seen sideways

Collection_main: Gabinetto disegni e stampe degli Uffizi
BB_1961_title_recto: Due studi di una gamba sinistra e nudo visto da tergo
BB_1961_title_verso: Due studi di panneggio di una figura vista da tergo
BB_1938_title_recto: Studies of leg and a nude, seen from behind
BB_1938_title_verso: Two studies of drapery of figure seen from back
BB_1938_text_recto: Rather early.

Collection_main: Gabinetto disegni e stampe degli Uffizi

Collection_main: Gabinetto disegni e stampe degli Uffizi

BB_1961_title_verso: Testa femminile
BB_1938_title_recto: Torso of youth in profile to right, with hand held up to chin. Perhaps for one of the Evangelists in the Capponi Chapel at S. Felicita

BB_1938_text_recto: Done in the most extraordinary technique with bistre on a ground rubbed with black chalk, resulting in a freedom and force that are not easily surpassed in Renaissance draughtsmanship. Indeed we are reminded of the Japanese and certain recent French men.

Collection_main: Gabinetto disegni e stampe degli Uffizi

BB_1938_title_verso: Slight sketch of figure running and perspective outline of two gates; in right upper corner sketch of gate reminding us of the one in the Certosa fresco representing Christ in the garden
BB_1938_text_recto: The folds are of purely Northern character, and here we have witness to Pontormo's attempt at adopting not only the ideas but the manner of Dürer. Doubtless for some figure in the Certosa frescoes.

BB_1938_title_recto: Nude pretty youth sitting sideways

BB_1938_text_recto: This motive betrays, what otherwise we might not have suspected, that the idea of these putti for Poggio a Cajano came to Pontormo from Michelangelo's nude lads in the Sixtine Ceiling.

Collection_main: Gabinetto disegni e stampe degli Uffizi

BB_1938_title_recto: Nude youth with head in profile to right stands looking at object in right hand
BB_1938_title_verso: More rapid and probably later study of wild-looking youth fluttering behind him a drapery which he holds with both hands close to his head
BB_1938_text_recto: Very powerful contours, as if undercut in bronze, yet of marvellous effect as colour. Perhaps done after Michelangelo's bozzetto for the David of c. 1517.

Collection_main: Gabinetto disegni e stampe degli Uffizi
BB_1961_title_recto: Schizzo rapido ma magistrale di un nudo maschile adagiato all'indietro, col braccio destro alzato che nasconde a metà il volto disegnato parzialmente al disopra di questo, altro schizzo eloquente di un nudo in posa analoga, ma visto più di fronte scarabocchi di una spalla e di un fanciullo
BB_1961_title_verso: Progetto per la lunetta di Poggio a Caiano: due figure giovanili (le stesse studiate negli schizzi sul recto) si appoggiano al vertice della finestra rotonda reggendo le insegne; in mezzo a loro uno stemma; ai lati inferiori della finestra, vaga indicazione di due figure; al di fuori di questo schema, rapido schizzo di due putti avvinghiati dorso contro dorso, e studio molto più deciso di due putti gagliardamente avvinti, in piedi sopra un piedistallo iscritto Jacopo da Pontormo
BB_1938_title_recto: Rapid bust masterly sketch of male nude leaning backward, with right arm held up and half hiding face. Partly drawn over this, an equally telling sketch of a nude seen more form the front. Also scrawl of a shoulder, and of a child. All for Poggio a Cajano
BB_1938_title_verso: Mapping out of the lunette at Poggio a Cajano. Youthful figures, for which the two on the front were sketches, lean against the top of the round window holding ensigns. Between them a panoply. Near the window below, vague indication of a figure on either side. The outside this scheme, rapid sketch of the two putti back to back, and more firm, indeed very decisive study of two putti clinging sturdily one to the other, and standing on a pedestal. Both these groups of putti are imitations of those Michelangelo placed on the pedestals in his Sixtine frescoes. The mapping out in black chalk, the figures in red chalk

Collection_main: Gabinetto disegni e stampe degli Uffizi
BB_1961_title_recto: Ragazzo nudo a cavalcioni di un ramo di lauro
BB_1938_title_recto: Putto striding laurel bush, earlier and more spirited version of my 2017A, and like that done in connection with the frescoes at Poggio a Cajano

BB_1938_title_recto: Masterly, vigorous sketch for the child angel on our right in the S. Michele altar-piece. Repetition of part of same figure
BB_1938_title_verso: Seated male nude, with right hand pressing down on bench, and left held out. Child's head. Done perhaps for same work before it took final shape

BB_1961_title_recto: Nudo virile sproporzionalmente allungato nella posa del Cristo in atto di essere inchiodato sulla croce (a carboncino acquarellato con biacca e rosa chiaro) in direzione rovesciata un busto dalla testa più giovanile, col braccio destro alzato tracciato rapidamente, senza dubbio per lo stesso scopo (a sanguigna) nell'angolo inferiore sinistro, rifinito studio dal vero per la sola testa del Cristo, incollato dal Pontormo stesso (a sanguigna)
BB_1961_text_recto: Same as 1938, in Italian and added: Vedi anche BB n. 2159 recto.
BB_1938_title_recto: Study in black chalk and wash for disproportionately long figure of Christ in attitude of being nailed to cross. Also in reverse direction a more youthful head with right arm stretched up, no doubt for same purpose. The bust and right arm are drawn in red chalk roughly, and the head alone more elaborately, and from the model
BB_1938_text_recto: This sketch certainly served for the fine composition representing the Nailing to the Cross for which my 2159A gives us the design.

BB_1938_title_verso: Drapery for torso with left arm akimbo

BB_1961_title_verso: Sommario profilo a sinistra di uomo giovanile

BB_1938_title_verso: More summary profile to left of youngish man
BB_1938_text_recto: Both these profiles have an almost Holbeinesque precision.

Collection_main: Gabinetto disegni e stampe degli Uffizi
BB_1961_title_recto: Quattro putti in atteggiamenti diversi, due dei quali visibili solo in parte
BB_1961_title_verso: Putto seduto per terra verso destra, con la gamba destra piegata al ginocchio e la gamba sinistra distesa e studi separati delle sue membra
BB_1938_title_recto: Four putti in various attitudes, two of them only partly visible
BB_1938_title_verso: Putto seated on ground, with right hand on it and left leg stretched out
BB_1938_text_recto: These sketches may have served for the charming putto in the foreground of Pontormo's Annunziata fresco. They were all done probably from the model which was rapidly sketched in various attitudes more and more approaching the one in the painting. The quality of the drawing, so singularly angular and yet so fluent, has never been surpassed by our artist. Clapp (see Dessins, p. 219) connects them with the drawings for Poggio with which indeed they have more in common. It is interesting to note that the attitudes remain nearer to Andrea while the technique has already left him behind.

Collection_main: Gabinetto disegni e stampe degli Uffizi

BB_1961_title_verso: Studio più rapido per la stessa figura del recto
BB_1938_title_recto: Fine study of sleeping figure and of head of same, for Dead Christ for which my 2174, 2175 verso, 2175A also served
BB_1938_title_verso: More rapid study of same figure

Collection_main: Gabinetto disegni e stampe degli Uffizi
BB_1961_title_recto: Inchiodamento di Cristo sulla Croce
BB_1961_text_recto: Same as 1938 and 1938 Title, in Italian
BB_1938_title_recto: Arched composition for fresco, the lower right corner of which overhangs door. It represents, in many small figures, Christ being nailed to the cross, and is interesting as an arrangement, full of freakishness and originality. It is squared for enlarging and was planned for the Certosa but never executed
BB_1938_text_recto: See in connection with it my 1972A, 2148, 2159, 2171, 2174, 2175A, 2177.

BB_1938_text_recto: It seems to me now (1934) nearer to Michelangelo, particularly the two straggling groups to our right.
BB_1903_text_recto: Very close to Andrea, and quite early

Collection_main: Gabinetto disegni e stampe degli Uffizi

BB_1961_title_verso: Donna semisdraiata che si appoggia al gomito sinistro con le gambe allungate sul terreno
BB_1961_text_recto: Same as 1938 and 1938 Title, in Italian
BB_1938_title_recto: Study for reclining shepherdess, the one next to the window on our right in the lunette at Poggio a Cajano
BB_1938_title_verso: Study for reclining shepherdess to right of the one for which the last is study
BB_1938_text_recto: Both are free and powerful as draughtsmanship. This one seems a more elaborated version of my 2020 verso.

Collection_main: Gabinetto disegni e stampe degli Uffizi
BB_1961_title_recto: Mezza figura di nudo giovanile dai capelli ricciuti, appoggiato sul gomito destro e volto leggermente verso sinistra
BB_1938_title_recto: Half-length figure of curly-headed youthful nude leaning on right elbow and looking out a little to left. Perhaps study for one of the Evangelists in the Capponi Chapel at S. Felicita

Collection_main: Gabinetto disegni e stampe degli Uffizi
BB_1961_title_recto: A sinistra un cavaliere, a destra una specie di vecchia Sibilla che lo addita a un giovane, nel mezzo del foglio un groviglio di figure, quelle in primo piano stese a terra bocconi, quelle nello sfondo simili a lancieri a cavallo
BB_1961_text_recto: Same as 1938, in Italian and added: Per il cavaliere vedi anche BB n. 2205 e BB n. 2023, per le figure bocconi vedi anche BB n. 2021 verso. [1958: Sia questo, sia gli studi di cavaliere su BB n. 2205, si riferiscono allo sfondo dell'"Epifania" dipinta dal Pontormo intorno al 1517-18 e ora a Pitti.]
BB_1938_title_recto: Old sibyl pointing out to a knight a youthful cavalier on horseback
BB_1938_text_recto: The rider occurs in the Martyrdom of St. Maurice, and the entire sketch may have been made while Pontormo was preparing for enlarging that picture. The study is of remarkable pictorial effect, energetic and yet graceful giving us a slight foretaste of Greco.

Collection_main: Gabinetto disegni e stampe degli Uffizi

BB_1961_title_verso: Esile nudo virile seduto, appoggiato come a ripiano di tavola e due rapidi schizzi di un busto di vecchio
BB_1938_title_recto: Elderly nude seated, looking to right, with right leg drawn back, holding staff in right hand
BB_1938_title_verso: Slender nude lightly seated, and two rapid sketches of old man's head
BB_1938_text_recto: The purpose of this sheet is unknown to me. Early.
BB_1903_text_recto: Same as 1938 and added: Possibly it may have been done in connection with Poggio a Cajano.

BB_1938_title_recto: Nude kneeling to left in attitude of prayer, holding staff in closed right hand, his left drawn back and below the same model reclining
BB_1938_title_verso: Three youthful nudes reclining, one of theme pointing with his left hand
BB_1938_text_recto: Very likely as Clapp suggests (Dessins, p. 227) for an Adoration of the Shepherds
BB_1938_text_verso: Excellent. Several years later than the recto, the principal figure distinctly "Michelangelo-Raphaelesque".
BB_1903_text_recto: This is  perhaps a study for a "Pietà", the dead Christ for which we have in n. 2174.

BB_1961_title_verso: Ragazzo semigenuflesso che punta l'indice destro in alto
BB_1938_title_recto: Study of putto seated, with right hand pressing on bench, and left lifted up
BB_1938_title_verso: Boy half kneeling and pointing
BB_1938_text_recto: Reminiscent of Andrea's studies (my 131) for the Madonna and Angels now in the Wallace Collection. Probably for a young Baptist. This and the putto must have served for some such picture as the small altar-piece in the Uffizi still ascribed to Rosso.

Collection_main: Gabinetto disegni e stampe degli Uffizi

BB_1938_title_recto: Nude youth reclining, with right arm over head, out of which his eyes look at us aghast. Late and Michelangelesque

Collection_main: Gabinetto disegni e stampe degli Uffizi
BB_1961_title_recto: Busto di donna anziana che porta un'acconciatura da vedova
BB_1961_text_recto: Same as 1938, in Italian and added: Vedi anche BB n. 2011 recto.
BB_1938_title_recto: Bust of middle-aged lady wearing widow's headdress
BB_1938_text_recto: Simple, straightforward, direct, and dignified. From later middle period. Conceivably for the portrait of Maria Salviati at the Uffizi, where she is considerably "stylized"

Collection_main: Gabinetto disegni e stampe degli Uffizi
BB_1961_title_recto: Testa graziosa, ma eccessivamente elaborata, di donna giovanile, leggermente piegata a sinistra con in testa un fazzoletto
BB_1938_title_recto: Pretty but somewhat over-elaborated head of young woman, leaning a little to left, wearing kerchief
BB_1938_text_recto: Perhaps for the Madonna in the Louvre altar-piece.

Collection_main: Gabinetto disegni e stampe degli Uffizi

BB_1961_text_recto: Same as 1938, in Italian and added: [1959: Se vaga è la corrispondenza vista dal Giglioli fra il verso e il Cristo della "Deposizione" di Santa Felicita, esatto sembra il riferimento del recto al San Giovanni addormentato nell'"Orazione nell'Orto " alla Certosa (1522-27): riferimento stabilito da L. Marcucci nel catalogo della Mostra del 1956].
BB_1938_title_recto: Heavily draped, melancholy youth, seated against table with head in his hand, lost in reverie
BB_1938_title_verso: Lower part of male nude reclining on right side
BB_1938_text_recto: An absurdly Wertherish or even Byronic young man, most charmingly drawn

BB_1938_title_recto: Demon pulling at arm of torso
BB_1938_title_verso: Nude in attitude of Michelangelo's Day, but absurdly exaggerated
BB_1938_text_recto: Doubtless for S. Lorenzo

Collection_main: Gabinetto disegni e stampe degli Uffizi

BB_1961_title_verso: Altri due studi affrescati per lo stesso
BB_1938_title_recto: Nude seated on his heels with legs drawn up, shading himself with right hand. Yet another study for the seated shepherd on the extreme left in the Poggio a Cajano fresco
BB_1938_title_verso: Two more scratchy studies for same

Collection_main: Gabinetto disegni e stampe degli Uffizi

BB_1961_title_verso: Figura virile barbuta nella stessa posa del nudo sul recto
BB_1961_text_recto: Same as 1938, in Italian and added:  [1957: Janet Cox, Burlington Magazine, Gennaio 1956, fig. 19, lo riferisce al Padre Eterno nel perduto affresco della volta nella Cappella Capponi a Santa Felicita (1526-28) e mi sembra con ragione.]
BB_1938_title_recto: Nude figure seated on ground with right hand held out eloquently and legs stretched out
BB_1938_text_recto: Probably a study for a Christ about to be nailed to the cross, and for the composition for which my 2159A is the design. Of poor quality but not, as Clapp thinks, too poor to be by Pontormo.

Collection_main: Gabinetto disegni e stampe degli Uffizi
BB_1961_title_recto: Busto di uomo nudo
BB_1938_title_recto: Bust of a nude man. Date of S. Felicita Pietà

Collection_main: Gabinetto disegni e stampe degli Uffizi
BB_1961_title_recto: Parte superiore di nudo giovanile che guarda in alto
BB_1961_title_verso: Studio simile al recto
BB_1938_title_recto: Upper part of youthful nude looking to right, study perhaps for young Baptist in an altar-piece
BB_1938_title_verso: Similar study

Collection_main: Gabinetto disegni e stampe degli Uffizi
BB_1961_title_recto: Quattro studi variamente elaborati per un Cristo Morto in grembo alla Madre, due dei quali piccolissimi a carboncino, e studi separati per la testa, le mani e i piedi
BB_1961_title_verso: Nudo inginocchiato che ci guarda, avido di compassione; un altro nudo più curvo, un braccio ed una gamba
BB_1938_title_recto: Several excellent studies of various stages and degrees of elaboration for a Dead Christ, two very small ones being in black chalk
BB_1938_title_verso: Kneeling nude looking at us as if craving sympathy, another nude more bent, an arm and a leg. Doubtless for same work
BB_1938_text_recto: They all would seem to have been done, like my 2159, 2175 verso, and 2175A in preparation for a Pietà
BB_1938_text_verso: See L'Arte, 1925, p. 157, fig. 10, where Giulia Sinibaldi points out the great likeness between this and the other studies (see my 2159, 2159A, 2175, 2175A, 2177) and the Dublin Pietà. I cannot help doubting whether so important a set of studies would have been prepared for a small predella panel. Perhaps another larger composition of the same type did exist and is lost to us.
BB_1903_text_recto: Same as 1938 and added: N. 2046, 2162, 2175, 2177 may have been for the same composition, which Pontormo have made while he was engaged upon the fresco at Poggio a Cajano.

Collection_main: Gabinetto disegni e stampe degli Uffizi
BB_1961_title_recto: Studio dal modello di un nudo virile in profilo a sinistra, piegato in avanti con un'asta nella mano destra e il piede destro appoggiato a un gradino
BB_1961_title_verso: Studio di un Cristo morto
BB_1938_title_recto: Study form male model of nude in profile to left, bending over, staff in hand, with right foot lifted, and touching a platform. Done perhaps for an Adoration of the Shepherds. Cf. My 2162.
BB_1938_title_verso: Study of Dead Christ, for the composition sketched in my 1962, 2159 and 2175A

Collection_main: Gabinetto disegni e stampe degli Uffizi
BB_1961_title_recto: Studio dal modello di un nudo maschile dormiente col capo sollevato su cuscini, il braccio destro disteso, ed il sinistro ricadente sul grembo altri due schizzi più piccoli per una figura in posizione simile, ma più vicina alle figure giacenti di Michelangelo sulle Tombe Medicee
BB_1961_title_verso: Nudo maschile che cammina in avanti con la testa buttata all'indietro ed il braccio destro proteso
BB_1938_title_recto: Study for model of sleeping male nude propped up with pillows, right arm extended, and left falling on lap. Also two smaller sketches for figure in somewhat similar position, but closer to Michelangelo's reclining figures on the Medici Tombs
BB_1938_title_verso: Male nude walking with head tossed back and right arm held out
BB_1938_text_recto: Obviously this sketch was for a Dead Christ, and probably for the work for which we have other sketches here, for instance my 2174
BB_1938_text_verso: Singularly close to Andrea, although of course more perfunctory.

Collection_main: Gabinetto disegni e stampe degli Uffizi

BB_1961_title_verso: Giovane uomo in un lungo mantello che si volta verso di noi
BB_1938_title_recto: Youth loosely draped but with legs bare, looks down, right arm akimbo, left held out
BB_1938_title_verso: Young man in long mantle turning towards us
BB_1938_text_recto: This sheet, like to  some degree my 2175 and to a greater degree the following number show Pontormo in a phase where it is easy to confound him as a draughtsman with his brilliant follower Naldini.

Collection_main: Gabinetto disegni e stampe degli Uffizi

BB_1938_title_recto: Kneeling nude looking toward us, evidently for same figure as in my 2174 verso
BB_1938_title_verso: Kneeling youth for same purpose in red chalk; and in black chalk, bust of young Baptist
BB_1938_text_recto: Both the nudes must have been drawn in connection with the Pietà sketched in my 2174, 2175 and 2175A.
BB_1903_text_recto: Both the nudes must have been drawn in connection with the "Pietà" sketched in n. 1962 and 2174.

BB_1938_text_recto: Both these admirable drawings may have served for the S. Michele altar-piece in a more primitive phase, the one on the recto for the Evangelist, the one on the verso for the St. Francis. But it is possible that these also were done in connection with Poggio a Cajano, and this is more likely, for the window there seems indicated on this sheet.

BB_1938_title_verso: Studies for nude figures meant to decorate a spandrel

Collection_main: Gabinetto disegni e stampe degli Uffizi
BB_1961_title_recto: Uomo leggermente drappeggiato, dalla barba fluente, seduto assai basso, di tre quarti verso destra, con il volto e il braccio destro diretti verso sinistra (molti pentimenti nelle posizioni della testa, delle gambe e delle mani)
BB_1961_text_recto: Si deve a J. Cox l'aver identificato questa figura, già attribuita a Niccolò dell'Abate, con il Padre Eterno al centro dell'affresco, ora perduto, nella volta della Cappella Capponi a Santa Felicita (1526-28). Per altri studi destinati a questo Padre Eterno vedi BB n. 2171-

Collection_main: Gabinetto disegni e stampe degli Uffizi
BB_1961_title_recto: Altra composizione arcuata contenente un'originalissima rappresentazione della Epifania: il corteo dei Magi si snoda in primo piano, dirigendosi verso sinistra, dove presso ad una roccia sotto una tettoia illuminata da una finestrina alla sinistra il primo dei re s'inginocchia e bacia il piedino del Bambino Gesù, il quale si divincola fra le mani di Sua madre mentre Ella si china tenendoLo nelle braccia protese fra Sant'Anna e San Giuseppe sotto San Giuseppe, San Giovannino arringa la folla sottostante
BB_1938_title_recto: Tall arched composition containing a most original treatment of the Epiphany. The  huddled train of the Magi winds up the foreground, and turns to left, where by a rock, under a shed lighted by a window on the left, the first of the kings kneels and embraces the foot of the Christ Child, Who struggles in the hands of His mother as she stoops, holding Him at arms' length. To her right and left, St. Anne and St. Joseph. Under Joseph, the infant Baptist addressing the crowd below
BB_1938_text_recto: Ascribed to Rosso. The handling is free and bold, and worthy of the originality of the conception. I agree with Clapp in dating this design soon after 1520. It anticipates Tintoretto in the Scuola di S. Rocco.
BB_1903_text_recto: I would date this design about 1528, and, at all events, place it somewhat earlier than the panel in the Pitti Gallery.

BB_1961_title_recto: Due grandi nudi maschili che guardano in uno specchio, ed un fanciullo seduto a sinistra
BB_1938_title_recto: Two large male nudes peering into a glass, and a child seated on left
BB_1938_text_recto: Powerful, and doubtless a study for a fresco but for which of the many decorations whereof no trace remains, I cannot determine.

BB_1961_title_recto: Ritratto di un avvocato fiorentino seduto in una poltrona a braccioli
BB_1938_title_recto: Sketch for portrait of Florentine lawyer seated in armchair

BB_1961_title_recto: Giovane Santo con un'asta
BB_1938_title_recto: Young saint with a staff
BB_1938_text_recto: Ascribed to Cigoli.

BB_1961_title_recto: Martirio di San Maurizio e della Legione Tebana
BB_1938_title_recto: Study of about size of the painting for the Martyrdom of St. Maurice and the Theban Legion, painted for Carlo Neroni, and now in the Uffizi

BB_1961_title_recto: Nudo femminile seduto in forte contrapposto che regge un grandioso disco sopra il ginocchio sinistro rialzato. Nell'angolo inferiore sinistro, piccolo nudo ancor più contorto
BB_1961_title_verso: Torso virile in atto di tirare qualcosa, col collo arrovesciato indietro verso destra; e perpendicolarmente ad esso, una Madonna seduta che tiene in grembo il Bambino addormentato
BB_1938_title_recto: Seated female nude twisting in strong contrapposto to right and holding large disc on drawn-up left knee. In lower-hand corner a small and even more twisted nude
BB_1938_title_verso: Male torso straining up to right and vertically to it sketch for Madonna seated holding the Child asleep in her lap
BB_1938_text_recto: In the text to the Prestel publication it is suggested that the female nude was made in connection with the allegorical frescoes at Careggi, 1538-1543. Nowhere else is Pontormo more successfully and more magnificently Michelangelesque whether in the contour drawing of the monumental Madonna or the highly finished work of the allegorical figure, only that the last has at the same time a deliberate elegance that anticipates the French followers of Rosso and Primaticcio.
Cataloguer's Question: Without stars in column H, but we don't find the item in BB_1903.

BB_1961_title_recto: Tre nudi virili che camminano verso sinistra
BB_1961_title_verso: Donna seduta e studi di panneggi

BB_1938_title_verso: Study for seated woman and for some draperies
BB_1938_text_recto: The same sketch as on the recto occurs in the Uffizi (442F) and is of somewhat better quality.

BB_1961_title_recto: Donna paludata, seduta con le mani in mano
BB_1961_title_verso: Due studi per il torso ed uno per il busto del Cristo nella "Deposizione" di Santa Felicita

BB_1938_title_verso: Two studies for the torso and one for the head of the Christ in the S. Felicita Deposition
BB_1938_text_recto: Same as 1938, in Italian

BB_1961_title_recto: Tre nudi smisuratamente lunghi: una donna seduta sopra una roccia che cerca di tirarsi su un'altra, pure seduta, che cerca di sostenerne una terza
BB_1938_title_recto: Three immeasurably long nudes, ascribed to Michelangelo, but certainly by Pontormo, and probably for the Deluge at S. Lorenzo. One female sits on a rock trying to draw herself up. Another seated, tries to support a third

BB_1961_title_recto: Busto di un giovane, incorniciato da un turbine di drappeggi
BB_1938_title_recto: Head and torso of youth framed in by swirl of drapery
BB_1938_text_recto: According to Clapp (Dessins, p. 295) for one of the Evangelists in the vaulting of the Capponi Chapel at S. Felicita.

BB_1961_title_recto: Madonna seduta verso destra col Bambino in piedi sul Suo grembo e a sinistra San Giovannino seduto che addita il cielo con la sinistra
BB_1938_title_recto: Study for Madonna looking to left while the Child clings to her, and the infant John stands by

BB_1961_title_recto: Studio per una decorazione parietale divisa da pilastri e cornici in un trittico sormontato da tre lunette: i tre scomparti inferiori contengono una scena unica, possibilmente la Morte di Seneca nel suo Bagno nella lunetta mediana si vede Leda distesa che accarezza i figli ed il cigno ciascuna delle due lunette laterali, più piccole, contiene un busto e funge da piedistallo a uno spavaldo putto che regge uno scudo con le sei palle di Casa Medici
BB_1938_title_recto: Study for the decoration of a wall. It was to have been divided by pilasters and cornices into six main compartments, the three below being higher than those above them. These three lower ones represent one scene, possibly the Death of Seneca in his Bath. In a lunette in the upper middle compartment we see Leda stretched out reclining, fondling her children and the swan. In the side compartment in each lunette is a bust, and above it a putto in dashing attitude supporting a shield with the Medici arms
BB_1938_text_recto: The style of this design is clearly of Pontormo's earlier, although not earliest, years. That being so, and considering the Medici crest, we may assume that the design was intended for one of the villas of these magnates that was being decorated towards 1520. The one that absorbed at that time the energies of some of the most famous Florentine artists then alive was Poggio a Cajano. There Andrea painted his Tribute to Caesar, and Franciabigio his Triumph of Cicero. There also Pontormo was to have had a leading part, and indeed did leave a lunette of almost unsurpassable beauty as decoration. What more likely than that the wall under this lunette was intended to contain the most signal deed in the life of Seneca, a hero scarcely less of a favourite in the Cinquecento than Cicero himself. The interpretation as Death of Seneca has found no favour but remains to me more satisfactory than the idea that it represents an athlete's bath. As the composition still looks as if intended for the great hall at Poggio a Cajano, the intention must have been to commemorate some heroic or glorious episode in Roman history.

BB_1961_title_recto: Studio di un nudo maschile con la mano destra che accenna in avanti, il braccio sinistro steso verso destra. Iscritto Pontormo
BB_1961_title_verso: Due monaci
BB_1938_title_recto: Study of a nude male with his right hand pointing forward, the left arm extended to the right
BB_1938_title_verso: Study of two monks
BB_1938_text_recto: From the Certosa period. Indeed it is likely that the two monk were done for the Feast of Emmaus originally painted for that monastery, but now in the Florence Academy. The older monk in our study appears on the left in the painting.
Cataloguer's Comments: Formerly Oppenheimer Collection.
Cataloguer's Question: Without stars in column H, but we don't find the item in BB_1903.

BB_1961_title_recto: Giovane nudo seduto, volto a sinistra, ma che guarda verso lo spettatore in basso, a destra, il medesimo con un mantello, su scala minore

BB_1938_text_recto: Recto probably made in connection with Poggio a Cajano while the drapery of the St. Jerome looks already Düreresque and is therefore somewhat later as is also the small altar-piece for which it served.

BB_1961_title_recto: Nudo che si piega come per portare o sorreggere un peso con ambedue le braccia nell'angolo inferiore destro un altro schizzo più debole per la parte superiore della medesima figura

BB_1961_title_recto: Giovane inginocchiato in profilo a sinistra
BB_1961_title_verso: Due mani appoggiate sopra un'asta e studio di una mano destra

BB_1938_text_recto: Very fine, and of about 1530. The kneeling figure may be a sketch for the Pygmalion in the Barberini Gallery.

BB_1961_title_recto: Uomo ammantato, con un grande cappello, seduto a un tavolo e studio separato della sua testa

BB_1961_title_recto: Studio per un cavallo visto di fronte (a sanguigna) e per una mano con le dita ripiegate in dentro (a carboncino)
BB_1938_title_recto: Study for horse seen frontally in red chalk and for hand with fingers bent inside in black chalk
BB_1938_text_recto: Probably of the Certosa period. A similar drawing, although somewhat later in date, representing a horse and a horse's head has been published in the Connoisseur for May, 1923, p. 5, and was then in the A.G.B. Russel Collection.

BB_1961_title_recto: La Vergine, seduta sui calcagni sopra un rialzo roccioso, si piega verso Sant'Elisabetta, mentre Gesù e San Giovannino giuocano in mezzo a loro: a sinistra una martire seminuda guarda sentimentalmente verso San Francesco inginocchiato col dorso verso di noi, che parla a lei additando San Giovannino
BB_1938_title_recto: The Virgin on rock platform, seated on her heels, stoops to St. Elizabeth, while between them the two Holy Children are at play. On the left a half-nude female martyr looks sentimentally at St. Francis, who kneels with his back towards us, talking to her of the infant Baptist, to whom he is pointing
BB_1938_text_recto: A very remarkable copy of this drawing exists in the Louvre Print Room under n. 1991, ascribed to Vanni. A singularly mannered composition of about 1530. It now seems to me at least ten yeas earlier.
Cataloguer's Comments: Inventory number handwritten.

BB_1961_title_recto: Gruppo di tre nudi maschili, due seduti, l'uno di fronte all'altro ed il terzo in piedi, visto da tergo
BB_1961_title_verso: Giovane con le braccia alzate
BB_1961_text_recto: Ambedue le facce, evidentemente collegate con Poggio a Caiano.

BB_1961_title_recto: Ritratto a mezza figura di giovane uomo dal naso lungo, in mantello e berretto, seduto a un tavolo in atto di scrivere
BB_1961_text_recto: L'iscrizione in calligrafia antica, in cima alla pagina, lo dice un ritratto del Duca Alessandro de' Medici per mano del Pontormo. Malgrado la qualità piuttosto trascurata e debole del disegno, non vedo ragioni per non accettarlo. Sia le fattezze sia il vestiario del personaggio corrispondono al "Ritratto del Duca Alessandro" nella Johnson Collection a Philapelphia. Il Pontormo deve aver fatto più di uno schizzo per i ritratti di Alessandro - un o grande e l'altro piccolo - che egli dipinse, secondo il Vasari, poco prima della morte di Alessandro nel 1537.
Cataloguer's Comments: Location handwritten, formerly private collection.

BB_1961_title_recto: Giovinetto a mezza figura
BB_1961_text_recto: Con ogni probabilità per la "Deposizione" di Santa Felicita (circa 1528).

BB_1938_title_recto: Reclining female and part of another woman, as well as a male head (fros S. Lorenzo)
BB_1938_title_verso: Capitals and vases
BB_1938_text_recto: This and the three following studies are considered by Bell (p. 76) and by Clapp (Dessins, pp. 298 and 299) as copies after the S. Lorenzo frescoes. The nudes like, for instance, the one in my 2261 seem to them too highly finished to be by Pontormo himself. If they are right, these copies must have been done by some close follower, perfectly conversant with his method as a draughtsman, like Bronzino or his pupil Allori.

Sono d'accordo con lui nel datarlo intorno al 1520 e nel riferirlo alla lunetta per Poggio a Caiano che non fu affrescata, ma per la quale ci sono rimasti gli schizzi.

BB_1961_title_recto: Due nudi, l'uno maschile e l'altro femminile, avvinti e con lo sguardo al cielo, in atto di ascendere, mentre altri nudi s'annidano sotto di loro

BB_1961_title_recto: Pilato seduto in trono sotto un baldacchino semicircolare fra due laici e due rabbini vestiti come monaci, si lava le mani sopra un bacile retto da un servo che mesce acqua da una brocca, mentre a destra un gruppo di guardie spinge avanti il Cristo
BB_1938_title_recto: Christ before Pilate. The Procurator of Judaea enthroned under a semicircular baldachin between two laymen and two rabbis dressed as monks, reaches forward to hold his hands over a basin held by a footman who poors water out of a pitcher. To the right guards bring in Our Lord. The scene is placed in the pretorium with door opening on a river and a bridge
BB_1938_text_recto: Dates from last years of Quattrocento and interesting as being at once intensely Botticellian and yet a drawing that few if any students would be tempted to assign to the master himself. But assistants who drew like this could easily have painted pictures like the Boston Madonna with the infant John and similar confections
Cataloguer's Comments: Drawing missing in BB 1903

BB_1961_title_recto: Alla presenza di astanti stupefatti, un Re si china a sollevare il lenzuolo funebre da due giovani che San giovanni Evangelista ha riportato in vita
BB_1938_title_recto: King lifting shroud off two young men whom St. John the evangelist has just brought to life
BB_1938_text_recto: Probably a tracing from a Botticellian drawing made for an embroidery. The original must have been companion to my 576.A

BB_1961_title_recto: Il giovane San Giovanni Evangelista abbraccia i piedi del Cristo morto (del quale null'altro si vede), mentre un Angelo stante regge un candelabro
BB_1938_title_recto: The young Evangelist embraces the feet of the dead Christ (of whom no more is visible), while an angel stands by holding a candelabrum
BB_1938_text_recto: Crudo but not unlikely a contemporary copy of an original of about 1490
BB_1903_text_recto: Crude, and of a quality scarcely as good as Carli's, whom it suggests, but not without a touch of the fascination adhering to Botticelli's even worst followers

BB_1961_title_recto: Cinque Apostoli che ascoltano una semplice donna genuflessa
BB_1938_title_recto: Five apostles listening to the supplication of a kneeling woman
BB_1938_text_recto: I used to ascribe this to "Amico di Sandro" but now see that is very close to Botticelli except in quality. It may be a studio copy of part of a composition by the master, dating from about 1490 and representing the Story of the Woman of Canaan (Matthew xv: 21-28)

BB_1961_title_recto: Ottantacinque fogli con illustrazioni per la Divina Commedia di Dante: per l'Inferno (eccettuati i canti I, IX, X, XII, XIII, XV, XVI ora nella Biblioteca Vaticana ed i Canti II, III, IV, V, VI, XI, XIV mai rinvenuti), per tutto il Purgatorio e per il Paradiso (meno i Canti XXXI e XXXIII)
BB_1961_text_recto: Secondo la mia opinione queste illustrazioni non possono essere anteriori al 1490, mentre la datazione suggerita da altri critici oscilla tra il 1479 ed il 1503
BB_1938_title_recto: Drawings in pen and ink, sketched in with the stile, to illustrate Dante's Divina Commedia
BB_1938_text_recto: The silver-point with which these designs were first drawn has with the rarest exceptions disappeared under the ink which has gone over it. The superiority of the illustrations that have remained without inking, as, for instance, those for Inferno XXX, Purgatorio VIII, and Paradiso XIX, is so manifest that one is tempted to ask whether B. himself did all the repassing with the pen or whether he left some of it to assistants. I belive that a detailed examination (for which there is no room here) would reveal the presence of more than one apprentice hand, but that the larger number were gone over by the master himself. Only one must not always expect it even of him that he will not slip occasionally into calligraphic ways of inking his silver-point and thereby lose something of the sparkle of the creative effort
Cataloguer's Comments: Inventory number missing in BB 1961, BB 1938, BB 1903

BB_1961_title_recto: Cinque Apostoli che ascoltano una semplice donna genuflessa

BB_1961_title_recto: Incoronazione della Vergine
BB_1961_text_recto: Conosco questo foglio solamente attraverso la riproduzione del Van Marle ed è possibile che i contorni a carboncino fossero del maestro. Nel suo aspetto presente, tuttavia, il disegno non può essere valutato come suo, sebbene sembri una prima idea per la parte superiore della "Incoronazione" degli Uffizi (n. 8362). Rispetto al dipinto, le posizioni degli Angeli e dei Cherubini appaiono qui invertite: nel disegno gli Angeli fanno corona dietro al Cristo ed alla Madonna e le teste dei Cherubini formano un arco sotto di loro, nel dipinto invece l'arco dei Cherubini è in alto e gli Angeli danzano in cerchio in basso
BB_1938_title_recto: Study for upper part of Coronation of the Virgin
BB_1938_text_recto: I know this sheet only from Van Marle's reproduction, and it remains possible that the outline was by the master himself. The sketch in its present aspect cannot, however, count as his although it would seem to represent an earlier idea for the upper part of the Uffizi Coronation, with the angels forming an arch over thepricipal figures and the cherubs below
Cataloguer's Comments: Inventory number missing in BB 1961 and BB 1938. Drawing missing in BB 1903

BB_1938_text_recto: There is an almost exact correspondence in action between this sketch and the painting on the back of a lady's profile of Botticelli's School formerly Miss Cohen's, now in the London N.G., 2084. The drawing, however, is of superior quality to the painting, and closer to Botticelli in feeling, although the technique is not quite that of a strict follower

BB_1961_title_recto: Testa di giovane, quasi in profilo a sinistra, alzata come in estatica contemplazione
BB_1938_title_recto: Head of youth looking up in adoration  almost in profile left
BB_1938_text_recto: I used to ascribe this to "Amico di Sandro", and if there was anything to justify , more than thirty-five years ago, when we knew even less than we do now, the demand for an artistic personality like "Amico's", it is this drawing with its vivacity of expression and daintiness of touch that might almost as well be Filippo's as Botticelli's. Indeed, it has required frequent return to the problem before I could solve it in favour of Botticelli. Of course it belongs to the earlier part of his career although scarcely the earliest
BB_1903_text_recto: This certainly is not by Botticelli to whom it is ascribed. It stands very close to Filippo, but I doubt whether it is by that master. Something in the vivacity of the expression, the daintiness of the feeling, and the quality of the touch, inclines me to the belief that the real author of this charming head may have been Amico.

BB_1961_title_recto: Madonna che sostiene sul suo ginocchio destro il Bambino Gesù, al quale un re prostrato bacia il piedino, mentre San Giuseppe si appoggia al suo bastone, con la testa fra le braccia

BB_1938_title_recto: Madonna bending to present on her right knee the Child, whose foot is being kissed by a prostrate king. Above to left Joseph leaning with head in his arms against wall
BB_1938_text_recto: Fragment of design for Adoration of Magi of which bits are my 561.B and 569.A
Cataloguer's Comments: Drawing missing in BB 1903

BB_1961_title_recto: Gruppo di uomini ammantati, uno genuflesso, uno piegato in avanti con le braccia incrociate sul petto, gli altri in piedi

BB_1938_text_recto: For same composition as my 561.A and 569.A
BB_1903_text_recto: Mr. Horne tells me that the original was a fresco that once existed in the Palazo Vecchio. Our copy, while accurate, does not seem to be by a pupil of Botticelli

BB_1961_title_recto: Figura allegorica dell'Abbondanza
BB_1938_title_recto: Study for allegorical figure of Abundance

BB_1961_title_recto: Figura femminile drappeggiata che sorregge uno scudo con la mano sinistra
BB_1938_title_recto: On back of early Adoration of Magi (no. 592). Draped female figure holding up a shield with l. hand
BB_1938_text_recto: Mr. Kenneth Clark, the director of the National Gallery, who was good enough to send me the photo, writes on May 12th, 1936: "It is done straight onto the wood without any priming or preparation. The head is full face but only roughly indicated. As far as I can see the right arm was originally raised and the thing hanging down at the figure's right side is part of the sleeve". Let me for my part add that in the reprodution I can discover nothing that Botticelli might not have done in the early years when he was groping his way between Fra Filippo, Pollajuolo and Verrocchio toward his own style
Cataloguer's Comments: Inventory number "592" is referred to the painting of "Adoration of Magi" in whose back is located the drawing. Drawing missing in BB 1903.

BB_1961_title_recto: Ritratto di un uomo barbuto stante, con le gambe incrociate, il braccio appoggiato a un tavolo, e lo sguardo volto a sinistra; iscritto in basso da mano più tarda «A B (Angelo Bronzino?) il suo ritratto di mano propria»
BB_1961_text_recto:
La qualità piuttosto inferiore mi ricorda i due disegni seguenti (Uffizi 6757 F, 6758 F) che solevo dare allo stesso Pontormo, ma sono forse tutti e tre disegni
giovanili del Bronzino. La posa ricorda il Moretto o il Moroni più che un artista fiorentino.
BB_1938_title_recto:
Sketch for portrait of bearded man standing with legs crossed
leaning and left arm resting on table and looking to Ieft. The inscription underneath, "AB il
suo ritratto di mano propria" (Angelo Bronzino ?), by later hand.
BB_1938_text_recto:
The rather inferior quality reminds me of the two following numbers (Uffizi 6757, 6758)
which I used to give to Pontormo himself. All three may turn out to be early Bronzinos. The
pose recalls Moretto or Moroni rather than a Florentine.
Cataloguer's Comments: No technique.

di mano molto più tarda: «Dicono del Pordenone dipinse a Piacenza in Chiesi de' Pri Zoccolanti» Nell'angolo inferiore di sinistra, in scrittura ancor più tarda, «Franciabigio»

Study for Saint James in the Last Supper of the Convento della Calza. Underneath study for shoulder, sleeve and hand of same figure. In right upper corner much later inscription: "Dicono Del Pordenone dipinse a Piacenza in Chiesi de' Pri
Zoccolanti." In lower Ieft corner "Franciabigio" in even later handwriting.

BB_1961_title_recto: Pietà
BB_1961_text_recto:
Copia fedele del disegno originale di Raffaellino per la «Pietà» di Monaco. La meticolosa finezza del tratteggio esclude per questo foglio la paternità del nostro; anche il tocco è troppo abbandonato per lui. Probabilmente
il copista era un seguace di Fra Bartolommeo. Le deviazioni dal dipinto sono interessanti e quasi tutte tendono ad un'interpretazione meno filippinesca e più peruginesca di quella che scopriamo nel dipinto. Perfino le pieghe
sono più peruginesche nel disegno. Esso sembra basarsi in parte sulla «Pietà» del
Perugino ora agli Uffizi dalla quale deriva anche la sua maggiore calma e relativamente maggiore compattezza. La data della «Pietà» di Monaco non può essere anteriore al 1490 ed è questa la data più antica che si possa assegnare al capolavoro del Perugino.
BB_1938_title_recto: Copy of original study for Garbo's Munich Pietà.
BB_1938_text_recto:
The minuteness and fineness of the hatching is certainly not Garbo's and the touch is too slack for him. Probably a faithful copy by a follower of Fra Bartolollomeo. The deviations from the painting are interesting, and nearly all tend toward a less Filippinesque and more Peruginesque phase of Garbo than we discover in the finished
picture. Based upon Perugino's Pietà now in the Uffizi,
our drawing partakes not only of its greater calm but of its relatively greater compactness. Even the folds are more Peruginesque than in the painting. The date of this last can, by
the way, be no earlier than 1490, the earliest date that may be assigned to Perugino's
above-mentioned masterpiece.

BB_1961_title_recto: Testa di donna con gli occhi abbassati verso destra
BB_1938_title_recto: Head of woman looking down to left.
BB_1903_title_recto: Head of Woman looking down.

BB_1961_title_recto: Testa di giovane ricciuto, dalla bocca dolce; braccio destro che tiene un sasso nella mano e mano sinistra
BB_1961_title_verso: San Rocco, fra Santa Caterina e Sant'Antonio Abate.
BB_1961_text_recto: Per gli altri disegni montati insieme a questo dal Vasari sul recto del foglio, vedi BB nn. 1276, 1276 A, 1276 B.
BB_1961_text_verso:
Sembra uno studio per il trittico con i medesimi Santi nella Chiesa di San Felice
a Firenze, dipinto nella bottega del Botticelli. È cosi vicino al Garbo nella sua
maniera botticelliana da rendere probabile che sia di lui. Per l'altro disegno montato
insieme vedi BB n. 1275.
BB_1938_title_recto:
Head of curly haired youth with sweet looking mouth and
characteristic expression. Also an arm with stone in hand.
BB_1938_title_verso:
St. Roch between St. Catherine and Anthony Abbot. Highly coloured.
St. Roch in a separate panel. All within a frame drawn in bistre.
BB_1938_text_verso:
Probably done in
preparation for the triptych in S. Felice at Florence painted in Botticelli's studio. So close to Garbo in his  Botticellian manner as to make it probable that it is by him. For
other drawings framed in with these by Vasari on both recto and verso see my 1275,
1276, 1276A, and 1276B.
BB_1903_title_recto: Head of curly-haired Youth. Sweet look and mouth. Characteristic expression. Also an arm with stone in hand.
Cataloguer's Question: Only verso was former 571...how can I note it?

BB_1961_title_recto:
Due foglietti montati insieme dal Vasari:
a) Due mani femminili, delle quali la sinistra regge un bacile
b) Due mani ed una manica
BB_1961_text_recto: All'attribuzione vasariana a Fra Filippo fu sostituita quella al Botticelli, ma la forma delle mani, la qualità dei contorni, la tecnica disegnativa bastano a dimostrare che sono studi di Raffaellino del Garbo nella sua fase botticelliana. 1957: le mani sul foglietto a) sono studi per la Madonna nel «Tondo Pucci».
BB_1938_title_recto: Two sheets with studios or hands.
BB_1938_text_recto: Ascribed to Botticelli, but the forms, the contours, and the technique alone would induce me to believe that they are by Garbo in his Botticellian phase. Actually two of them are the hands of the Madonna in Garbo's Pieta at Munich.
BB_1903_title_recto: Two sheets with studies of hands.
BB_1903_text_recto:
Ascribed to Botticelli, but the forms, the contours, and
the technique induce me to believe that they are by Raffaellino in his Botticellian phase.

BB_1961_title_verso: Un piede ed uno stinco e parte di un'architrave.
BB_1961_text_recto: il giovane è lo stesso che appare in BB n. 843 verso, ma là è volto a sinistra e più soave. Attribuito a Filippino Lippi, ma nota il caratteristico tratteggio a zig-zag.
BB_1938_title_recto: Youth in full armour but bare headed, seated holding a sword across his knees.
BB_1938_title_verso: A foot and shin, and part of an impost on green ground.
BB_1938_text_recto:
The same as the youth in armour on David's British Museum sheet ascribed to Masaccio (my 843 verso),
but suaver, and turned to Ieft. Characteristic
zigzag hatching.
BB_1903_title_recto: Youth in full armour but bare headed, sitting, holding a sword across his knees.
BB_1903_text_recto: The same as the youth in armour on David's British Museum sheet ascribed to Masaccio (N. 843 verso), but suaver, and turned to left. Characteristic zigzag hatching. Ascribed to Filippino.

BB_1961_title_recto: Due figure ammantate
BB_1938_title_recto: Two draped figures.
BB_1938_text_recto: Catalogued as "unknown".
BB_1903_title_recto: Two draped figures.
BB_1903_title_verso: Catalogued as "unknown".

BB_1961_title_recto: Uomo seduto Studio dal vero per un ritratto
BB_1961_text_recto: La tecnica ed il carattere sono inconfondibilmente di David. Il tipo richiama più di una testa nella «Deposizione» di Ognissanti. Uno schizzo molto simile si trova al Louvre (BB n. 859). Già attribuito a Masaccio, quindi a Filippino Lippi.
BB_1938_title_recto: Seated man, study from life for a portrait.
BB_1938_text_recto: The technique and the character are unmistakably David's. The type recalls more than one head in the Ognissanti Deposition. A closely similar sketch is in the Louvre (my 859). Ascribed formerly to Masacoio, and now to Filippino.
BB_1903_title_recto: A seated Man, study from life for a portrait.
BB_1903_text_recto: The technique and the character are unmistakably David's. The type recalls more than one head in the Ognissanti Deposition. A closely similar sketch is in the Louvre (No. 859). Ascribed formerly to Masacoio, and now to Filippino.

BB_1961_title_recto: Copia dei rilievi dell'Arco di Costantino a Roma
BB_1961_title_verso: Copia dall'Arco di Traiano ad Ancona.
BB_1938_title_recto: Study after reliefs and medallions on the Arch of Constantine.
BB_1938_title_verso: Study of the Arch of Trajan at Ancona.
BB_1938_text_recto: ascribed to Domenico.
BB_1903_title_recto: Study after reliefs and medallions on the Arch of Costantine.

BB_1961_title_recto: Figura seduta, ammantata
BB_1938_title_recto: Draped seated figure.
BB_1938_text_recto: Ascribed to Filippino.
BB_1903_title_recto: Draped seated firure.

BB_1961_title_recto: Nudo maschile

BB_1938_text_recto: of same type as next, and like that ascribed to Filippino.

BB_1903_title_verso: Hastily sketched girl's head.

BB_1961_title_recto: Due nudi virili ed uomo appoggiato di lato, in posa meditabonda
BB_1961_text_recto: Sia le pose, sia il modello sono gli stessi che appaiono in BB n. 844, un foglio del British Museum attribuito al Castagno. Catalogato come Filippino Lippi.
BB_1938_title_recto:
Two nudes in same model and attitude as the nude in David's British Museum sheet ascribed
to Castagno (my 844).
BB_1938_text_recto: Also the same meditating figure as in that sheet, but leaning instead of sitting. Catalogued as Filippino's.
BB_1903_title_recto: Two Nudes in same model and attitude as the nude in David's British Museum sheet ascribed to Castagno.
BB_1903_text_recto: Also the same meditating figure as in that sheet, but leaning instead of sitting. Catalogued as Filippino's.

BB_1961_title_recto: Due nudi, uno dei quali per un Cristo in croce
BB_1961_text_recto: È attribuito a Filippino Lippi, ma il disegno delle gambe e il tratteggio sono di David.
BB_1938_title_recto: Two nudes, one of them to serve as a Christ on the Cross.
BB_1938_text_recto: Drawing of legs and hatching David's, but ascribed to Filippino. The legs of Christ curiously like those in the Crucifixion at S. Apollonia.
BB_1903_title_recto: Two nudes, one of them to serve as a Christ on the Cross.
BB_1903_text_recto: Drawing of legs and hatching David's, but ascribed to Filippino.

BB_1938_title_recto: Youth in profile to right-same model as youth on my 772.
BB_1938_title_verso:
Two sketches in
same technique of lower part of profile.

BB_1903_title_recto: A Youth in profile to right-same model as youth on David's Berlin sheet.

BB_1961_title_recto: Giovane uomo ammantato
BB_1961_title_verso: Parte di una testa di donna, con lo sguardo alzato verso destra.
BB_1961_text_recto: è attribuito al Pesellino, ma le pieghe ed il tratteggio sono di David.
BB_1938_title_recto: Draped youth.
BB_1938_title_verso: Part of woman's head, looking up to right on greenish ground.
BB_1938_text_recto: folds and hatching David's, but ascribed to Pesellino.
BB_1903_title_recto: A draped Youth.
BB_1903_title_verso: Part of woman's head, looking up to right on greenish ground.
BB_1903_text_recto: folds and hatching David's, but ascribed to Pesellino.

BB_1961_title_recto: Giovane seduto, quasi in profilo a sinistra, con lo sguardo sull'asta che tiene davanti a sé con ambedue le mani
BB_1961_text_recto: Attribuito al Pesellino, ma il tipo, le pieghe, la mano sinistra, sono caratteristiche di David.
BB_1938_title_recto: Youth lightly seated in profile to left, looking at a staff which he holds before him with both hands.
BB_1938_text_recto: Ascribed to Pesellino but the type, the folds, the left hand are characteristic of David.
BB_1903_title_recto: A Youth lightly seated in profile to left, looking at a staff which he holds before him with both hands.
BB_1903_text_recto: The type, the folds, the left hand are characteristic of David. Ascribed to Pesellino.

BB_1961_title_recto: Giovane uomo dalle fattezze ordinarie, ma dall'espressione sentimentale, in piedi, con la mano destra appoggiata ad un'asta
BB_1961_text_recto: Di nuovo attribuito al Pesellino, ma i panneggi ed il tipo lo caratterizzano come opera di David. Confrontatelo con il giovane che avanza verso lo spettatore nell'affresco della «Visitazione» a Santa Maria Novella.
BB_1938_title_recto: Rough-featured but sentimental-looking youth, standing with his right hand on a staff.
BB_1938_text_recto: Again ascribed to Pesellino, but his draperies and his type stamp him as David's. He should be compared with the youth seen coming forward in the fresco of the Visitation at S. Maria Novella.
BB_1903_title_recto: Rough-featured but sentimental-looking Youth, standing with his right hand on a staff.
BB_1903_text_recto: Again ascribed to Pesellino, but his draperies and his type stamp him as David's. He should be compared with the youth seen coming forward in the fresco of the Visitation at S. Maria Novella.

BB_1961_title_recto: Uomo ammantato seduto, con un tridente nella mano destra, volto verso sinistra
BB_1938_title_recto: A draped man seated, turning to left and pointing with his left hand to left. In his right hand a fire-shovel.
BB_1938_text_recto: Also ascribed to Pesellino.
BB_1903_title_recto: A draped Man seated, turning to left and pointing with his left hand to left. In his right hand a fire-shovel.
BB_1903_text_recto: Also ascribed to Pese!lino, but everything bespeaks David as the author.

BB_1961_title_recto: Giovane uomo ammantato, in piedi
BB_1961_title_correction: Verso: bust of man without head.
BB_1961_text_recto: ricorda i modelli di BB nn. 786 e 787, ed ancor più il giovane nella «Visitazione» a Santa Maria Novella, menzionata a proposito di BB n. 789.
BB_1938_title_recto: Draped youth standing.
BB_1938_text_recto: Same character as in my 786 and 787, and even more like the youth in the Visitation mentioned under my 789.
BB_1903_title_recto: A draped Youth standing.
BB_1903_text_recto: Same character as in my 786 and 787, and even more like the youth in the Visitation mentioned under my 789.

BB_1961_title_recto: Nudo in posizione semi-seduta, con le braccia legate dietro
BB_1938_title_recto: Nude, in half-seated posture, with his arms tied behind him.
BB_1938_text_recto: Clipped.
BB_1903_title_recto: A Nude, in half-seated posture, with his arms tied behind him.

BB_1961_title_recto: Angelo adorante, genuflesso verso destra e schizzi per un Gesù Bambino
BB_1961_title_verso: Figura ammantata vista da tergo.
BB_1961_text_recto: Questo foglio è attribuito al Verrocchio, ma la figura ammantata sul verso è certamente di David. Gli schizzi a penna, sul recto, hanno il tratteggio tipico della scuola del Ghirlandajo e la mano dell'Angelo ha le due dita mediane piegate in giù secondo un vezzo caratteristico di David (cfr. BB n. 788). L'Angelo ci offre così un punto di partenza per lo studio di altri disegni a penna di David.
BB_1938_title_recto: Angel in profile to right, kneeling in adoration; also two children.
BB_1938_title_verso: Draped figure seen from the back.
BB_1938_text_recto: This sheet is ascribed to Verrocchio, but the draped figure is certainly David's. The pen-sketches have the Ghirlandajesque stroke and hatching, and the angel's hand has the two middle fingers bent down in a way that  characterizes David (cf. my 788). The angel thus offers us a starting-point for the study of other drawings with the pen by David.
BB_1903_title_recto: An Angel in profile to right, kneeling in adoration; also two children.
BB_1903_title_verso: A draped figure seen from the back.
BB_1903_text_recto: This sheet is ascribed to Verrocchio, but the draped figure is certainly David's. The pen-sketches have the Ghirlandajesque stroke and hatching, and the angel's hand has the two middle fingers bent down in a way that  characterizes David (cf. my 788). The angel thus offers us a starting-point for the study of other drawings with the pen by David.

BB_1961_title_recto: Due studi per un San Giovanni Evangelista in una Crocifissione
BB_1961_title_verso: Una figura stante ed una seduta. Probabilmente per la medesima composizione.
BB_1938_title_recto: Two studies for Evangelist in a Crucifixion.
BB_1938_title_verso: One standing and one seated figure. Probably for same composition.

BB_1961_title_recto: Testa di giovane donna dal tipo fiammingo e due nudi virili
BB_1961_text_recto: Attribuito a Filippino Lippi, ma i nudi ripetono quelli in BB n. 784.
BB_1938_title_recto: Head of young woman of Flemish type and two nudes of the character of those in my 784.
BB_1938_text_recto: Ascribed to Filippino.
BB_1903_title_recto: Head of Young Woman, and two Nudes of the character of those in No. 784.

BB_1938_title_recto: Youthful nude lying on his back asleep.

BB_1938_title_recto: Stately heavily draped young man with a hand held up.

BB_1961_title_recto: Figura seminuda, col solo mantello che dal collo scende dietro le spalle e gira intorno ai fianchi, in corsa verso sinistra, volta indietro, con un arco in mano
BB_1938_title_recto: Half draped figure running to Ieft but looking back  with bow in hand.
BB_1938_text_recto: I used to assign this sketch to the school of Filippino while now it seems to me in every respect characteristic for David. Same hand as my 782.

BB_1961_title_recto: Giovane donna piegata in avanti, in profilo a sinistra

BB_1938_text_recto: Drapery and hands characteristic of David, but ascribed to Filippino.
BB_1903_title_recto: Young Woman leaning over, in profile to Ieft.
BB_1903_text_recto: Drapery and hands characteristic of David, but ascribed to Filippino.

BB_1961_title_recto: Tre figure ammantate, quella in mezzo, addormentata, con la testa appoggiata ad una tavola
BB_1961_title_verso: Due figure ammantate.
BB_1961_text_recto: Il loro tipo ricorre spesso nei dipinti di David ed a lui accenna il tratteggio ed il sistema delle pieghe, ma la vecchia attribuzione è al Pollajuolo.
BB_1938_title_recto: Three draped figures, of whom the middle one asleep, with his head resting on a table.
BB_1938_title_verso: Two draped figures.
BB_1938_text_recto: Of a type occurring frequently in David's paintings. The folds and hatching point to him also, but the attribution is to Piero Pollajuolo.
BB_1903_title_recto: Three draped figures, of whom the middle one asleep, with his head resting on a table, is of a type ocdtrring frequently in David's paintings. The folds and hatching point to him also, but the attribution is to Piero Pollajuolo.

BB_1961_title_recto: Uomo che punta l'indice destro in basso, avvolto come in un toga, fra due giovani con i mantelli buttati sulla spalla sinistra

BB_1961_title_recto: Frate
BB_1961_title_verso: Giovane che legge, in ampi paludamenti.
BB_1961_text_recto: attribuito al Botticelli, ma le pieghe, il tratteggio e la tecnica sono di David e la mano è esattamente uguale a quella del giovane che legge, in BB n. 813 verso.
BB_1938_title_recto: A Friar.
BB_1938_title_verso: Heavily draped youth reading.
BB_1938_text_recto: ascribed to Botticelli, but the folds, the hatching, and the technique are David's. The hand is exactly like that of the youth reading on the back of my 813.
BB_1903_title_recto: Friar.
BB_1903_text_recto: ascribed to Botticelli, but the folds, the hatching, and the technique are David's. The hand is exactly like that of the youth reading on the back of my 813.

BB_1961_title_recto: Testa di un giovane
BB_1961_title_verso: Studio di un braccio destro.
BB_1961_text_recto: Non è certamente di Domenico, al quale è attribuito; potrebbe essere opera di David del tempo degli affreschi in San Martino Buonomini, a meno che non sia addirittura di chi lo aiutò in quel lavoro.
BB_1938_title_recto: Head of a youth.
BB_1938_title_verso: Study of a right arm.
BB_1938_text_recto: It certainly is not Domenico's as ascribed, and is pwbably David's in the phase that we find him in at the Buonomini di S. Martino. On the other hand, it is just possible that it is by his assistant in that work.
BB_1903_title_recto: Head of a Youth.
BB_1903_text_recto: It certainly is not Domenico's as ascribed, and is pwbably David's in the phase that we find him in at the Buonomini di S. Martino. On the other hand, it is just possible that it is by his assistant in that work.

BB_1903_title_recto: A draped figure standing, and a sleeping Nude reclining.

BB_1961_title_recto: Due nudi, l'uno seduto e l'altro in piedi, visto da tergo (cfr BB n 825)
BB_1961_title_verso: Tre nudi stanti, in atteggiamenti diversi.

BB_1938_title_verso: Three nudes standing in various attitudes.
BB_1903_title_recto: Two nudes, one seated, and the other seen from the back, standing. Compare with No. 825.

BB_1961_title_recto: Busto di giovane uomo dal volto glabro, con un lucco dalle pieghe pollajuolesche
BB_1961_text_recto: È attribuito al Pollajuolo probabilmente a causa del lucco, ma è evidentemente ghirlandaiesco e la tecnica rende plausibile la paternità di David.
BB_1938_title_recto: Portrait bust of smooLh-faced man, wearing lucco of Pollajuolesque folds.
BB_1938_text_recto:
Ascribed to Pollajuolo probably because of the lucco. But it is clearly Ghirlandajesque, and the
technique makes it probable that its author was David.
BB_1903_title_recto: Portrait bust of a smooth-faced Man, wearing a lucco of Pollajuolesque folds, for which reason, perhaps, it is ascribed to Pollajuolo.
BB_1903_text_recto: But it is clearly Ghirlandajesque, and the technique makes it probable that its author was David.

BB_1961_title_recto: Due figure ammantate, una seduta e l'altra stante
BB_1961_title_verso: Due giovani seduti, in ampi mantelli; quello a sinistra in atto di leggere, quello a destra nella stessa posa d.i una figura in BB n. 844.
BB_1961_text_recto: Attribuito a Masolino, ma il tratteggio, il disegno dei pied.i ed i caratteri generali non lasciano dubbio che questo foglio appartenga alla nostra serie.
BB_1938_title_recto: Two draped figures, one sitting and the other standing.
BB_1938_title_verso: Two draped youthful figures seated, the one on the left reading, and the one on the right reclining in the exact attitude of a figure on David's British Museum sheet ascribed to Castagno (my 844).
BB_1938_text_recto: Ascribed to Masolino, but the hatching, the drawing of the feet, and the general character leave no doubt that this sheet is of our series.
BB_1903_title_recto: Two draped figures, one sitting and the other standing.
BB_1903_title_verso: Two draped youthful figures seated, the one on the left reading, and the one on the right reclining in the exact attitude of a figure on David's British Museum sheet ascribed to Castagno (my 844).

BB_1961_title_verso: Giovane ammantato e la palma d'una mano.
BB_1961_text_recto: questo e BB n. 859 M sono i due fogli, nel gruppo da me ricomposto, che risultano attribuiti a David da qualcuno in tempo passato. Malgrado la scritta e malgrado l'identità di questi tre uomini con quelli in BB n. 8oo verso, il disegno appariva catalogato come Masolino ed ora come «Bottega di Filippino Lippi».
BB_1961_text_verso: il disegno della mano è caratteristico di David.
BB_1938_title_recto: Three draped figures, almost identical with those on the back of my 800.
BB_1938_title_verso: Draped youth and the inside of an open hand.
BB_1938_text_recto: it would thus seem that the attribution to David of one at least of this series of drawings had already occurred to some one before. Catalogued as Masolino's.
BB_1938_text_verso: This hand is most characteristic of David.
BB_1903_title_recto: Three draped figures, almost identical with those on the back of No. 800. In the lower right hand corner we read, in no very ancient hand, the word "David."
BB_1903_title_verso: A draped Youth and the inside of an open hand.
