BB_1903_title_recto: Study for drapery of Virgin in Louvre Visitation.

BB_1961_title_recto: Disegno per un'Incoronazione
BB_1961_text_recto: La parte superiore differisce dal dipinto di Narni nell'avere meno figure. Questo disegno può essere stato inteso per quell'opera. Altrettanto dicasi per BB nn. 862 B e 889, sebbene con minore probabilità. Tutti  e tre sono delle varianti interessanti del tema e molto più felici del quadro d'altare eccessivamente affollato.
BB_1938_title_recto: Design for a Coronation.
BB_1938_text_recto: The upper part differs from the painting at Narni in having fewer figures. This design may have been intended to serve for that work. So may have my 862B and 889 although less likely. All three are interesting variants on the theme, and much happier than the crowded altar-piece.
BB_1903_title_recto: Design for a Coronation.
BB_1903_text_recto: The upper part differing from the painting at Narni only in having fewer figures, and from the lower part in having many more. Nevertheless this design may have been intended to serve for that work.

BB_1961_title_recto: Natività della Vergine
BB_1961_text_recto: Rapido schizzo per l'affresco nel Coro di Santa Maria Novella, a Firenze.
BB_1938_title_recto: Rapid sketch for the fresco representing the Birth of the Virgin.
BB_1903_title_recto: Rapid sketch for the fresco representing the Birth of the Virgin.

BB_1961_title_recto: Busto di giovane donna, vista di fronte
BB_1938_title_recto: Bust of young woman, seen full-face.
BB_1938_text_recto: Probably the study for a portrait of which a contemporary copy now belongs to Mrs. Payson of New York.
BB_1903_title_recto: Bust of young woman, seen full-face.

BB_1961_title_recto: Busto di giovane donna con berretto aderente e lunghi capelli sciolti
BB_1938_title_recto: Bust of young woman in close-fitting cap and long straggling hair.
BB_1938_text_recto: I was never happy over the attribution of this head to Domenico Ghirlandaio. When Fischel some twenty years later gave it to Perugino I accepted it without hesitation. The fact that most of us could confuse Ghirlandajo with Perugino in such an obvious case as this proves how close they stood to each other in maturity and points to a common influence to which they were submitted in earlier years. That influence must have been exerted by Verroochio and more still by the young Leonardo.
BB_1903_title_recto: Bust of Young Man, in close-fitting cap and long straggling hair.

BB_1961_title_recto: Busto di vecchio glabro, in profilo a destra
BB_1938_title_recto: Bust of oldish man, in profile to right.
BB_1903_title_recto: Bust of oldish Man, in profile to right.

BB_1961_title_recto: Santo che scrive in un libro e, a destra, su scala minore, rapido schizzo di vescovo, pure scrivente, ambedue eretti
BB_1961_text_recto: Attribuito al Garbo, ma il tratto, il chiaro-scuro sono inconfondibilmente di Domenico Ghirlandajo. Disegno importante dei suoi primi anni.
BB_1938_title_recto: Saint writing in a book, and to Ieft smaller and more spirited figure of a bishop, also writing, both erect.
BB_1938_text_recto: Ascribed to Garbo, but the stroke, the hatching and the forms are unmistakably Domenico Ghirlandajo's. An important drawing from his earlier years.
BB_1903_title_recto: A Saint writing in a book, and to Ieft smaller and more spirited figure of a Bishop, also writing, both erect.
BB_1903_text_recto: Ascribed to Garbo, but the stroke, the hatching and the forms are unmistakably Domenico's. An important drawing from his earlier years.

BB_1961_title_recto: Profilo verso sinistra di gentildonna in piedi, con le mani raccolte sul grembo e la testa appena accennata
BB_1961_text_recto: Studio per l'affresco della «Nascita del Battista» nel Coro di Santa Maria Novella a Firenze.
BB_1938_title_recto: Study for figure of a great lady in the fresco of the Birth of the Baptist at S. Maria Novella.
BB_1903_title_recto: Study for figure of a great Lady in the fresco of the Birth of the Baptist at S. Maria Novella.

BB_1961_title_recto: Imposizione del nome al Battista
BB_1961_text_recto: Schizzo preparatorio per l'affresco nel Coro di Santa Maria Novella a Firenze.
BB_1938_title_recto: Study for the fresco representing Zacharias naming the infant John.
BB_1903_title_recto: Study for the fresco representing Zacharias naming the infant John.

BB_1961_title_recto: Vescovo che battezza una persona anziana; sullo scalino c'è una scritta, di mano quasi contemporanea, con le parole «Domenico del Grillandajo»
BB_1961_text_recto: Studio per l'affresco con «Papa Silvestro che battezza Costantino Imperatore» eseguito intorno al 1475 da Domenico e David Ghirlandajo nella Biblioteca Vaticana ed oggi perduto. Il disegno del coro forse è una reminiscenza dell'antica Basilica romana di San Pietro.
BB_1938_title_recto: Bishop baptizing a person of ripe years. Inscribed on step, in almost contemporary hand, with the words "Domenico del Grillandaio ".
BB_1938_text_recto: The choir is probably a memory picture of old St. Peter's.
BB_1903_title_recto: A Bishop baptizing a person of ripe years.

BB_1961_title_recto: Testa di giovane uomo vista di fronte
BB_1961_text_recto: Attribuito a «Ecole Fiorentine, xve Siècle», ma attribuito a Domenico Ghirlandajo dal Morelli.
BB_1938_title_recto: Head of man, seen full-face.
BB_1938_text_recto: Ascribed "Roole Florentine, XV6 Siecle", but attributed to Domenico Ghirlandajo by Morelli. Fischel ascribes this head to Perugino. It is one that might be by that follower of ·Verrocchio's, as well as by Credi. I still believe that it was most probably done by Domenico Ghirlandajo.
BB_1903_title_recto: Head of man, seen full-face.

BB_1961_title_recto: Figura acefala drappeggiata, vista di profilo a sinistra
BB_1938_title_recto: Heavily draped headless figure in profile to left.
BB_1938_text_recto: Attributed to Fra Filippo.

BB_1961_title_recto: Testa di un giovane, volto leggermente a sinistra con capelli ricciuti, sotto un berretto
BB_1961_text_recto: Non classificato, ma attribuito correttamente dal Morelli.
BB_1938_title_recto: Head of a young man, turning slightly to left, with curling hair under a cap.
BB_1938_text_recto: Not classified, but correctly ascribed by Morelli. It is not quite of Domenico Ghirlandajo's best quality, although probably belonging to the period of his best activity - the frescoes at S. Trinita, etc.- the period in which he comes closest to Botticelli. There is in this head a something or the last-named master which may tempt students to ascribe it to the painter who stands, as it were, between Domenico Ghirlandajo and Botticelli, I mean Alunno di Domenico, others may think of Pilippino.
BB_1903_title_recto: Head of a Young Man, turning slightly to right, curling hair under a cap.
BB_1903_text_recto: Not classified, but rightly ascribed by Morelli. It is not quite of Ghirlandajo's best quality, although probably belonging to the period of his best activity -the frescoes at S. Trinita, &c.

BB_1961_title_recto: Figura ammantata vista da tergo
BB_1961_text_recto: Attribuito a scuola fiorentina, ma iscritto «Domen. Grillan.» da mano piuttosto posteriore.
BB_1938_title_recto: Draped figure seen from the back.
BB_1938_text_recto: Attributed to Florentine School but inscribed "Doen. Grillan .... " in somewhat later hand.

BB_1961_title_recto: Studio per un'Incoronazione
BB_1961_text_recto: Non facilmente uno schizzo per il dipinto di Narni, col quale non ha in comune che il soggetto. Il disegno però è della medesima data circa della pittura. La qualità, nell'insieme, è eccellente (vedi BB nn. 877 e 862 B).
BB_1938_title_recto: Study for a Coronation.
BB_1938_text_recto: Scarcely to be regarded as a sketch for the painling at Narni, with which it has in common nothing but the subject. The drawing, however, is of about the same elate as tho picture. The quality, on the whole, is excellent. See my 877, and 862B.
BB_1903_title_recto: Study for a Coronation.
BB_1903_text_recto: Scarcely to be regarded as a sketch for the painting at Narni, with which it has in common nothing but the subject. The drawing, however, is of about the same date as the picture. The quality, on the whole, is excellent.

BB_1961_title_recto: Santo (Francesco?) che appare in una sala capitolare dove un frate sta predicando
BB_1961_title_verso: Disegno lineare più sommario dello stesso soggetto.
BB_1961_text_recto: È uno dei disegni a penna più ammirevoli di Domenico, rapido, fermo e chiaro.
BB_1938_title_recto: Saint (Francis?) appearing in a Chapter Hall, where a monk is delivering a lecture.
BB_1938_title_verso: More summary outlining of the same subject.
BB_1938_text_recto: Probably for a fresco representing Francis appearing to the Brethren at Aries, in which case we may assume that Domenico Ghirlandajo painted or at least was invited to paint the Franciscan legend in some cloister of the order. One of Domenico's most admirable pen-drawings, spirited, firm, and clear.
BB_1903_title_recto: A Saint (Francis?) appearing in a Chapter Hall, where a Monk is delivering a lecture.
BB_1903_title_verso: More summary outlining of the same subject.
BB_1903_text_recto: One of Domenico's most admirable pen-drawings, spirited, firm, and clear.

BB_1961_title_recto: Due giovani in panneggi fluttuanti
BB_1938_title_recto: Two young women in fluttering draperies. Excellent and no doubt after the antique.
BB_1903_title_recto: Two young women in fluttering draperies. Excellent.

BB_1961_title_recto: Testa di vecchio
BB_1961_text_recto: Studio per il «Vecchio col nipotino» del Louvre (n. 1322), forse schizzato mentre il soggetto dormiva o più probabilmente era da poco spirato.
BB_1938_title_recto: Head of old man.
BB_1938_text_recto: Study for the Louvre picture of an old man and his little grandson. It must have been sketched while the subject was asleep or more likely just expired. In either case it must have been done in one sitting, and  that not a long one. This gives a measure of the rapidity with which the Renaissance masters drew, and makes one wonder what has become of the thousands of sketches every one of them must have made in the course of his career. Michelangelo burned sackfuls periodically.
Cataloguer's Comments: No stars but no item in BB1903.

BB_1961_title_recto: L'apparizione dell'Angelo a Zaccaria nel Tempio
BB_1961_text_recto: Schizzo per l'affresco nel Coro di Santa Maria Novella a Firenze.
BB_1938_title_recto: Study for the fresco representing Zacharias in the Temple.
BB_1903_title_recto: Study for the fresco representing Zacharias in the Temple.

BB_1961_title_recto: Cristo in Gloria e Santi
BB_1961_text_recto: Studio per la pala del 1492, con «Cristo in Gloria e Santi», nel Palazzo dei Priori a Volterra.
BB_1938_title_recto: Study for the Volterra altar-piece.
BB_1903_title_recto: Study for the Volterra altar-piece.

BB_1961_title_recto: Busto di uomo con cappello tondo, volto leggermente a sinistra
BB_1961_text_recto: Schizzo per uno dei quattro Dignitari nell'angolo in basso a sinistra dell'affresco a Santa Maria Novella a Firenze, rappresentante «Zaccaria al Tempio». Non ho veduto il disegno, ma dalla fotografia sembra un originale che può essere stato ripassato sopra più tardi.

BB_1961_title_recto: Testa di vecchia
BB_1961_text_recto: Studio per l'ultima donna a sinistra nell'affresco della «Natività della Vergine» in Santa Maria Novella a Firenze.
BB_1938_title_recto: Bust of elderly female.
BB_1938_text_recto: Study for the one next to the last in the group to the Ieft in the fresco of the Birth of the Virgin.
BB_1903_title_recto: Bust of elderly Female.
BB_1903_text_recto: Study for the one next to the last in the group to the Ieft in the fresco of the Birth of the Virgin.

BB_1961_title_recto: Cattura di una Principessa
BB_1938_title_recto: Capture of a Princess.

BB_1961_title_recto: Martirio di una Santa
BB_1961_text_recto: Questo ed il disegno precedente sono di uno stretto seguace che ricorda l'autore del Codex Escurialensis (vedi BB n. 893 C).
BB_1938_title_recto: Martyrdom of female saint.
BB_1938_text_recto: This and last by a close follower like the one who did the sketches in the Codex Escurialensis (see my 8930).

BB_1961_title_recto: Taccuino di schizzi a penna dei monumenti romani antichi
BB_1938_title_recto: Reproduced and commented in an exemplary fashion by Hermann Egger with the assistance of Christian Hiilsen and Adolf Michaelis, Vienna, 1906.

BB_1961_title_recto: Copia da uno schizzo originale di Domenico forse per il «Bruto» in Palazzo Vecchio
BB_1938_title_recto: Copy after an original sketch, for the Brutus, perhaps, in the Palazzo Vecchio.
BB_1938_text_recto: Catalogued as ''Maniera di Filippino."
BB_1903_title_recto: Copy after an original sketch, for the Brutus perhaps, in the Palazzo Vecchio.

BB_1961_title_recto: Santo vescovo fra due Angeli
BB_1961_title_verso: Studi anatomici.
BB_1961_text_recto: Opera di ignoto aiuto di Domenico Ghirlandajo.
BB_1938_title_recto: Bishop saint between two angels.
BB_1938_title_verso: Anatomical studies.
BB_1938_text_recto: By an unknown assistant of Domenico Ghirlandajo.
BB_1903_title_recto: St. Nicholas between two Angels.
BB_1903_title_verso: Anatomical studies.
BB_1903_text_recto: By some unknown and feeble assistant of Domenico.

BB_1961_title_recto: Monaco inginocchiato a destra e due schizzi di un uomo, visto da tergo, che alza la mano destra e si volta a sinistra
BB_1961_text_recto: Sembra della cerchia di Domenico Ghirlandajo, ma potrebbe anche non essere fiorentino.
BB_1938_title_recto: Monk kneeling to right, and two sketches of a man lifting up his right hand and turning to Ieft.
BB_1938_text_recto: Seems to be of Domenico Ghirlandajo's following, although not indisputably Florentine.
BB_1903_title_recto: A Monk kneeling to right, and two sketches of a man lifting up his right hand and turning to Ieft.
BB_1903_text_recto: Seems to be of Domenico Ghirlandajo's following, although not indisputably Florentine.

BB_1961_title_recto: Due putti, uno volto verso lo spettatore, l'altro visto da tergo; a sinistra la gamba sinistra e il piede di un terzo fanciullo
BB_1961_text_recto: Attribuito ad ignoto italiano del XVIII secolo.
BB_1938_title_recto: Two studies for putti, one facing us and one seen from behind.
BB_1938_text_recto: Attributed to unknown Italian 18th century.

BB_1961_title_recto: Danza di Salomè
BB_1961_title_verso: Di mano posteriore.
BB_1961_text_recto: Copia di uno stretto seguace di Domenico e David Ghirlandajo, dall'affresco nel coro di Santa Maria Novella a Firenze, o piuttosto da un cartone di Domenico per l'affresco.
BB_1938_title_recto: Copy by close follower of Domenico Ghirlandajo and David of the fresco in S. Maria Novella representing the Dance of Herodias.
BB_1938_title_verso: By later hand.

BB_1961_title_recto: Profilo di giovane dai lunghi capelli lisci
BB_1961_title_verso: Busto di vecchio con barba corta e berretto alto.
BB_1961_text_recto: Il profilo sul recto ci ricorda Mainardi e Benedetto Ghirlandajo, il vecchio sul verso rammenta Piero di Cosimo. Non è sicuro che l'autore sia un artista fiorentino; potrebbe essere uno straniero, Juan de Borgoiia che deve aver lavorato a Firenze sotto i Ghirlandajo e fu probabilmente influenzato da Piero di Cosimo. Attribuito ad «Anonimo Fiorentino del Quattrocento».
BB_1938_title_recto: Profile of youth with lank streaming hair.
BB_1938_title_verso: Bust of old man with short beard and high cap.
BB_1938_text_recto: Attributed anonymous Florentine 15th century. The profile reminds one of Mainardi and Benedetto Ghirlandajo, the old man of Piero di Cosimo. It may conceivably be not Florentine at all, but by Juan de Borgoiia, who must have worked under the Ghirlandajo in Florence and very likely been influenced by Piero di Cosimo.

BB_1961_title_recto: Testa di un ragazzino con i capelli lunghi, in profilo a sinistra
BB_1961_text_recto: Iscritto «Leonardo da Vinci» in grafia dei primi dell'Ottocento nell'angolo inferiore sinistro. L'attribuzione a Leonardo è dovuta alla somiglianza di questo schizzo con quei profili milanesi che solevano essere  assegnati indiscriminatamente al grande fiorentino. Ma esso è molto vicino a Domenico Ghirlandajo e forse ancor più al suo fratello Benedetto, quale appare nel dipinto di Aigueperse.
BB_1938_title_recto: Head of little boy with longish hair in profile to Ieft.
BB_1938_text_recto: Inscribed in lower Ieft-hand corner in a hand of about 1800 with the words "di Leonardo da Vinci." This is tribute, no doubt, to the resemblance with Milanese profiles that used to be attributed indiscriminately to the great Florentine. It is, on the contrary, quite close to Domenico Ghirlandajo but perhaps closer still to his brother Benedetto as we find him at Aigueperse.

BB_1961_title_recto: Angeli che volano Iscritto «Giotto» in grafia secentesca
BB_1961_text_recto: Forse studio per una Crocifissione. Attribuito a Domenico Ghirlandajo.
BB_1938_title_recto: Studies for floating angels perhaps for a Crucifixion. Inscribed in 17th century hand with the word "Giotto".
BB_1938_text_recto: Attributed to Domenico Ghirlandajo himself.

BB_1961_title_recto: Santo in atto di benedire un malato
BB_1938_title_recto: Saint blessing a sick man.
BB_1903_title_recto: A Saint blessing a Sick Man.

BB_1961_title_recto: Testa di uomo barbuto
BB_1938_title_recto: Head of bearded man.
BB_1938_text_recto: Ascribed to Raphael.
BB_1903_title_recto: Head of a bearded Man.
BB_1903_text_recto: Same character as 901, and like that ascribed to Raphael.

BB_1961_title_recto: Studio di testa maschile
BB_1961_text_recto: Attribuito a Raffaello. 1932: Oggi la severità critica che mi indusse ad assegnare questa testa a Ridolfo mi sembra eccessiva: malgrado i suoi molti difetti, forse in parte dovuti a ritocchi, questa testa mi sembra ora molto più simile ad un Raffaello giovanile che non ad un Ridolfo del Ghirlandajo.
BB_1938_title_recto: Study of male head.
BB_1938_text_recto: Ascribed to Raphael. I no longer hold to this attribution. Despite many faults, due perhaps in part to retouching, the head now seems much more like an early Raphael.
BB_1903_title_recto: Study of a male head.

BB_1961_title_recto: Studio per un ritratto di Signora anziana, seduta su un basso sedile, in profilo a sinistra
BB_1938_title_recto: Study for portrait of middle-aged lady seated low in profile left.
BB_1938_text_recto: Mature and interesting work.

BB_1961_title_recto: Translazione del corpo di San Zanobi
BB_1961_text_recto: Studio per il quadro ora all'Accademia (già agli Uffizi, n. 1589).
BB_1938_title_recto: Study for the Uffizi picture representing the transfer of S. Zanobi's body.
BB_1903_title_recto: Study for the Uffizi picture representing the transfer of S. Zanobi's body.

BB_1961_title_recto: Testa di uomo anziano, forse disegnata dalla maschera mortuaria
BB_1938_title_recto: Head of elderly man done probably from death mask.
BB_1938_text_recto: Ascribed to Perugino.

BB_1961_title_recto: Testa di gentiluomo fiorentino di mezza età che guarda attentamente, quasi drammaticamente, verso destra
BB_1961_text_recto: Sembra troppo sensibile per costui e le pieghe del panneggio lo avvicinano molto più a Ridolfo del Ghirlandajo. La data è poco oltre il 1515, il che rende possibile che sia, come credeva Heseltine, un ritratto di Angelo Doni.
BB_1938_title_recto: Head or Florentine gentleman in early middle years looking keenly and even dramatically to right.
BB_1938_text_recto: It seems far too sentitive for him, and the folds of drapery bring it much nearer to Ridolfo. Its date is scarcely later than 1515, which makes it possible that it is, as Mr. Haseltine believed, a portrait of Angelo Doni.

BB_1961_title_recto: Studio per una Madonna e Santi
BB_1961_text_recto: L'autore di questo disegno sembrerebbe un seguace di Ridolfo del Ghirlandajo, caduto completamente sotto l'influenza di Raffaello. Io suppongo che sia Leonardo da Pistoia. Un confronto con la «Madonna e  Santi» dipinta da quest'ultimo nel 1516, oggi nella Pinacoteca di Volterra, tende a confermare quest'attribuzione.
BB_1938_title_recto: Study for altar-piece.
BB_1938_text_recto: The author of this drawing would seem to have been a follower of Ridolfo's, who fell completely under Raphael's influence. I suspect him to have been Leonardo da Pistoia. A comparison with the latter's altar-piece at Volterra tends to confirm this attribution.
BB_1903_title_recto: Study for altar-piece.
BB_1903_text_recto: The author of this drawing would seem to have been a follower of Ridolfo's, who fell completely under Raphael's influence. I suspect him to have been Leonardo da Pistoia. A comparison with the latter's altar-piece at Volterra tends to confirm this attribution.

BB_1961_title_recto: Santa Caterina in piedi, fra i Santi Stefano e Lorenzo
BB_1961_text_recto: Anche questo schizzo tradisce l'influenza dominante di Ridolfo e non è escluso che sia anch'esso di Leonardo da Pistoia, ma in una fase più giovanile e vigorosa. In ogni modo esso è dell'autore di un disegno a Monaco di Baviera, ivi attribuito al Beato Angelico, perché è una copia della «Lapidazione di Santo Stefano», affrescata dall'Angelico in Vaticano (vedi BB n. 177).
BB_1938_title_recto: St. Catherine standing between Sts. Stephen and Lawrence.
BB_1938_text_recto: This also betrays the dominant influence of Ridolfo, and it is not impossible that it again is by Leonardo da Pistoia, but in an earlier, more strenuous phase. At all events, this sketch is by the author of a drawing at Munich ascribed to Fra Angelico. The drawing in question is a copy after Fra Angelico's Vatican fresco representing the Stoning of Stephen (see my 177).
BB_1903_title_recto: St. Catherine standing between SS. Stephen and Lawrence.
BB_1903_text_recto: This also betrays the dominant influence of Ridolfo, and it is not impossible that it again is by Leonardo da Pistoia, but in an earlier, more strenuous phase. At all events, this sketch is by the author of a drawing at Munich ascribed to Fra Angelico. The drawing in question is a copy after Fra Angelico's Vatican fresco representing the Stoning of Stephen (see No.177).

BB_1961_title_recto: San Bernardino in profilo a srmstra, con un ostensorio nella mano destra ed un'asta nella sinistra
BB_1961_text_recto: Vicino a Ridolfo, tanto da poter anche essere suo.
BB_1938_title_recto: Study for S. Bernardino in profile to left with monstrance in right hand and staff in left.
BB_1938_text_recto: Close to Ridolfo and possibly by him.

BB_1961_title_recto: Madonna circondata da cinque Santi, uno dei quali, Santo Stefano, porge il Bambino a Sant'Anna, e, in basso, San Sebastiano e San Rocco (?) genuflessi
BB_1961_text_recto: Studio per una pala d'altare di un seguace del maturo Ridolfo, possibilmente Michele di Ridolfo, al quale è attribuito.
BB_1938_title_recto: Study for altar-piece. Virgin surrounded by five male saints, one of whom, Stephen, hands the Child to Anne. Below kneel Sebastian and another saint, perhaps Roch.
BB_1938_text_recto: Follower of the mature Ridolfo, possibly Michele di Ridolfo, to whom it is attributed.

BB_1961_title_recto: Annunciazione con due Angeli astanti
BB_1961_text_recto: Incantevole composizione vicino a Ridolfo. Se la memoria non m'inganna, c'è un rapporto fra questo disegno ed un dipinto dello stesso soggetto a Panzana. In tal caso, anche questo schizzo sarebbe di Michele di Ridolfo.
BB_1938_title_recto: Fine design for Annunciation, with two angels looking on.
BB_1938_text_recto: Charming, and close to Ridolfo. If memory does not fail me, there is a connection between this drawing and a painting of the same subject in S. Maria at Panzano. In that case the sketch also would be by Michele di Ridolfo.
BB_1903_title_recto: Fine design for Annunciation, with two angels looking on.
BB_1903_text_recto: Charming, and close to Ridolfo. If memory does not fail me, there is a connection between this drawing and a painting of the same subject in S. Maria at Panzano. In that case the sketch also would be by Michele di Ridolfo.

BB_1961_title_recto: Madonna in trono entro una nicchia con due Santi per parte e due Sante inginocchiate in basso Riconoscibili sono Nicola, Stefano e la Maddalena
BB_1961_text_recto: Di uno fra i primi seguaci di Ridolfo, se non addirittura di lui stesso.
BB_1938_title_recto: Sketch for Madonna enthroned against niche with two male saints on each side and two female saints kneeling below. Recognizable are Nicholas, Stephen, and the Magdalen.
BB_1938_text_recto: Close to Ridolfo. By an early follower if not by himself.

BB_1961_title_recto: Studio molto rifinito per una Crocifissione
BB_1961_text_recto: Il Sirén dice molto giustamente che questo disegno potrebbe anche passare per una miniatura monocroma. Vi si osservano tutte le caratteristiche di stile e di modellato che appaiono negli affreschi e nelle tavole dell'artista.
BB_1938_title_recto: Highly finished study for Crucifixion.
BB_1938_text_recto: Siren quite rightly says that this design might pass for a monochrome illumination as easily as for a drawing. It illustrates every peculiarity of modelling as well as all else that characterizes Giovanni in his frescoes and panels.

BB_1961_title_recto: Tre figure allegoriche femminili sedute su nuvole, e, su scala minore, figure maschili, probabilmente apostoli o profeti
Due grandi Angeli affrontati, in profilo, che reggono candelabri, su uno sfondo di stoffa a motivi floreali
BB_1938_title_recto: Two large angels carrying candelabra facing each other in profile aganist background of embroidered stuff. Designs for embroidery.

BB_1961_title_recto: Due grandi Angeli poracandelabri, simili a BB n905C
BB_1938_title_recto: Two large angels carrying candelabra. Similar to my 905C.

BB_1961_title_recto: Papa a cavallo con un falcone in pugno e dietro a lui una donna anziana inginocchiata all'ingresso di una Chiesa Iscritto: «D beltrand (us) Ghuasco dictus clemens quintus»
BB_1961_text_recto: Attribuito alla Scuola di Fra Angelico.
BB_1938_title_recto: Pope on horseback carrying falcon on his wrist.
BB_1938_text_recto: Ascribed to Raffaellino del Garbo.
BB_1903_title_recto: Pope on horseback carrying falcon on his wrist.

BB_1961_title_recto: Busto di fanciullo con le braccia incrociate e lo sguardo volto in alto
BB_1961_text_recto: Attribuito a Paolo Uccello, questo diligente, ma legnoso disegno, appartiene invece alla cerchia di Benozzo. A me sembra plausibile l'ipotesi di Sir Kenneth Clark che esso sia di Giusto d'Andrea al tempo della sua collaborazione con Benozzo a San Gimignano.
BB_1938_title_recto: Bust of child with crossed hands looking up to Ieft.
BB_1938_text_recto: Attributed to Uccello, this painstaking but stiff and wooden drawing is from the close following of Benozzo. Kenneth Clark's plausible suggestion is that it may be by Giusto d'Andrea in the years when he was assisting that master at S. Gimignano.

BB_1961_title_recto: Busto, presentato frontalmente, di un uomo dai lineamenti forti, che alza gli occhi verso sinistra, come sorpreso
BB_1938_title_recto: Bust of man full-face with powerful features, looking up as if startled towards left.
BB_1938_text_recto: Attributed to Pollajuolo.

BB_1961_title_recto: Due figure paludate, l'una in piedi col braccio destro sul fianco, l'altra seduta con la testa appoggiata alla mano destra
BB_1938_title_recto: Two heavily draped figures, one standing with right arm akimbo, the other seated with head resting on right hand.

BB_1961_title_recto: Due giovani ammantati, l'uno seduto e l'altro in piedi
BB_1961_text_recto: Già attribuito a Masolino, ma lo spirito, la tecnica ed il tocco dimostrano che è un disegno del Granacci quando egli era vicino a David Ghirlandajo.
BB_1938_title_recto: Two draped young men, one seated and the other standing.
BB_1938_text_recto: Ascribed to Masolino, but the spirit, the technique, and the touch prove this to be by Granacci when close to David.
BB_1903_title_recto: Two draped Young Men, one seated and the other standing.
BB_1903_text_recto: Ascribed to Masolino, but the spirit, the technique, and the touch prove this to be by Granacci when close to David.

BB_1961_title_recto: Figura ammantata
BB_1938_title_recto: Draped figure.

BB_1961_title_recto: Figura ammantata, compagna della precedente
BB_1961_title_verso: Donna inginocchiata, per un'Annunciazione od una Natività, quasi umbra come sentimento.
BB_1938_title_recto: Draped figure, companion to last.
BB_1938_title_verso: Kneeling female figure, for Annunciation or Nativity, almost Umbrian in feeling.

BB_1961_title_recto: Testa di giovane
BB_1961_text_recto: Già attribuito a «Maniera di Ghirlandajo». Forse uno studio per l'Arcangelo Michele nella pala trasferita da Berlino al Museo di Halle.
BB_1938_title_recto: A head.
BB_1938_text_recto: Catalogued as "Maniera di Ghirlandajo."
BB_1903_title_recto: A head.

BB_1961_title_recto: Madonna inginocchiata in adorazione
BB_1961_text_recto: Il tipo femminile ed il tratteggio suggeriscono il Granacci, altrimenti questo disegno potrebbe passare per opera di David Ghirlandajo. Non è per nulla improbabile che questo sia uno studio per la Madonna in una giovanile Natività già nella Raccolta di Einile Richtenberger a Parigi (Rivist d'Arte, 1930, p. 197).
BB_1938_title_recto: Study for a Madonna kneeling in adoration.
BB_1938_text_recto: The type and the hatching point to Granacci; otherwise this drawing might pass as David's. It is by no means improbable that this sketch was made in preparation for a Madonna in a Nativity formerly belonging to M. Emile Richtenberger of Paris-Granacci's earliest work among those known to me (Rivista d'Arte, 1930, p. 197).
BB_1903_title_recto: Study for a Madonna kneeling in adoration.
BB_1903_text_recto: The type and the hatching point to Granacci; otherwise this drawing might pass as David's. It is by no means improbable that this sketch was made in preparation for a Madonna in a Nativity belonging to M.  Emile Richtemberger of Paris-Granacci's earliest work among those known to me.

BB_1961_title_recto: Nudo giovanile disteso, in una posa che ricorda la figura distesa in primo piano nel «Pan» del Signorelli (già Berlino, Museo, n 79 A)
BB_1961_text_recto: Già attribuito al Pesellino, ma il tipo fisico ed il tocco «alla Credi» sono del Granacci.
BB_1938_title_recto: Youthful nude reclining in an attitude which recalls the reclining figure in the foreground of Signorelli's Pan, now in Berlin.
BB_1938_text_recto: Ascribed to Pesellino, but the type and the Credi-like touch are Granacci's.
BB_1903_title_recto: A youthful nude reclining in an attitude which recalls the reclining figure in the foreground of Signorelli's Pan, now in Berlin.
BB_1903_text_recto: Ascribed to Pesellino, but the type and the Credi-like touch are Granacci's.

BB_1961_title_recto: Uomo anziano avvolto in un mantello, seduto in profilo a sinistra
BB_1938_title_recto: Draped elderly man seated in profile to left.
BB_1938_text_recto: Ascribed to Filippino.
BB_1903_title_recto: A draped Elderly Man seated in profile to left.

BB_1961_title_recto: Due giovani nudi, l'uno seduto e l'altro in piedi
BB_1961_text_recto: Differisce da David Ghirlandajo soltanto per una maggiore raffinatezza, per un tratteggio più fitto e per lo speciale modo di usare la biacca.
BB_1938_title_recto: Two youthful nudes, one seated and the other standing.
BB_1938_text_recto: Differs from David only in greater refinement, in the closer hatching, and in the way the white is applied.
BB_1903_title_recto: Two youthful Nudes, one seated and the other standing.
BB_1903_text_recto: Differs from David only in greater refinement, in the closer hatching, and in the way the white is applied.

BB_1961_title_recto: Testa di uomo a bocca aperta, con lo sguardo volto a destra
BB_1961_text_recto: Già attribuito al Botticelli, ma il tratteggio e le lumeggiature sono del Granacci.
BB_1938_title_recto: Head of man with open mouth, looking to right.
BB_1938_text_recto: Ascribed to Botticelli, but the type, the hatching, and the white are Granacci's.
BB_1903_title_recto: Head of man with open mouth, looking to right.
BB_1903_text_recto: Ascribed to Botticelli, but the type, the hatching, and the white are Granacci's.

BB_1961_title_recto: Testa femminile, quasi in profilo verso destra: in basso, a sinistra, vaghi contorni di un volto femminile e, nell'angolo inferiore destro, il profilo di un piede e le dita di un altro piede
BB_1961_title_verso: Nudo virile, seduto per terra a gambe incrociate, col braccio sinistro teso e lo sguardo vòlto a destra.
BB_1961_text_recto: la testa in profilo verso destra è una copia, con pochissime varianti, della «Madonna» di Fra Filippo agli Uffizi (n. 1598).
BB_1961_text_verso: è uno studio dello stesso modello che ha servito per BB n. 954.
BB_1938_title_recto: Head of the Virgin in profile nearly to right. Copy, with very slight variations, of the head in Fra Filippo's Uffizi Madonna. Below to Ieft, in vague outline, mask of a female head. Also a Ieft foot in profile and toes of another foot.
BB_1938_title_verso: Study of the same nude model as in my 954, seated in the same position, save that he is looking to right and holds out his left arm.
BB_1938_text_recto: The profile on the front of this sheet is one of the daintiest and sweetest bits of drawing of the entire school. Its strict Filippesque type and its prettiness were responsible, apparently, for its attribution to  Filippino. But this artist neither imitated his father's types nor had a touch so delicate. Obliged to look further for its author, the critic will think of many names before Granacci's. Yet I believe that the last is the right one. I came to this conclusion after examination of the touch, and quite independently of the nude figure on the verso. This nude, as it happens, is beyond question by Granacci, but that has not greatly influenced my decision; for instances are not infrequent of a front and back of the same leaf being by different draughtsmen. It is rarer perhaps to find masters of this date copying so faithfully older painters; but even this occurs, and Granacci seems to have been addicted to it. Flagrant cases are his copies after Pesellino and Fra Angelico, my 958 recto and verso.
BB_1903_title_recto: Head of the Virgin in profile nearly to right. Copy, with very slight variations, of the head in Fra Filippo's Uffizi Madonna. Below to Ieft, in vague outline, mask of a female head. Also a Ieft foot in profile and toes of another foot.
BB_1903_title_verso: Study of the same nude model as in No. 954, seated in the same position, save that he is looking to right and holds out his left arm.
BB_1903_text_recto: The profile on the front of this sheet is one of the daintiest and sweetest bits of drawing of the entire school. Its strict Filippesque type and its prettiness were responsible, apparently, for its attribution to  Filippino. But this artist neither imitated his father's types nor had a touch so delicate. Obliged to look further for its author, the critic will think of many names before Granacci's. Yet I believe that the last is the right one. I came to this conclusion after examination of the touch, and quite independently of the nude figure on the verso. This nude, as it happens, is beyond question by Granacci, but that has not greatly influenced my decision; for instances are not infrequent of a front and back of the same leaf being by different draughtsmen. It is rarer perhaps to find masters of this date copying so faithfully older painters; but even this occurs, and Granacci seems to have been addicted to it. Flagrant cases are his copies after Pesellino, No. 956.

BB_1961_title_recto: Testa di monaca
BB_1938_title_recto: Head of a nun.
BB_1938_text_recto: Ascribed to Ghirlandajo. Early.
BB_1903_title_recto: Head of a Young Man.
BB_1903_title_verso: Ascribed to Ghirlandajo.

BB_1961_title_recto: Ritratto di giovane donna
BB_1938_title_recto: Portrait of young woman.
BB_1938_text_recto: Same character and attribution as last.
BB_1903_title_recto: Portrait of Young Woman.
BB_1903_text_recto: Same character and attribution as last.

BB_1961_title_recto: Testa di monaca
BB_1938_title_recto: Head of a nun.
BB_1938_text_recto: Same character and attribution as last two.
BB_1903_title_recto: Head of a Nun.
BB_1903_text_recto: Same character and attribution as last two.

BB_1961_title_recto: Giovane donna nuda che solleva il braccio destro sopra la testa e con la mano sinistra trattiene un velo intorno alle sue gambe Su scala molto maggiore, studio del palmo di una mano con le dita piegate e, più piccolo, un piede destro; perpendicolarmente a questo, scorcio di una testa china di giovinetta
BB_1938_title_recto: Young woman, nude but for a gauzelike drapery which she holds over her left leg, with her right arm over her head. On much larger scale, study of the inside of a hand with bent fingers. On smaller scale  again, a right foot and foreshortened head of a young person.
BB_1938_text_recto: This leaf is catalogued as Botticelli's, because it is assumed that the nude was destined for the Truth in Sandro's Calumny. But the conception of the nude is different in the two figures. The sketch is at once more realistic and more advanced than Sandro's figure, nor is the type, nor the proportions, nor the technique in any way Botticellian. In all these respects the drawing is Ghirlandajesque. At least as clearly characteristic of the same school is the study of a hand. Regarding this sheet closer, we cannot fail to observe that the hatching and the application of white are Granacci's. Finally, almost by way of "Granacci his mark," we have the woman's long, boneless, curved thumb, peculiar to him, as, for instance, in the St. Jerome in the St. Petersburg Nativity. But although certainly not Botticelli's, it is by no  means improbable that while drawing this nude Granacci had in mind Botticelli's Truth.
BB_1903_title_recto: Young woman, nude but for a gauzelike drapery which she holds over her left leg, with her right arm over her head. On much larger scale, study of the inside of a hand with bent fingers. On smaller scale  again, a right foot and foreshortened head of a young person.
BB_1903_text_recto: This leaf is catalogued as Botticelli's, because it is assumed that the nude was destined for the Truth in Sandro's Calumny. But the conception of the nude is different in the two figures. The sketch is at once more realistic and more advanced than Sandro's figure, nor is the type, nor the proportions, nor the technique in any way Botticellian. In all these respects the drawing is Ghirlandajesque. At least as clearly characteristic of the same school is the study of a hand. Regarding this sheet closer, we cannot fail to observe that the hatching and the application of white are Granacci's. Finally, almost by way of "Granacci his mark," we have the woman's long, boneless, curved thumb, peculiar to him, as, for instance, in the St. Jerome in the St. Petersburg Nativity. But although certainly not Botticelli's, it is by no  means improbable that while drawing this nude Granacci had in mind Botticelli's Truth.

BB_1961_title_recto: Giovane donna in piedi, col braccio destro alzato come per trafiggersi e la veste gonfiata dal vento
BB_1961_text_recto: Studio per una Lucrezia. Attribuito al Botticelli, ma non ha niente di botticelliano ed ha invece molti punti di contatto con le opere del Granacci. Per esempio, la Madonna nella «Natività» già n. 1065 della Alte Pinakothek a Monaco di Baviera, ha lo stesso volto di questa Lucrezia; e la Santa Caterina nella «Vergine in gloria e quattro Santi» all'Accademia di Firenze (n. 8650) le assomiglia non solo nell'aspetto, ma anche nell'azione. Venendo ai particolari meno appariscenti, confrontate i panneggi del nostro disegno con i panneggi nei dipinti summentovati e con quelli nelle «Storie di Giuseppe Ebreo» (Uffizi nn. 2150 e 2152); osservate soprattutto la veste leggera della donna col bambino che le corre appresso, nel secondo piano del pannello con «Giuseppe che presenta i fratelli al Faraone»; confrontate la mano sinistra della Lucrezia e la mano che addita, del vecchio in primo piano nello stesso pannello, o la mano protesa dell'ufficiale che conduce Giuseppe in prigione nel pannello compagno; infine confrontate la mano destra della Lucrezia e la mano destra del San Giuseppe nella «Sacra Famiglia» del Granacci a Pitti (n. 345), ivi a lungo attribuita al Peruzzi.
BB_1938_title_recto: Study for a Lucretia.
BB_1938_text_recto: Ascribed to Botticelli.
BB_1903_title_recto: Study for a Lucretia.

BB_1961_title_recto: Donna ammantata in profilo a sinistra
BB_1961_title_verso: Due grandi amorini alati, in profilo, in atto di suonare il piffero, un piccolo fauno ed una sfinge.
BB_1961_text_recto: in origine era compagno del disegno precedente e, come quello, attribuito al Botticelli, ma interamente ripassato in bistro e acquarellato da mano posteriore.
BB_1938_title_recto: Draped female, in profile to left.
BB_1938_title_verso: Two large winged cupids in profile playing on pipes and a small faun and sphinx.
BB_1938_text_recto: Originally a pendant to last, and like that ascribed to Botticelli, but entirely made over with bistre and wash by a later hand.
BB_1903_title_recto: A draped Female, in profile to left.
BB_1903_text_recto: Originally a pendant to last, and like that ascribed to Botticelli, but retouched with bistre and wash by a later hand.

BB_1961_title_recto: Figura ammantata
BB_1961_text_recto: Già attribuito al Ghirlandajo. Identica, come tipo e carattere, a BB n. 957.
BB_1938_title_recto: Draped figure.
BB_1938_text_recto: Ascribed to Ghilandajo, but exact type and character of my 957.
BB_1903_title_recto: Draped figure.
BB_1903_text_recto: Ascribed to Ghilandajo, but exact type and character of No. 957.

BB_1961_title_recto: Tre giovani nudi
BB_1961_text_recto: Già attribuito a Piero Pollajuolo. Se non fosse per la loro maggiore gentilezza e per il tratteggio più fine, potrebbero essere di David Ghirlandajo.
BB_1938_title_recto: Three youthful nudes.
BB_1938_text_recto: Ascribed to Piero Pollajuolo, but except for greater gentleness and finer hatching this might be David's.
BB_1903_title_recto: Three youthful Nudes.
BB_1903_text_recto: But for greater gentleness and finer hatching they might be David's. Ascribed to Piero Pollajuolo.

BB_1961_title_recto: Giovane nudo seduto di fronte allo spettatore, con la gamba sinistra in violento scorcio e la testa in profilo a sinistra
BB_1961_text_recto: Il tratteggio è come quello del Credi. Già attribuito a Piero Pollajuolo.
BB_1938_title_recto: Nude youth seated his body square on to the spectator with his left leg in violent foreshortening, and his head in profile to left. The hatching like Credi's.
BB_1938_text_recto: Ascibed to Piero Pollajuolo.
BB_1903_title_recto: Nude youth seated his body square on to the spectator with his left leg in violent foreshortening, and his head in profile to left. The hatching like Credi's.

BB_1961_title_recto: Poderoso nudo maschile in piedi, vòlto in profilo a sinistra con la mano destra su un'asta e la sinistra abbandonata lungo il fianco
BB_1961_text_recto: Già attribuito a Piero Pollajuolo, ma il tipo facciale e l'orecchio sono distintamente del Granacci; il corpo ricorda il Battista nella pala del Granacci trasferita da Berlino al Museo di Halle. Anche il disegno delle braccia e l'uso della biacca confermano la nostra attribuzione.
BB_1938_title_recto: Powerful male nude standing, in profile to left, with his right hand on a staff and his left falling at his side.
BB_1938_text_recto: Ascribed to Piero Pollajuolo, but the type of head and the ear are distinctly Granacci's, while the body recalls the Baptist in the Berlin altar-piece. Finally, the drawing of the arms and the use of white confirm our attribution.
BB_1903_title_recto: A powerful male Nude standing, in profile to left, with his right hand on a staff and his left falling at his side.
BB_1903_text_recto: Ascribed to Piero Pollajuolo, but the type of head and the ear are distinctly Granacci's, while the body recalls the Baptist in the Berlin altar-piece (No. 97). Finally, the drawing of the arms and the use of white confirm our attribution.

BB_1961_title_recto: Testa di uomo glabro con le labbr aaperte e l'espressione dolente
BB_1961_text_recto: Ricorda Raffaello e Ridolfo del Ghirlandajo e sembra copiata da un busto di Scopas.
BB_1938_title_recto: Head of clean-shaven man with open mouth and suffering expression very likely copied after a Scopasian bust.
BB_1938_text_recto: Suggests Raphael and Ridolfo Ghirlandajo.

BB_1961_title_recto: Parte inferiore di un uomo in piedi
BB_1961_text_recto: È attribuito al Credi, ma le pieghe ed il tratteggio sono quanto mai caratteristici del Granacci (cfr. BB nn. 937, 943 e 947).
BB_1938_title_recto: Study for the lower part of erect male figure.
BB_1938_text_recto: Ascribed to Credi, but the folds and the hatohing are most characteristic of Granacci (cf. my 937, 943 and 947).
BB_1903_title_recto: Study for the lower part of erect male figure.
BB_1903_text_recto: Ascribed to Credi, but the folds and the hatohing are most characteristic of Granacci (cf. Nos. 937, 943 and 947).

BB_1961_title_recto: Due figure ammantate, l'una seduta frontalmente, l'altra in profilo a sinistra
BB_1961_title_verso: Una loggia ed una statua di guerriero con lo scudo e la spada.
BB_1938_title_recto: Two draped figures, one seated facing us, the other in profile to Ieft.
BB_1938_title_verso: Pen sketch for a loggia and a statue in armour holding shield and sword.

BB_1961_title_recto: Bambino seduto che tende le braccia verso sinistra
BB_1961_text_recto: Già attribuito al Credi, del quale non è. Un confronto col Bambino Gesù nella pala del Granacci trasferita da Berlino al Museo di Halle, ma ancor più la tecnica ed il tocco assicurano l'attribuzione al Granacci.
BB_1938_title_recto: Infant seated, stretching out its iittle arms to the Ieft.
BB_1938_text_recto: Ascribed to Credi, by whom it is not. A comparison with the Child in Granacci's Berlin altar-piece, but even more the technique and touch, secure the attribution to Granacci.
BB_1903_title_recto: An Infant seated, stretching out its iittle arms to the Ieft.
BB_1903_text_recto: Ascribed to Credi, by whom it is not. A comparison with the Child in Granacci's Berlin altar-piece (No. 97), but even more the technique and touch, secure the attribution to Granacci.

BB_1961_title_recto: Nudo anziano a braccia aperte, con un sasso nella mano destra
BB_1961_title_verso: Figura ammantata che regge un libro ed un'asta.
BB_1961_text_recto: una volta attribuito al Pollajuolo. Sarebbe stata più ragionevole un'attribuzione al Credi perché nel tipo e nella tecnica questo disegno del Granacci è più vicino a quelli del Credi.
BB_1938_title_recto: Elderly nude, holding out his arms, with a stone in right hand.
BB_1938_title_verso: Draped figure holding book and staff.
BB_1938_text_recto: ascribed to Pollajuolo. An attribution to Credi would have been more reasonable, for both as type and as technique this is the most like Credi's of all Granacci's drawings.
BB_1903_title_recto: An elderly Nude, holding out his arms, with a stone in right hand.
BB_1903_title_verso: Draped figure holding book and staff.
BB_1903_text_recto: ascribed to Pollajuolo. An attribution to Credi would have been more reasonable, for both as type and as technique this is the most like Credi's of all Granacci's drawings.

BB_1961_title_recto: Due nudi seduti, l'uno che ci guarda di fronte e l'altro che si volge indietro con un movimento che richiama i nudi decorativi di Michelangelo nella vòlta della Sistina
BB_1961_title_verso: Testa di uomo barbuto e testa di fanciulla; iscritto «Puligo» o «Ridolfo del Ghirlandajo» da una mano intorno al 1600.
BB_1961_text_recto: qui tutto è del Granacci e forse della sua migliore fase matura. Ciò nonostante queste figure sono attribuite a Piero Pollajuolo. Un confronto col foglio del Credi (BB n. 690) è istruttivo.
BB_1938_title_recto: Two nudes seated, one facing us, and the other turning away with a movement recalling Michelangelo's decorative nudes on the Sixtine Ceiling. Nevertheless, these two figures are ascribed to Piero Pollajuolo.
BB_1938_title_verso: Head of a bearded man, and in bistre a girl's head also in hand of about 1600: "Puligo o Ridolfo del Ghirlandaio".
BB_1938_text_recto: here everything is Granacci's, and almost of his better known maturer phase. Comparison with Credi's sheet (my 690) is instructive.
BB_1903_title_recto: Two Nudes seated, one facing us, and the other turning away with a movement recalling Michelangelo's decorative nudes on the Sixtine Ceiling. Nevertheless, these two figures are ascribed to Piero Pollajuolo.
BB_1903_title_verso: Head of a bearded Man, and in bistre a Girl's Head.
BB_1903_text_recto: here everything is Granacci's, and almost of his better known maturer phase. Comparison with Credi's sheet (No. 690) is instructive.

BB_1961_title_recto: Figura ammantata, con pieghe simili a quelle di BB n 937, e testa femminile che nel tipo ricorda tanto il Credi, quanto il Perugino, ma come tecnica il solo Credi
BB_1961_title_verso: Giovane avvolto in un mantello, con lo sguardo chino verso la sua sinistra.
BB_1961_text_recto: Già attribuito al Pollajuolo, ma stilisticamente identico a BB nn. 938 e 939. Questo foglio ci fornisce un anello di congiunzione fra i disegni del Granacci prossimi a David Ghirlandajo ed i suoi disegni più vicini a Lorenzo di Credi.
BB_1938_title_recto: Draped figure of young man looking down to his Ieft.
BB_1938_title_verso: Similar draped figure, but with folds more as in my 937. Also a woman's head, in type recalling both Credi and Perugino, but in technique Credi alone.
BB_1938_text_recto: This sheet thus furnishes points of contact between those of Granacci's drawings in which he is nearer David, and those in which he approaches Credi.
BB_1903_title_recto: Draped figure of Young Man looking down to left. Ascribed to Piero Pollajuolo, but of the precise style of Nos. 938 and 939.
BB_1903_title_verso: Similar draped figure, but with folds more as in No. 937. Also a Woman's Head, in type recalling both Credi and Perugino, but in technique Credi alone.
BB_1903_text_recto: This sheet thus furnishes points of contact between those of Granacci's drawings, in which he is nearer David, and those in which he approaches Credi.

BB_1961_title_recto: Nudo in piedi, con la testa volta in profilo a sinistra, le gambe divaricate e fermamente piantate al suolo, il braccio destro alzato ed il sinistro teso in fuori
BB_1961_text_recto: La testa e l'orecchio sono palesemente del Granacci e così lo è la tecnica «alla Credi» (cfr. BB n. 931). Già attribuito, come quello, al Pollajuolo.
BB_1938_title_recto: Nude standing with legs apart and firmly planted, his right arm held up and his Ieft stretched out.
BB_1938_text_recto: The head, in profile to Ieft, and the ear are visibly Granacci's. So is the Credi-like character of the technique (cf. my 931). Ascribed, like that, to Pollajuolo.
BB_1903_title_recto: A Nude standing with legs apart and firmly planted, his right arm held up and his Ieft stretched out.
BB_1903_text_recto: The head, in profile to Ieft, and the ear are visibly Granacci's. So is the Credi-like character of the technique (cf. my 931). Ascribed, like that, to Pollajuolo.

BB_1961_title_recto: Nudo in piedi, in atto di avanzare verso sinistra, tendendo il braccio sinistro
BB_1961_text_recto: Il tipo somatico, le proporzioni, il disegno delle braccia, il tocco, sono tutti del Granacci. Già attribuito al Pollajuolo.
BB_1938_title_recto: Nude figure standing in striding posture to Ieft, with the Ieft arm held out.
BB_1938_text_recto: Ascribed to Pollajuolo. The type, the proportions, the drawing of the arms, the touch, all are Granacci's.
BB_1903_title_recto: Nude figure standing in striding posture to Ieft, with the Ieft arm held out.
BB_1903_text_recto: Ascribed to Pollajuolo. The type, the proportions, the drawing of the arms, the touch, all are Granacci's.

BB_1961_title_recto: Nudo maschile seduto frontalmente presso un tavolo, con le gambe accavallate e la testa in profilo a destra, appoggiata alla mano
BB_1961_text_recto: Il tipo della testa e dell'orecchio è inconfondibilmente del Granacci, ed anche il tocco è chiaramente suo, ma il tratteggio incrociato ricorda un po' Filippino Lippi. Attribuito a Piero Pollajuolo.
BB_1938_title_recto: Male nude seated by a table, with his head sharply turned to right resting in his hand, and his legs crossed.
BB_1938_text_recto: Ascribed to Pollajuolo. Here the type of head and the ear are unmistakably Granacci's. The touch is also clearly his. In the cross-hatching, however, we are reminded somewhat of Filippino.
BB_1903_title_recto: A male Nude seated by a table, with his head sharply turned to right resting in his hand, and his legs crossed.
BB_1903_text_recto: Here the type of head and the ear are unmistakably Granacci's. The touch is also clearly his. In the cross-hatching, however, we are reminded somewhat of Filippino. Ascribed to Piero Pollajuolo.

BB_1961_title_recto: Studio di panneggio per una figura in piedi, in profilo a sinistra
BB_1961_text_recto: È difficile capire per quale ragione, se non fosse per qualcosa nel tocco, questo disegno sia già stato attribuito al Credi. Le pieghe non ricadono secondo il suo sistema, ma piuttosto secondo quello del Ghirlandajo, un po' come in BB n. 939. In pittura, il parallelo più vicino sono i panneggi della Vergine in una «Incoronazione» a Città di Castello, che il Cavalcaselle accetta come interamente eseguita dal Granacci; ma anche se altri aiuti collaborarono a questa pittura, per la quale Domenico Ghirlandajo fornì il disegno, la Vergine è chiaramente del Granacci. Se confrontiamo i panneggi di questo foglio con quelli di BB n. 978, che è tanto più tardo e tanto più ovviamente del Granacci, vedremo che ciò nonostante le pieghe si rassomigliano.
BB_1938_title_recto: Study of drapery for figure standing in profile to Ieft.
BB_1938_text_recto: Why this should have been ascribed to Credi, except for something in the touoh, it is hard to understand. The folds are not of his system but rather Ghirlandajesque, somewhat as in a study for drapery over knees on my 939, or in the two standing figures on the same sheet. The nearest parallel to them are the draperies of the Virgin in a Coronation at Città di Castello, the execution of the whole of which Cavalcaselle would take to be Granacci's. Perhaps other assistants as well have worked on this picture designed by Domenico but the Virgin is clearly Granacci's. To return to our drawing, it should further be compared with my 978, which, although so much later and more obviously Granacci's, yet resembles it in the folds.
BB_1903_title_recto: Study of drapery for a figure standing in profile to left.
BB_1903_text_recto: Why this should have been ascribed to Credi, except for something in the touch, it is hard to understand. The folds are not of his system but rather Ghirlandajesque, somewhat as in a study for drapery over knees on No. 939, or in the two standing figures on the same sheet. The nearest parallel to them are the draperies of the Virgin in a Coronation at Città di Castello, the execution of the whole of which Cavalcaselle would take to be Granacci's. Perhaps other assistants as well have worked on this Ghirlandajesque picture, but the Virgin is clearly Granacci's. To return to our drawing, it should further be compared with No. 978, which, although so much later and more obviously Granacci's, yet resembles it in the folds.

BB_1961_title_recto: Giovane ammantato seduto, panneggio per una figura in piedi, e due studi di fanciulla in movimento brusco
BB_1961_title_verso: Giovane elegantemente paludato, atteggiato come la figura all'estrema destra nell'«Epifania» di Leonardo (Uffizi n. 1594) e una figura più piccola in profilo.
BB_1961_text_recto: Questo foglio era una volta attribuito a Domenico Ghirlandajo, ma né la qualità del tocco né i panneggi sono suoi. È molto più vicino a David, anzi è ovvio che il suo autore deve essere stato in stretti rapporti con quest'ultimo. Che questo autore sia il Granacci ce lo dimostrano il tratteggio, il tocco «alla Credi», le pieghe squadrate. È ovviamente della stessa mano che disegnò il foglio seguente.
BB_1938_title_recto: Draped youth seated, drapery for standing figure, and two studies of a girl in brisk movement.
BB_1938_title_verso: Elegantly draped youth, in attitude of tho figure on the extreme r. in Leonardo's Adoration of the Magi. Also a smaller figure in profile.
BB_1938_text_recto: This sheet is ascribed to Ghirlandajo, but the qualit.y of touch is not his, nor are the draperies of his system. The relation to David is much closer, and it is obvious that their author must have been on intimate terms with the latter. That this author was Granacci is clear from the Credi-like hatching and touch, and from the squarish folds. It is obviously by the hand which drew the next.
BB_1903_title_recto: A draped Youth seated, drapery for a standing figure, and two studies of a Girl in brisk movement.
BB_1903_title_verso: An elegantly draped Youth, in attitude of the figure on the extreme right in Leonardo's Adoration of the Magi. Also a smaller figure in profile.
BB_1903_text_recto: This sheet is ascribed to Ghirlandajo, but the quality of touch is not his, nor are the draperies of his system. The relation to David is much closer, and it is obvious that their author must have been on intimate terms with the latter. That this author was Granacci is clear from the Credi-like hatching and touch, and from the squarish fo lds. It is obviously by the hand which drew the next.

BB_1961_title_recto: Due giovinetti in ampi mantelli, panneggio, intorno ai ginocchi di una figura seduta e, nel verso opposto, lieve schizzo di una Madonna che adora il Bambino
BB_1961_title_verso: Due studi di panneggi, eseguiti con la stessa tecnica del panneggio sul recto.
BB_1961_text_recto: attribuito al Ghirlandajo. Le figure infatti sono ghirlandaiesche, ma più nello stile di David che in quello di Domenico. Per David, però, questi schizzi sono troppo raffinati. Il sistema delle pieghe richiama alla  mente le pitture giovanili del Granacci ed uno studio come BB n. 937. Il tratteggio e l'uso della biacca inoltre, ricollegano questo foglio, come tutti gli studi giovanili del Granacci, alla scuola del Credi. Finalmente la Madonna adorante si ritrova tale e quale sopra un foglio certamente del Granacci (BB n. 981). Questi schizzi per una Madonna (vedi anche BB n. 909) sono forse studi per la «Natività» già nella Raccolta di Ernile Richtenberger a Parigi (Rivista D'Arte, 1930, p. 197).
BB_1938_title_recto: Two draped figures, drapery for lower part of seated figure, and sketch for a Madonna adoring the Child.
BB_1938_title_verso: Two studies of drapery in same technique.
BB_1938_text_recto: the figures on the recto are Ghirlandajesque, but in David's rather than Domenico's fashion. For David, however, these sketches are too refined. The system of folds recalls Granacci's earliest painting and such a study as my 937. The hatching and white, moreover, connect this sheet with the school of Credi, in the way that all Granacci's earlier studies attach themselves to that school. Finally, the sketch for a Madonna recurs with no change on a sheet certainly by Granacci in the Santarelli Collection (my 981) of the Uffizi. These sketches for a Madonna, as well as the one on my 909, may have served as studies for a Nativity formerly belonging to M. Richtenberger, of Paris (Rivista d'Arte, 1930, p. 197).
BB_1903_title_recto: Two draped figures, drapery for lower part of seated figure, and sketch for a Madonna adoring the Child.
BB_1903_text_recto: The figures are Ghirlandajesque, but in David's rather than Domenico's fashion. For David, however, these sketches are too refined. The system of folds recalls Granacci's earliest paintings and such a study as No. 937· The hatching and white, moreover, connect this sheet with the school of Credi, in the way that all Granacci's earlier studies attach themselves to that school. Finally, the sketch for a Madonna recurs with no change on a sheet certainly by Granacci in the Santarelli Collection (No. 981) of the Uffizi (Note: These sketches for a Madonna, as well as the one on No. 909, may have served as studies for a Nativity belonging to M. Richtemberger, of Paris). Ascribed to Domenico.

BB_1961_title_recto: Vergine genuflessa a destra e Bambino Gesù che L'abbraccia; a destra, su scala maggiore, scorcio di una mano
BB_1961_text_recto: I volti della Vergine e del Bambino sono ambedue chiaramente del Granacci; quanto alla mano, cfr. con BB n. 922. Già attribuito a Domenico Ghirlandajo.
BB_1938_title_recto: Virgin kneeling, turned to right, and the Child reaching up to her. This with the pen and white chalk Also study, with silver point and whith chalk, for a hand.
BB_1938_text_recto: Ascribed to Domenico. The hand should be compared with the one on my 922. Both the Virgin's face and the Child's are clearly Granacci's.
BB_1903_title_recto: The Virgin kneeling, turned to right, and the Child reaching up to her. This with the pen and white. Also study, with silver-point and white, for a hand.
BB_1903_text_recto: The last should be compared with the hand on No. 922. Both the Virgin's face and the Child's are clearly Granacci's. Ascribed to Domenico.

BB_1961_title_recto: Figura ammantata, vista da tergo
BB_1961_text_recto: Già attribuito a Masaccio, ma le pieghe ed il tocco sono del Granacci.
BB_1938_title_recto: Draped figure seen from behind.
BB_1938_text_recto: Ascribed to Masaccio, but folds and touch are Granacci's.
BB_1903_title_recto: A draped figure seen from behind.
BB_1903_text_recto: Ascribed to Masaccio, but folds and touch are Granacci's.

BB_1961_title_recto: Figura ammantata e due teste di fanciulli
BB_1961_text_recto: Molto vicino a Domenico Ghirlandajo, al quale era attribuito, ma molto di più al Credi.
BB_1938_title_recto: Draped figure, and two children's heads.
BB_1938_text_recto: Ascribed to Domenico and close to him.
BB_1903_title_recto: A draped figure, and two Children's heads.

BB_1961_title_recto: Studio dal calco di un piede e panneggi intorno alle gambe allungate di una figura seduta per terra; il resto della figura è appena accennato con linee di contorno e mostra una faccia distintamente  granacciesca
BB_1961_text_recto: Tecnica e pieghe sono del Granacci. Già attribuito al Credi.
BB_1938_title_recto: Study after the cast of a foot. Drapery for legs of figure sitting on the ground stretched out. The rest of this figure is indicated in outline, and has a face of distinctly Granacciesque type. The folds and the  technique also are his.
BB_1938_text_recto: Ascribed to Credi.
BB_1903_title_recto: Study after the cast of a foot. Drapery for legs of figure sitting on the ground stretched out. The rest of this figure is indicated in outline, and has a face of distinctly Granacciesque type. The folds and the technique also are his.

BB_1961_title_recto: Uomo nudo, in profilo a destra, col braccio destro proteso e l'aria marziale
BB_1961_text_recto: Già attribuito al Pesellino. Quasi identico a BB n. 935.
BB_1938_title_recto: Almost nude male standing in martial attitude, with right arm held out, and facing tor. Nearly identical with my 935.
BB_1938_text_recto: Ascribed to Pesellino but rather Peruginesque.
BB_1903_title_recto: Almost nude Male standing in martial attitude, with right arm held out, and facing to right. This is nearly identical with No. 935.

BB_1961_title_recto: Nudo che regge una spada con ambedue le mani
BB_1961_text_recto: Già attribuito a Piero Pollajuolo, ma simile a BB n. 927.
BB_1938_title_recto: Nude holding sword with both hands.
BB_1938_text_recto: Ascr. to Piero Pollajuolo, but in the character of my 927.
BB_1903_title_recto: A Nude holding a sword with both hands.
BB_1903_text_recto: Ascribed to Piero Pollajuolo, but in the character of No. 927.

BB_1961_title_recto: Due giovani ammantati e, fra di loro, un piede; inoltre una testa di fanciullo ed un Angelo che corre verso sinistra
BB_1961_title_verso: Studio da un rilievo antico (vedi anche BB n. 948 verso): Giovane nudo a cavallo, Vittoria seduta, con una cornucopia e, a destra, in senso inverso, busto virile.
BB_1961_text_recto: già attribuito a Domenico Ghirlandajo, ma sotto ogni punto di vista caratteristico del Granacci ed uno dei suoi migliori disegni ghirlandaieschi.
BB_1938_title_recto: Two draped young men. Between them study of a foot. Also a child's head, and an angel running to Ieft.
BB_1938_title_verso: Study from same antique relief as verso of wy 948: nude youth on horseback, seated Victory with cornucopia.
BB_1938_text_recto: ascribed to Domenico, but in every way characteristic of Granacci, and one of his best Ghirlandajesque drawings.
BB_1938_text_verso:
The nude on horseback
far too Leonardesque for Domenico or David.
BB_1903_title_recto: Two draped Young Men. Between them study of a foot. Also a Child's head, and an Angel running to left.
BB_1903_text_recto: Ascribed to Domenico, but in every way characteristic of Granacci, and one of his best Ghirlandajesque drawings.

BB_1961_title_recto: Giovane ammantato, seduto per terra e putto
BB_1961_text_recto: Le pieghe del manto del giovane si ritrovano in BB n. 943 ed il putto è identico a quello in BB n. 930. Già attribuito al Credi.
BB_1938_title_recto: Draped young man seated on the ground. His folds as in my 940. Also a child exactly like the one in my 930.
BB_1938_text_recto: Ascribed to Credi.
BB_1903_title_recto: Draped Young Man seated on the ground. His folds as in No. 943. Also a Child exactly like the one on No. 930.

BB_1961_title_recto: Giovane donna seduta, con le braccia protese verso terra
BB_1961_title_verso: Nudo a cavallo e due altre figure dall'antico.
BB_1961_text_recto: forse uno studio per una Nascita della Vergine. Già attribuito a Domenico Ghirlandajo, ma il tocco e la tecnica sono tipici del Granacci. I due pollici sono caratteristici di lui (vedi BB n. 922).
BB_1961_text_verso: Cfr. BB n. 946 verso.
BB_1938_title_recto: Young woman seated, reaching down with both arms to the groundstudy perhaps for a figure in a Birth of the Virgin.
BB_1938_title_verso: Nude on horseback, and two other figures after the antique.
BB_1938_text_recto: ascribed to Domenico, but tho touch and the technique are Granacci's. Both thumbs are highly characteristic of him (see my 922).
BB_1903_title_recto: A Young Woman seated, reaching down with both arms to the ground-study perhaps for a figure in a Birth of the Virgin.
BB_1903_title_verso: A Nude on horseback, and two other figures after the antique.
BB_1903_text_recto: ascribed to Domenico, but the touch and the technique are Granacci's. Both thumbs are highly characteristic of him. (See under No. 922.)

BB_1961_title_recto: Giovinetto nudo seduto, che si toglie un pruno dal piede sinistro, appoggiandolo al ginocchio destro
BB_1961_text_recto: Già attribuito al Credi. Cfr. BB n. 974 verso.
BB_1938_title_recto: Youthful nude seated, holding his Ieft foot with both hands on his right knee.
BB_1938_text_recto: Ascribed to Credi.
BB_1903_title_recto: A youthful Nude seated, holding his left foot with both hands on his right knee.

BB_1961_title_recto: Nudo maschile seduto per terra a gambe incrociate ed appoggiato sul braccio destro; testa in profilo a sinistra
BB_1961_text_recto: Il tipo, le proporzioni, la tecnica sono del Granacci. Lo scorcio del braccio destro fa pensare a Michelangelo. La mano sinistra è puramente cinquecentesca. Già attribuito a Piero Pollajuolo .
BB_1938_title_recto: Male nude seated on ground with legs crossed, and leaning on his right arm. Head in profile to Ieft.
BB_1938_text_recto: Ascribed to Piero Pollajuolo. The type, the proportions, the technique, all are Granacci's. The foreshortened right arm suggests Michelangelo. The Ieft hand is of a character found only in the Cinquecento.
BB_1903_title_recto: A male Nude seated on the ground with legs crossed, and leaning on his right arm. Head in profile to left.
BB_1903_text_recto: The type, the proportions, the technique, all are Granacci's. The foreshortened right arm suggests Michelangelo. The left hand is of a character found only in the Cinquecento. Nevertheless, this is ascribed to Piero Pollajuolo.

BB_1961_title_recto: Madonna dell'Uiniltà col Bambino sul ginocchio sinistro, che si protende verso San Giovannino genuflesso, al di sopra del quale è San Giuseppe con mani alzate in gioioso stupore; in basso, figura acefala di fanciullo
BB_1961_text_recto: Studio per una Sacra Fainiglia con San Giovannino non dissiinile da quella del Granacci nella Galleria Pitti (n. 345); cfr. BB n. 979 recto e verso per la composizione e, per il Bambino Gesù, cfr. BB nn. 930 e 947. Lo spirito, i tipi e l'uso della penna sono distintamente del Granacci.
BB_1938_title_recto: Virgin seated on ground with the Child on her Ieft knee; He reaches out towards the infant John, who faces Him, while above the latter Joseph throws up his hands in delight; below, torso of a child.
BB_1938_text_recto: Study for a picture not unlike Granacci's Holy Family at the Pitti Gallery, and resembling also two drawings ascribed to Fra Paolino, but also by Granacci, my 979. See also my 1059 for the Leonardesque quality of the motive. The spirit, the types, and the pen-stroke are disctinctly Granacci's. With the Child compare those on my 930 and 947.
BB_1903_title_recto: The Virgin seated on the ground with the Child on her left knee. He reaches out toward the infant John, who faces Him, while above the latter Joseph throws up his hands in delight. Below, torso of a Child.
BB_1903_text_recto: Study for a picture not un like Granacci's Holy Family at the Pitti Gallery (No. 345), and resembling also two drawings ascribed to Fra Paolino, but also by Granacci, No. 979. The spirit, the types, and the pen-stroke are distinctly Granacci's. With the Child compare those on Nos. 930 and 947.

BB_1961_title_recto: Giovane donna ammantata, seduta per terra, volta a destra, ma vista da tergo e, su scala minore, leggero schizzo di Apollo
BB_1961_title_verso: Giovane dai lunghi riccioli, seduto per terra, in un ampio mantello e in profilo a sinistra, con le braccia tese verso un paesaggio; dietro di lui la parte inferiore di un nudo maschile eccessivamente allungato ed esile.
BB_1961_text_recto: questo foglio era attribuito al Pesellino per la buona ragione che la figura femminile è copiata dalla predella del Pesellino agli Uffizi (n. 8355), che raffigura «Sant'Antonio che fa cercare il cuore dell'Avaro». Però la tecnica disegnativa ricorda non già gli anni mediani del Quattrocento, ma i priini anni del Cinquecento; e l'Apollo tradisce una ricerca di contrapposto che fa pensare a Michelangelo, ma non al Pesellino. Questa figura ha inoltre le proporzioni e la struttura di un altro nudo del Granacci (BB n. 922) e la sua mano è identica alla mano destra della donna in BB n. 948. Il tratto e la tecnica sono esattamente siinili a quelli dei due disegni ora ricordati.
BB_1961_text_verso: il giovane seduto è copiato dal San Giovanni nella Pietà al centro della predella dell'«Incoronazione» del Beato Angelico al Louvre (n. 1290), ma il profilo e le mani sono decisamente del Granacci e le pieghe si avvicinano a quelle di un altro disegno del Granacci, BB n. 947. Quanto al nudo, esile ed allungato, esso riappare in BB n. 982 e le sue proporzioni sono cosi impensabili al tempo del Pesellino, com'erano invece frequenti a un'epoca più vicina al Cellini.
BB_1938_title_recto: Draped young woman seated on ground, turning to right, but seen from behind; also vague sketch of Apollo.
BB_1938_title_verso: Young man, with curling long locks heavily draped, sits on the ground facing to Ieft, with hands held out towards a landscape; also lower part of excessively slender nude like my 982C.
BB_1938_text_recto: This sheet is ascribed to Pesellino, for the good reason that the female figure on the recto is copied after one in Pesellino's predella at the Uffizi representing St. Anthony causing the miser's heart to be sought for. It is, however, done in a technique that recalls not the earlier middle years of the fifteenth, but the earliest years of the sixteenth century. Turning to the Apollo, we note a search for contrapposto which suggests Michelangelo, but not Pesellino. This figure has, moreover, the exact proportions and build of Granacci's nude on my 922. His hand is identical with the right hand on my 948. The stroke and the technique are exactly as in the two last-mentioned drawings. Reversing the sheet we see, obviously drawn by the same person, a nude of proportions as undreamt of in Pesellino's time as they were frequent in an epoch closer to Cellini's. The seated figure on the verso is copied from the St. John in the Pietà of the predella to Fra Angelico's Coronation at the Louvre. The profile and hands are decidedly Granacci's, and the folds approach those on my 947 by the same artist.
BB_1903_title_recto: A draped Young Woman seated on the ground, turning to right, but seen from behind. Copy after a figure in Pesellino's predella at the Florence Academy representing St. Antony causing the miser's heart to be sought for. Also a vague sketch of an Apollo.
BB_1903_title_verso: Young Man, with curling long locks heavily draped, sits on the ground facing to left, with hands held out toward a landscape. Also lower part of excessively slender Nude.
BB_1903_text_recto: This sheet is ascribed to Pesellino, for the good reason that the female figure corresponds to one of Pesellino's. A careful student must quickly perceive, however, that even this figure is done in a technique that recalls not the earlier middle years of the fifteenth, but the earliest years of the sixteenth century. Turning to the Apollo, we note a search for coutraposto which suggests Michelangelo, but not Pesellino. This figure has, moreover, the exact proportions and build of Granacci's nude on No. 922. His hand is identical with the right hand on No. 948. The stroke and the technique are exactly as in the two last-mentioned drawings. Reversing the sheet we see, obviously drawn by the same person, a nude of proportions as undreamt of in Pesellino's time as they were frequent in an epoch closer to Cellini's. The seated figure has a profile and hands decidedly Granacci's, and folds that approach those on No. 947 by the same artist.

BB_1961_title_recto: Figura ammantata, seduta in profilo a destra
BB_1961_text_recto: Ha il tipo somatico ed il carattere delle figure in BB nn. 933 e 938, ma qui la tecnica disegnativa si avvicina più a quella di David Ghirlandajo, quale appare in BB n. 786. Già attribuito al Pesellino.
BB_1938_title_recto: Draped seated figure in profile to right.
BB_1938_text_recto: Ascribed to Pesellino. Exact type and character of the figures on my 933 and 938, but of a technique nearer David's, as, for instance in my 786, which I ascribe to the latter.
BB_1903_title_recto: Draped seated figure in profile to right.
BB_1903_text_recto: He is of the exact type and character of the figures on Nos. 933 and 938, but of a technique nearer David's, as, for instance, in No. 786, which I ascribe to the latter. Catalogued as Pesellino's.

BB_1961_title_recto: Due figure genuflesse, l'una in profilo a sinistra, l'altra vista frontalmente
BB_1961_text_recto: Già attribuito al Credi, ma il tipo e la mano sono certamente del Granacci.
BB_1938_title_recto: Two kneeling figures, one in profile to left, the other seen frontally. Studies chiefly of drapery.
BB_1938_text_recto: Ascribed to Credi, but the type and the hand are certainly Granacci's. According to Jakobsen studies for the St. Jerome in the Berlin Assumption and for the St. Michael in the Uffizi altar-piece (No. 1596).
BB_1903_title_recto: Two kneeling figures in profile to left-studies chiefly of drapery.
BB_1903_text_recto: Ascribed to Credi, but the type and the hand are certainly Granacci's.

BB_1961_title_recto: Tarchiato nudo maschile, seduto con le mani legate dietro la schiena
BB_1961_title_verso: Torso di un nudo.
BB_1961_text_recto: attribuito al Pollajuolo. Ha lo stesso carattere di BB n. 928.
BB_1961_text_verso: molto caratteristico del Granacci.
BB_1938_title_recto: Heavy nude, seated with his hands tied behind him.
BB_1938_title_verso: Torso a nude.
BB_1938_text_recto: ascribed to Piero Pollajuolo. In character of my 928.

BB_1961_title_recto: Giovane uomo in tunica corta, che si volge indietro alzando le mani, come terrorizzato
BB_1961_title_verso: Giovane che si toglie un pruno dal piede.
BB_1961_text_verso: Verselencato per errore con ambo i numeri 974 e 740 nella I edizione.
BB_1938_title_recto: Male figure in short tunic, starting back with hands held up in fright.
BB_1938_title_verso: Seated figure, a repetition of my 949.
BB_1938_text_recto: Dr. B. Degenhart in Rivista d' Arte, 1930, pp. 417-419, points out the connection between this sketch and a figure in the Botticellian panel formerly in the Spiridon Collection and now the property of Senor Cambo of Barcelona, and concludes that the drawing is a study for the painting, the usual fallacy that when a sketch and painting correspond one must have been done for the other. In this case it is probable that Granacci, who so often imitates and follows Botticelli, has copied this figure from a study by that master, for that the Cambo panel was designed by Botticelli in every part should be beyond dispute. On the verso the eclectic Granacci is at his nearest to David Ghirlandajo, while in the other version of the same subject - the classical one of the youth pulling out a thorn from his foot (my 949) - he is nearer to Credi.
BB_1903_title_recto: Figure of a Youth in attitude of starting back.
BB_1903_title_verso: Nude Youth seated, holding his left foot with both hands.

BB_1961_text_recto: Tarda, ma le pieghe ricordano ancora quelle di un disegno molto anteriore, BB n. 937, attribuito al Credi.
