Il contrasto fra questo mondo demoniaco e quello della logica armonia è oggi guastato dal fatto che ben poco rimane della parte inferiore e che la parte superiore, dei tronchi e delle fronde, ha acquistato, nelle successive ridipinture, una pesante meccanicità. La decorazione della Sala delle Assi fu compiuta da Leonardo nel 1498, verso la fine del primo periodo milanese.

BB_1961_title_recto: Piccolo codice databile circa 1490 Contiene vari schizzi di cui i più interessanti per noi sono il profilo di un vecchio, un altro profilo, ed alcune caricature
BB_1938_title_recto: Small codex containing sketches. The most interesting to us are the profile head of an old man, another profile and some caricatures.
BB_1903_title_recto: A small codex containing sketches. The most interesting to us are the profile Head of an Old Man, another profile and some caricatures.

BB_1961_title_recto: A sinistra, scaramuccia di cavalli galoppanti, e, a destra, uomo caduto per terra
BB_1961_title_verso: Debole schizzo di un cavallo.
BB_1961_text_recto: con tutta probabilità studi per la «Battaglia di Anghiari» (1503-4) e simili agli analoghi studi a Venezia e a Windsor.
BB_1961_text_verso: non di Leonardo.

BB_1961_title_recto: Cavallo e cavaliere, ambedue volti verso sinistra e la testa del cavaliere in due posizioni differenti
BB_1961_text_recto: Quasi identico allo schizzo Holland-Hibbert (BB n. 1013 A), ma in condizioni molto migliori.
BB_1938_title_recto: Sketch for horse and rider, both slightly turning to Ieft and the rider's head in two different positions.
BB_1938_text_recto: Almost identical with the Hoiland-Hibbert sketch (my 1044D) but in much better state.

BB_1961_title_recto: Grazioso schizzo, in un tondo,  di un giovane addormentato sotto un albero con la testa appoggiata alle braccia e vicino alla sua testa una lucertola che lotta con un serpe Varie linee di scrittura la spiegano come un'Allegoria della Fedeltà
BB_1961_title_verso: Una nicchia con dentro tre figure, una pianta architettonica e linee di scrittura.
BB_1961_text_verso: Versapparentemente uno schizzo per l'allestimento di una scena. Un tipo simile di nicchia appare nel Codice Arundel, fol. 231 verso. Fine del secondo periodo milanese (1508-13).
BB_1938_title_recto: Dainty sketch of a youthful figure asleep under a tree with his head resting on his arms and close to his head a lizard fighting with a snake. Several lines of writing explain it as an Allegory of Faithfulness.
BB_1938_title_verso: Niche with three figures in it, an architectural plan and some writing.
BB_1938_text_verso: apparently sketch for the setting of a stage. A similar type of niche appears in the Arundel MS., fol. 231 verso. End of second Milanese period.

BB_1961_title_recto: Quattro studi, due dei quali iscritti in una cornice centinata, per una Vergine genuflessa in adorazione del Bambino, e due schizzi per il Bambino disteso per terra
BB_1961_text_recto: Studi per una Natività, con o senza pastori, che sembra occupasse la mente di Leonardo già prima che fosse assorbito dalla creazione dell'incompiuta «Epifania» degli Uffizi (n. 1594) del 1481. Lo studio in basso a sinistra e ancor più quello al centro, con San Giovannino, ove la figura della Vergine si muove con un certo contrapposto, sembrano anticipare la «Vergine delle Rocce» del 1483. Vari dipinti fiorentini del Cinquecento si ispirarono al gruppo centrale: vedi la «Madonna con San Giovannino» nei Magazzini degli Uffizi, quella già appartenente a Henry Harris a Londra e quella nella collezione Melzi d'Eril a Milano.
BB_1938_title_recto: Four different studies for a Madonna kneeling with outspread hands wistfully adoring the Child.
BB_1938_text_recto: For a Nativity either by itself or combined with an Adoration of the Shepherds, which seems to have preoccupied Leonardo just before getting absorbed in the creation of the unfinished Epiphany. It is interesting that in the two sketches with a certain contrapposto, particularly the central one with the infant Baptist in it, there is an anticipation of the Virgin of the Rocks. Florentine paintings of the 16th century inspired by this central group are to be seen in the Uffizi depot and in Mr. Henry Harris' Collection while a Milanese one exists in the Melzi d' Eril Collection in Milan.

BB_1961_title_recto: Profilo a sinistra di un uomo dai capelli arruffati e dal naso poderoso
BB_1961_text_recto: VASARI Soc., I, vii, 2, dove viene confrontato col famoso profilo di guerriero nel British Museum, BB n. 1035, che tuttavia è molto più tardo.
BB_1938_title_recto: Profile to left of man with shaggy hair and powerful nose.
BB_1938_text_recto: Vasari Soc., I, vii, 2, where it is compared to the famous profile of a warrior in the British Museum (my 1035). It is, however, much later.

BB_1961_title_recto: Testa femminile china, quasi in profilo, verso destra
BB_1961_text_recto: Studio per la Vergine nella «Madonna con Sant'Anna» al Louvre (n. 1598) del 1501.
BB_1938_title_recto: Head of the Virgin for the Louvre version of the Madonna with St. Anne.
BB_1903_title_recto: Head of the Virgin for the Louvre version of the Madonna with St. Anne.

BB_1961_title_recto: Orso che cammina verso sinistra, sovrapposto ad uno schizzo di donna seduta, ad esso peprendicolare
Profilo a destra di uno zingaro che guarda verso l'alto
BB_1961_text_recto: Contemporaneo alla «Battaglia di Anghiari» (1503-4). Sospetto fortemente che il Vasari intendesse questa testa quando nella sua Vita di Leonardo nomina uno «Scaramuccia capitano de' Zingari, che poi ebbe Messer Donato Valdambrini lassatogli del Giambullari».
BB_1938_title_recto: Portrait of a Gipsy in profile, turned up to right.
BB_1938_text_recto: Contemporary with the Battle of the Standard. I strongly suspect that it was this head which Vasari had in mind when he was writing in his Life of Leonardo, of '' Scaramuccia capitano de' Zingari, che poi ebbe Messer Donato Valdambrini lassatogli del Giambullari."
BB_1903_title_recto: Portrait of a Gipsy in profile, turned up to right.
BB_1903_text_recto: I strongly suspect that it was this head which Vasari had in mind when writing in his life of Leonardo, of "Scaramuccia capitano de' Zingari, che poi ebbe Messer Donato Valdambrini lassatogli del Giambullari".

BB_1961_title_recto: Schizzi allegorici del Piacere e del Dolore e molte linee di scrittura
BB_1961_title_verso: Schizzi allegorici dell'Invidia e molte linee di scrittura.
BB_1961_text_verso: Versnella I edizione il verso è indicato sotto il numero 1053.
BB_1938_title_recto: AIIegory of Pleasure and Pain.
BB_1938_title_verso: Allegory of Envy - an exact illustration to the text on the same sheet.
BB_1938_text_recto: The verso is listed under my 1053 in First Edition.
BB_1903_title_recto: Allegory of Pleasure and Pain.
BB_1903_title_verso: Allegory of Envy - an exact illustration to the text on the same sheet.

BB_1961_title_recto: Cavaliere che irrompe sul nemico caduto;ruote dentate; nudo che lavora ad una macina; diverse linee di scrittura in due colonne
BB_1961_title_verso: Studi di balestre.
BB_1961_text_recto: il cavaliere è forse per la «Battaglia di Anghiari» (1503-5).
BB_1938_title_recto: Horseman at full speed attacking fallen foe. Cogwheels, and a nude working a treadmill. Also several lines of writing in two columns. The horseman is probably for the Battle of the Standard.
BB_1938_title_verso: Studies of crossbows.
BB_1903_title_recto: A Horseman at full speed attacking a fallen foe. Cog-wheels, and a Nude working a treadmill. Also several lines of writing in two columns. The horseman is probably for the Battle of the Standard.
BB_1903_title_verso: Studies of crossbows.

BB_1961_title_recto: Torso volto a destra e braccio destro, visibile fino al polso; nell'angolo superiore destro, indicazione di una guancia e di capelli ricciuti
BB_1961_text_recto: Studio per l'Arcangelo Gabriele nell'«Annunciazione» degli Uffizi (n. 1618) del 1473.
BB_1938_title_recto: Study for draped right shoulder and arm of angel in Uffizi Annunciation. This is in pen. In red chalk the line of a cheek with curling hair.
BB_1903_title_recto: Study for draped right shoulder and arm of Angel of the Annunciation. This is in pen. In red chalk the line of a cheek with curling hair.

BB_1961_title_recto: Allegoria che si crede rappresenti lo stato politico di Milano nella fine del Quattrocento
BB_1961_title_verso: Allegoria della Fama e della Prudenza.
BB_1938_title_recto: Allegory representing, it is suggested, the political state of Milan at the end of the 15th century.
BB_1938_title_verso: Allegory of Fame and Prudence.
BB_1903_title_recto: An allegory representing, it is suggested, the Political State of Milan at the end of the fifteenth century. A female figure with two faces, one being of an Old Man seated on a cage, while another Female holds up a mirror in which the old face is reflected. In the cage serpents, at which dogs, egged on by an eagle and a satyr, are biting.
BB_1903_title_verso: An Archer and a Lancer.

BB_1961_title_recto: Cavaliere su un cavallo impennato che si difende con una lunga spada dall'attacco di un grifone
BB_1938_title_recto: Rider on rearing horse defending himself with long sword against attack of griphon.
BB_1938_text_recto: The attitude of the horseman anticipates one of the wellknown figures in the Battle of the Standard. The contours and the hatching seem earlier, although not as I used to think as early as the Adoration.
BB_1903_title_recto: Two Horsemen-for background of the Adoration.

BB_1961_title_recto: Giovane donna che accenna all'unicorno accucciato ai suoi piedi
BB_1961_text_recto: Ancor più amabile del soggetto simile al British Museum, BB n. 1024 verso.
BB_1938_title_recto: Young woman pointing to a unicorn at her feet. Even lovelier than the similar subject at the British Museum (my 1024 verso).
BB_1903_title_recto: A Young vVoman pointing to a Unicorn at her feet. Even lovelier than the similar subject at the British Museum.

BB_1961_title_recto: Due uoroini seduti che si mettono o si tolgono le scarpe; varie macchine e utensili
BB_1938_title_recto: Two men sitting and putting on or taking off their shoes. Also various machines and implements.
BB_1938_text_recto: The technique and style of drawing would suit the epoch of the Adoration, but as we see in my 1065, where on the one side we find studies for an Adoration of the Shepherds and on the other for a Last Supper, so here we find him preoccupied with the motive of Christ washing the feet of two Disciples. People taking off or putting on their sandals and one at the same time putting his hand to his head, as Peter does traditionally when Christ kneels before him, suits this subject, and better than it does palefreniers and other menials in the background of the Adoration, and it would seem odd that Leonardo would have used them for such a low purpose without becoming aware of parodying sacred writ, as it were.
BB_1903_title_recto: Three Men putting on their shoes. One of them lifts his hand to his forehead, in the traditional attitude of Peter amazed at the condescension of his Master. Certainly sketch for a Christ washing the feet of His disciples. Also some implements.

BB_1961_title_recto: Leggero schizzo di una Vergine dell'Umiltà col Bambino seduto sul Suo ginocchio, alla quale viene presentato San Giovannino da una figura femminile che potrebbe essere Sant'Elisabetta od un Angelo
BB_1961_title_verso: Vari studi di prospettiva.
BB_1961_text_recto: Il Bodmer lo pensa una prima idea per la «Vergine delle Rocce», ma a sostegno della sua ipotesi c'è solo il fatto che il numero delle figure è lo stesso nelle due composizioni e che la terza figura, nel nostro disegno, sembra troppo giovane per una Sant'Elisabetta. Nei disegni di Fra Bartolommeo derivati da questo (BB nn. 405, 406, 466) la figura che presenta San Giovannino è un Angelo. Il motivo risale al Verrocchio, e ancor più addietro a Fra Filippo. La sola differenza è che qui Madre e Figlio sono seduti per terra, come nella «Madonna dell'Umiltà». Quel motivo religioso, arcaico e sorpassato, fu ripreso da Leonardo per ragioni puramente compositive ed egli lo trasmise poi a Raffaello, a Fra Bartolommeo e a Andrea del Sarto, il quale gli dette la più alta realizzazione nella «Madonna del Sacco». Altre eco della preoccupazione di Leonardo per questo tema esistono agli Uffizi: un tocco in penna da me dato al Granacci (vedi BB n. 955) ove la Sant'Elisabetta è sostituita da un San Giuseppe intensamente leonardesco, e una rozza copia acquarellata a bistro (Uffizi n. 206 F). Le assurdità del panneggio in questa copia, dimostrano che nell'originale le pieghe dovevano appartenere al periodo fiorentino di Leonardo anziché alla sua tarda carriera. Il motivo non fu dimenticato né in Toscana né a Milano. Suida riproduce una incisione ottocentesca da un tondo perduto del primo Cinquecento, possibilmente milanese e un dipinto agli Uffizi attribuito ad Alfani, ma probabilmente del Soggi, raffigurante la «Madonna, Sant'Elisabetta ed i due Bambini». Sono ambedue reminiscenze dello schizzo suddetto.
BB_1938_title_recto: Light sketch of the Virgin seated on the ground holding the Child on her knee while to her right the infant Baptist is presented to her by a female figure which might be taken either for a St. Elizabeth or for an angel.
BB_1938_title_verso: Various studies of perspective.
BB_1938_text_recto: Bodmer thinks the recto may have been a first idea for the Virgin of the Rocks, a suggestion that has little to support it beyond the fact that the two designs have the same number of figures, and possibly that the third figure in the drawing seems too youthful for a St. Elizabeth. In Fra Bartolommeo's imitations of this design (see for instance my 405, 406, 466) the accompanying figure is an angel. The motive goes back to Verrocchio and, further still, to Fra Filippo. The only difference is that the two principal figures are seated on the ground like the Madonna of Humility, which as a religious motivre had gone out, but which Leonardo took up again for purely compositional reasons and handed on to Raphael and Fra Bartolommeo and to Andrea del Sarto, who gave it its highest realization in the Madonna del Sacco. Other echoes of Leonardo's preoccupation with this composition exist: one in the Uffizi which I ascribed to Granacci (see my 955) and in which we have an intensely Leonardesque Joseph in the place of Elizabeth, and another also in the Uffizi (206F), a rough copy in bistre and wash of exactly the same motive. The value of this copy is that it allows us to see through the absurdities of the draperies that the folds belong most probably to the Florentine and not to a late period of Leonardo's career. The motive was not forgotten, either in Tuscany or in Milan. Suida reproduces as No. 65 a 19th century engraving after a lost tondo of the early 16th century, possibly Milanese and as No. 67 a painting in the Uffizi attributed to Alfani but probably by Soggi representing the Madonna, Elizabeth and the two Children. Both are reminiscent of the last-mentioned sketch.
BB_1903_title_recto: Mary and Elizabeth with their Children.
BB_1903_title_verso: Machinery.

BB_1961_title_recto: Unicorno che affonda il corno nel terreno, a penna; a destra, le parti posteriori di un cavallo, a punta d'argento
BB_1938_title_recto: Unicorn digging its horn into the ground. To the right the hind-quarters of a horse.
BB_1938_text_recto: First Milanese period.

BB_1961_title_recto: Testa di vecchio
BB_1938_title_recto: Head of an old man.
BB_1938_text_recto: First Milanese period.
BB_1903_title_recto: Head of an Old Man turned slightly to the left.

BB_1961_title_recto: Studio di panni che avvolgono le gambe di una persona seduta frontalmente
BB_1938_title_recto: Cast of drapery over lower part of seated figure.
BB_1903_title_recto: Cast of drapery over lower part of seated figure.
BB_1903_text_recto: This interesting study may have been done by Leonardo before he left Verrocchio's studio. It dates, at all events, from early in the artist's career, when his own manner had not emerged completely from the school which produced him. It was destined to be much imitated. Credi made an exact copy of it (Malcolm Collection, No. 23), and Ghirlandajo adopted it with slight changes for the drapery of the Virgin in his Uffizi altar-piece (No. 1297).

BB_1961_title_recto: Busto di dama in profilo a destra
BB_1961_title_verso: La perforazione che forma un contorno completo, è stata aiutata con inchiostro, sulla fronte e sul naso.
BB_1961_text_recto: Il merito di aver identificato in questo cartone il ritratto di Isabella d'Este spetta a Charles Yriarte. Isabella, come è noto, posò per Leonardo nel Febbraio del 1500.
BB_1938_title_recto: Bust of lady in profile to right - cartoon for portrait of Isabella d'Este.
BB_1938_title_verso: The pricking makes a complete design and has been helped out with ink over forehead and nose.
BB_1938_text_recto: The resulting profile, as simple and direct as the famous Piero Pollajuolo in the Poldi Pezzoli, Milan, corresponds very likely to what Leonardo did from the life and transferred to the panel before giving this cartoon the finish of an independent work of art. The credit of first recognizing Isabella in this cartoon is due to the late Charles Yriarte. As is well known she sat to Leonardo early in 1500.
BB_1903_title_recto: Bust of a lady in profile to right - cartoon for the portrait of Isabella d'Este.
BB_1903_text_recto: The credit of recognising Isabella in this cartoon is due to the late M. Charles Yriarte. As is well known, she sat to Leonardo early in 1500. Pricked for transfer.

BB_1961_title_recto: Panni che avvolgono le gambe di una figura seduta verso destra
BB_1961_text_recto: Studio per la veste della Vergine nella «Madonna con Sant'Anna» al Louvre (n. 1598).
BB_1938_title_recto: Study for the drapery of the Virgin in the Louvre version of the Madonna with St. Anne.
BB_1903_title_recto: Study for the drapery of the Virgin in the Louvre version of the Madonna with St. Anne.

BB_1961_title_recto: In un paese roccioso, fra animali allegorici, un uomo riflette il sole in uno specchio
BB_1961_text_recto: La fattura è sorvegliata, non ha la scioltezza delle improvvisazioni giovanili. Probabilmente è un disegno assai tardo. Una copia fedele di questa allegoria, che sembra una scena di incantesimo, si trova nel British Museum (n. Pp. 1-33). Un confronto del testo è istruttivo. Il British Museum possiede inoltre una magnifica incisione contemporanea, probabilmente di mano milanese, presa da questo foglio: ma per la figura nuda, che appare nell'incisione, Leonardo deve aver fornito uno schizzo separato.
BB_1938_title_recto: Allegory, possibly of an incantation. A little tight, and probably quite late.
BB_1938_text_recto: An exact copy of this passes at the British Museum for an original. A comparison of the torso is instructive. A magnificent contemporary engraving in the British Museum, probably by a Milanese hand, was taken from this study. But for the nude figure in the print Leonardo must have furnished a separate sketch.
BB_1903_title_recto: An allegory possibly of an Incantation.
BB_1903_text_recto: An exact copy of this passes at the British Museum for an original. A comparison of the torso is instructive. A magnificent contemporary engraving in the British Museum, probably by a Milanese hand, was taken from this study. But for the nude figure in the print Leonardo must have furnished a separate sketch.

BB_1961_title_recto: Sei figure virili, principalmente di nudi
BB_1961_title_verso: Leggero studio per una Madonna e vari nudi, alcuni altri in conversazione, altri ancora isolati.
BB_1961_text_recto: Questi studi sono variamente riferiti o ad un'Ultima Cena o ad un'Epifania. Ambedue i riferimenti mi sembrano giusti. Lo stile corrisponde all'attività giovanile di Leonardo, e le figure in conversazione non potevano essere intese per altro tema se non l'Epifania. Allo stesso tempo, i nudi a tavola e la figura singola (raffigurante certamente lo stesso Cristo) a un'altra tavola, sono evidentemente studi per un'Ultima Cena. Se ne deduce, quindi, che Leonardo, mentre era ancora impegnato dall'«Epifania» degli Uffizi (n. 1594) del 1481, già stava progettando un'Ultima Cena; naturalmente, ciò non implica di necessità che egli intendesse dipingerne una immediatamente.
BB_1938_title_recto: Six figures, chiefly nudes, for the Adoration, of about the same quality as the sheet at Cologne.
BB_1938_title_verso: Slight study for a Madonna in black chalk and nudes at a table, others in conversation, and still others by themselves in ink.
BB_1938_text_recto: These studies are variously designated as either for a Last Supper or for an Adoration. It seems to me that both designations are right. The style of the drawing points clearly to Leonardo's earlier years, and the figures in conversation can scarcely have been intended for any other purpose than the Epiphany. At the same time, the nudes at the table, and the single figure, surely representing Christ Himself, at another table, are plainly for a Last Supper. If all this be so, then this interesting result follows: that while Leonardo was still engaged upon his Adoration, he was already planning a Last Supper-not, of course, necessarily with the immediate intention of painting one.
BB_1903_title_recto: Six figures,chiefly Nudes, for the Adoration, of about the same quality as the sheet at Cologne.
BB_1903_title_verso: Nudes at a table, others in conversation, and still others by themselves, variously designated as studies either for a Last Supper or for an Adoration.
BB_1903_text_recto: It seems to me that both designations are right. The style of the drawing points clearly to Leonardo's earlier years, and the figures in conversation can scarcely have been intended for any other purpose than the Epiphany. At the same time, the nudes at the table, and the single figure, surely representing Christ Himself, at another table, are plainly for a Last Supper. If all this be so, then this interesting result follows: that while Leonardo was still engaged upon his Adoration, he was already planning a Last Supper - not, of course, necessarily with the immediate intention of painting one.

BB_1961_title_recto: Alabarde, aste ed altre armi
BB_1938_title_recto: Halberds, spears and various other weapons.
BB_1938_text_recto: First Milanese period.

BB_1961_title_recto: Madonna con San Giovannino
BB_1961_title_verso: Frammenti di un ornamento.
BB_1961_text_recto: Anche qui la Madonna appare seduta per terra come nel foglio ad Oxfors, BB n. 1059.
BB_1938_title_recto: Small study for Madonna with Infant John. Here too the Madonna appears seated on the ground as in the Oxford sheet, my 1059.
BB_1938_title_verso: Fragments of ornament.
BB_1903_title_recto: Small study for the Madonna with the Infant John.

BB_1961_title_recto: Testa di putto, volta verso destra
BB_1961_text_recto: Studio per il San Giovannino nella «Vergine delle Rocce» (Louvre n. 1599) del 1483.
BB_1938_title_recto: Study for head of Baptist in the Virgin of the Rocks.
BB_1903_title_recto: Study for the head of the Baptist in the "Vierge aux Rochers." So much made over as scarcely to count as Leonardo's.

BB_1961_title_recto: Studio per il panneggio di una figura inginocchiata in profilo a destra, presumibilmente un Angelo; nell'angolo superiore a sinistra porta il numero romano I
BB_1938_title_recto: Study for the drapery of figure kneeling in profile to right, presumably an ig. 521 angel. In upper Ieft corner the Roman numeral I.
BB_1903_title_recto: Study for the drapery of figure kneeling in profile to right, presumably an Angel.
BB_1903_text_recto: Ascribed to Leonardo, but more lilkely by some unknown fellow pupil of his under Verrocchio.

BB_1961_title_recto: Fortezza con un'alta torre, forse intesa per un faro
BB_1938_title_recto: Sketch of fortress with high tower, perhaps intended for a lighthouse.

BB_1961_title_recto: Busto di giovane donna che guarda in basso, girata quasi in profilo verso sinistra
BB_1961_title_verso: La stessa testa della donna sul recto, tracciata a penna da mano più cruda.
BB_1961_text_recto: in basso, non di mano di Leonardo, e perciò omesso nella riproduzione, schizzo molto rapido della parte superiore di una figura virile nuda, quasi di profilo a sinistra. Anche la linea che segna il profilo sembra così dura da far supporre che il disegno sia stato ripassato da un'altra mano. Lo si considera generalmente come uno studio per la «Madonna Litta», ora a Leningrado (n. 13 A), ca. 1480-85.
BB_1938_title_recto: Head of a young woman looking down almost in profile to Ieft.
BB_1938_title_verso: The woman's head traced by cruder hand in ink.
BB_1938_text_recto: below very rapid sketch of upper part of nude male figure almost in profile Ieft not by Leonardo. The outlines of the face on the recto seem so stiff that they may have been gone over by another hand.  Generally considered as a study for the Madonna Litta.

BB_1961_title_recto: Studio dell'incompiuta «Epifania» degli Uffizi (n 1594) del 1481
BB_1961_title_verso: Nudo seduto con un ginocchio alzato, che si appoggia alla mano destra.
BB_1938_title_recto: Study for the entire composition of the Adoration, the most elaborated and delightfur of the series. Left to the Louvre by the late M. Galichon.
BB_1938_title_verso: Seated nude figure, leaning on right hand, and with knee lifted up, for same composition.
BB_1938_text_recto: The nudes composing the episodes in the middle distance in the stable yard are, it is most curious to note, reminiscent of Fra Angelico's Adoration of the Magi, finished by Fra Filippo, in the Cook Collection at Richmond.
BB_1903_title_recto: Study for the entire composition of the Adoration, the most elaborated and delightfl of the series. Left to the Louvre by the late M. Galichon.

BB_1961_title_recto: Madonna volta a destra che porge una fruttiera al Bambino, il quale ne toglie frutta con la mano sinistra, mentre imbocca la Madre con l'altra mano
BB_1961_title_verso: Studio architettonico per una volta.
BB_1961_text_recto: nel 1900 portava ancora l'attribuzione a Raffaello sebbene B. de Tauzia e Ch. Ephrussi ne avessero da lungo tempo riconosciuto l'autore.
BB_1938_title_recto: Madonna, turned to right holding in right hand a vase, from which the Child takes fruit, while He caresses her cheek.
BB_1938_title_verso: Study of vaulting.
BB_1938_text_recto: The drawing on the recto was still ascribed to Raphael in 1900 despite the fact that M. de Tauzia and M. Ephrussi had long since recognized its authorship. It must have been the sketch for a picture very close to the Benois Madonna but done a little later and on the way to the Madonna in the unfinished Adoration.
BB_1903_title_recto: The Madonna, turned to right, holds in her right hand a vase, from which the Child takes fruit, while He caresses her cheek.
BB_1903_text_recto: Still ascribed to Raphael, despite the fact that M. de Tauzia, and M. Ephrussi before him, have long since recognised its authorship. It dates from the time of the Adoration, to the Madonna in which the one here bears a strong remblance.

BB_1961_title_recto: Piccolo e rovinato studio per una Madonna con Sant'Anna
BB_1961_text_recto: Interessante documento di uno stadio intermedio, nella composizione del gruppo, fra il cartone BB n. 1039 ed il dipinto al Louvre.
BB_1938_title_recto: Small and ruined study for the Madonna with St. Anne. Interesting as indicating a stage in the composition between the cartoon and the picture.
BB_1903_title_recto: Small and ruined study for the Madonna with St. Anne. Interesting as indicating a stage in the composition between the cartoon and the picture.

BB_1961_title_recto: Studio di panni che ricadono sull'eretta figura di un uomo barbuto, volto a destra, con le braccia piegate sotto il petto e le mani nascoste entro maniche ampie; nell'angolo superiore sinistro porta il numero romano III
BB_1938_title_recto: Draped figure of bearded man facing to right with arms folded under his chest and hands hidden in ample sleeves; in upper left corner the Roman numeral III.

BB_1961_title_recto: Studio di panni intorno ad una figura volta verso destra
BB_1961_text_recto: Sembra sia stato rimpicciolito in alto ed in basso. Più semplice del precedente e ad esso anteriore.
BB_1938_title_recto: Study of drapery for figure facing right.
BB_1938_text_recto: Seems to have been shortened at top and bottom. Simpler and earlier than last.

BB_1961_title_recto: Testa di giovane donna girata leggermente a sinistra, con lo sguardo chino ed i capelli raccolti in un'elaborata acconciatura
BB_1938_title_recto: Head of young woman with elaborately arranged hair turned slightly to left, looking down.

BB_1961_title_recto: Tutti questi manoscritti, portati in Francia da Napoleone I nel 1796 contengono schizzi di commento al testo, alcuni di grande bellezza
BB_1961_text_recto: Codex A (1492), B (ca. 1484-86), C (1490), D (probabilmente del secondo periodo fiorentino), E (1513-14), F (1508), G (1511-15), H (ca. 1494), I (ca. 1497), K (in tre periodi di tempo diversi), L (1502), M (fine periodo Sforzesco) e Codici Ashburnham 2038 e 2037, complementi dei Codici A e B.
BB_1938_title_recto: Containing various sketches scattered through them chiefly as illustrations to the text, some of them of great beauty.
BB_1903_title_recto: Containing various sketches scattered through them, chiefly as illustrations to the text, some of them of great beauty.
Cataloguer's Question: I put datation of Codex in text BB 1961.

BB_1961_title_recto: Studio di panni che avvolgono una figura genuflessa verso sinistra, ricadendo dalla spalla e spargendosi sul suolo
BB_1961_text_recto: Variante meno geometrica di BB n. 1037 A.
BB_1938_title_recto: Variant of the Malcolm cast of drapery (my 1037A), slightly less geometrical.

BB_1961_title_recto: Studio di panni che avvolgono la parte inferiore di una figura inginocchiata verso destra, forse un Angelo Gabriele
BB_1961_text_recto: Sembrerebbe eseguito dopo BB nn. 1014 A e 1067 A, perché assai più sciolto.
BB_1938_title_recto: Drapery of figure kneeling to right with torso barely indicated.

BB_1961_title_recto: Studio di panni che avvolgono i ginocchi di una figura seduta, forse una Vergine Annunziata
BB_1938_title_recto: Cast of drapery for seated figure, perhaps for Virgin Annunciate. Variant of my 1015C.

BB_1961_title_recto: Studio di panneggio trattenuto sul petto da una figura eretta in profilo a destra Iscritto XII nell'angolo superiore sinistro
BB_1961_text_recto: Variante di BB n. 1070A, fatta forse fra BB nn. 1070A e 1070B.
BB_1938_title_recto: Variant of my 1070A, done perhaps between 1070A and 1070B; in upper Ieft-hand corner the Roman numeral XII.

BB_1961_title_recto: Studio di panni che avvolgono il sedile e la gamba destra di una figura seduta in profilo verso sinistra
BB_1961_text_recto: Quasi il contrapposto del famoso studio, alquanto posteriore, al Louvre, BB n. 1061.
BB_1938_title_recto: Cast of drapery amply covering right leg of seated figure and flowing out to our right. Almost the reverse of the famous somewhat later study in the Louvre, my 1061.

BB_1961_title_recto: Due cavalieri che lottano con un drago; in basso un giovane nudo su un cavallo galoppante, altri tre cavalli ed un cane che abbaia contro uno di essi
BB_1938_title_recto: Two horsemen fighting a dragon. Below, a nude youth on a galloping horse, three other horses and a dog barking at one of them.
BB_1903_title_recto: Two Horsemen fighting with a Dragon.

BB_1961_title_recto: Cavaliere nudo su un cavallo al galoppo, in basso un altro cavallo visto da tergo e, su scala maggiore, una testa di cavallo in profilo a destra
BB_1961_text_recto: Da riferirsi alla «Battaglia di Anghiari» (1503-4) ed in ogni caso di quel periodo.
BB_1938_title_recto: Nude rider on horse at full gallop, below another horse seen from the back and larger head of a horse in profile to right.
BB_1938_text_recto: In connection with Battle of the Standard and at all events of that period.

BB_1961_title_recto: Undici nudi virili in vari atteggiamenti contemplativi
BB_1961_text_recto: Studi per un'Adorazione dei Pastori o per l'incompiuta «Epifania» degli Uffizi (n. 1594) del 1481.
BB_1938_title_recto: Various nudes for an Adoration of the Shepherds or for the unfinished Epiphany.
BB_1903_title_recto: Various Nudes for the Adoration.

BB_1961_title_recto: Uomini che fuggono d auna bomba, ed altri studi per l'arte della guerra
BB_1938_title_recto: Men escaping from a bomb, and other studies for the Art of War.
BB_1938_text_recto: End of first Milanese period.
BB_1903_title_recto: Men escaping from a bomb, and other studies for the Art of War.

BB_1961_title_recto: Studio per un panneggio intorno alla parte inferiore di una figura nuda
BB_1938_title_recto: Study for drapery around lower part of nude figure.

BB_1961_title_recto: Studio di panni per una figura genuflessa verso sinistra con la testa in tre differenti posizioni
BB_1961_text_recto: L'azione sembra quella di una persona che, dopo essersi mossa rapidamente, si è appena fermata. Si adatterebbe meglio ad un Angelo Annunziante che non ad una Vergine Annunziata. 1957: possibilmente una prima idea per l'«Annunciazione» degli Uffizi (n. 1618); certamente non era destinato alla predella del Louvre (n. 1602 A) che io ora giudico del Credi. Come data sembra precedere il dipinto degli Uffizi e l'azione potrebbe corrispondere a quella di una Vergine adorante in una Natività.
BB_1938_title_recto: Study for a heavily-draped kneeling figure with the head in three different positions.
BB_1938_text_recto: The action seems to be of a person who has just come to rest after moving rapidly. This would suit the Announcing Angel better than the Virgin Annunciate. Not necessarily for the Uffizi Annunciation and certainly not for the predella in the Louvre, which I now believe Credi's. In date probably earlier than Uffizi picture. The action might allow the possibility that the figure was intended for a Virgin in a Nativity.

BB_1961_title_recto: Torso di un vecchio dal gran naso adunco e dal mento proteso in modo grottesco
BB_1961_title_verso: Profilo a sinistra caricaturale di un uomo calvo.
BB_1961_text_recto: Primo periodo milanese (1482-99). La mano è tanto vicina nei tratti essenziali a quella della «Gentildonna con furetto» nel Museo Czartoryski a Cracovia (n. 180, ca. 1483), da persuaderei della loro comune paternità.
BB_1938_title_recto: Torso of old man with big hooked nose and grotesquely protruding chin.
BB_1938_title_verso: Caricatured profile to Ieft of bald man.
BB_1938_text_recto: First Milanese period. The hand of the figure on recto is in essentials like enough to the one in the Cracow portrait to persuade us that both were done by the same artist.

BB_1961_title_recto: Leda seminginocchiata presso le uova rotte da cui spuntano i figli
BB_1938_title_recto: Sketch for half-kneeling Leda.

BB_1961_title_recto: Allegoria dell'ermellino, come simbolo di purità
BB_1961_text_recto: Della fine del secondo periodo milanese (1508-13).
BB_1938_title_recto: Allegory of the ermine as symbol of purity.
BB_1938_text_recto: From end of second Milanese period.

BB_1961_title_recto: Testa di vecchio dalla barba fluente: con ogni probabilità un autoritratto
BB_1961_text_recto: È vero che la persona raffigurata pare più vecchia di quello che avrebbe dovuto essere Leonardo, ma che egli dimostrasse più dei suoi anni è un fatto noto ed accertato .
BB_1938_title_recto: Portrait of old man, in every probability Leonardo himself. Not free from retouches in nostrils and mouth.
BB_1938_text_recto: It is true that the person represented looks older than Leonardo should have looked, but that he seemed much older than his years is a well-known authenticated fact.
BB_1903_title_recto: Portrait of an old Man-in every probability Leonardo himself.
BB_1903_text_recto: It is true that the person represented looks older than Leonardo should have looked, but that he seemed much older than his years is a well authenticated fact.

BB_1961_title_recto: Busto di giovane donna
BB_1961_title_verso: Studio di intrecciature.
BB_1961_text_recto: Studio dal vero, con ogni probabilità per l'Angelo nella «Vergine delle Rocce» del 1483 (Louvre n. 1599).
BB_1938_title_recto: Head of a young woman.
BB_1938_text_recto: Study from the life. In every probability for the angel in the Virgin of the Rooks.
BB_1903_title_recto: Head of a Young Woman. Study from the life.
BB_1903_text_recto: In every probability for the Angel in the "Vierge aux Rochers."

BB_1961_title_recto: Tre punti di vista di una medesima testa maschile che sarebbe, secondo il Richter, quella di un armeno
BB_1938_title_recto: Three views of male head, according to Richter of an Armenian.
BB_1938_text_recto: First Milanese period.
BB_1903_title_recto: Three views of a male head, according to Richter of an Armenian.

BB_1961_title_recto: Studio delle proporzioni di un viso e di un occhio
BB_1961_title_verso: Studi di torchi.
BB_1938_title_recto: Study for proportions of face and !lye.
BB_1903_title_recto: Study for proportions of face and eye.

BB_1961_title_recto: Busto di un vecchio coronato di alloro, in profilo a destra
BB_1938_title_recto: Bust of laurel-wreathed old man in profile to right.
BB_1938_text_recto: Close to my 1028 verso.
BB_1903_title_recto: Bust of a laurel-wreathed Old Man in profile to right.

BB_1961_title_recto: Due studi di un occhio e tre linee di scrittura
BB_1961_title_verso: Studio di un torchio.
BB_1938_title_recto: Two studies of the eye and three lines of writing.
BB_1903_title_recto: Two studies of the eye.

BB_1961_title_recto: Bello studio dei muscoli di un torso e di gambe virili; nudo maschile con sciabola; in scala più piccola, altri nudi; ed ancora più piccoli, cavalli e cavalieri
BB_1938_title_recto: Fine study of the muscles of torso and legs. A male nude with sword. On smaller scale, other nudes; and smaller still, horses and riders.
BB_1903_title_recto: Fine study of the muscles of torso and legs. A male Nude with a sword. On smaller scale, other Nudes; and smaller still, Horses and Riders.

BB_1961_title_recto: Studio di gambe umane
BB_1938_title_recto: Study of human legs.
BB_1938_text_recto: Contemporary with Anghiari Battle.
BB_1903_title_recto: Study of human legs.

BB_1961_title_recto: Studi dell'anatomia esterna del cavallo
BB_1938_title_recto: Legs and breasts of horses.
BB_1903_title_recto: Legs and breasts of horses.

BB_1961_title_recto: Studi di gambe anteriori di cavalli
BB_1938_title_recto: Studies of horses' legs.
BB_1938_text_recto: First Milanese period.
BB_1903_title_recto: Studies of horses' legs.

BB_1961_title_recto: Studi di due insetti, squisitamente finiti
BB_1938_title_recto: Study of two insects-exquisitely finished.
BB_1938_text_recto: First Milanese period.
BB_1903_title_recto: Study of two insects-exquisitely finished.

BB_1961_title_recto: Studio della parte posteriore del cavallo
BB_1961_text_recto: Probabilmente di Leonardo, ma troppo ritoccato per esserne sicuri.

BB_1961_title_recto: Due carri d'assalto con falci per tagliare le membra dei nemici
BB_1938_title_recto: Two machines pulled by horses for mowing the enemy's limbs.
BB_1938_text_recto: First Milanese period.
BB_1903_title_recto: Two Machines pulled by horses for mowing down the enemy's limbs.

BB_1961_title_recto: Tre studi di un soldato che pugnala un uomo prostrato
BB_1938_title_recto: Three sketches for a soldier poniarding a prostrate man for the Battle of the Standard.
BB_1903_title_recto: Three groups of Wrestlers. Below, Nudes attacking-sketches for the Battle of the Standard.

BB_1961_title_recto: Scaramuccia di cavalleria
BB_1938_title_recto: A cavalry skirmish, for the Battle.
BB_1903_title_recto: A cavalry skirmish, for the Battle.

BB_1961_title_recto: Varie scaramucce di cavalleria e fanteria
BB_1938_title_recto: Various cavalry skirmishes, for the Battle.
BB_1903_title_recto: Various cavalry skirmishes, for the Battle.

BB_1961_title_recto: Scaramucce di cavalleria
BB_1938_title_recto: Cavalry skirmishes, for the Battle.
BB_1903_title_recto: Cavalry skirmishes, for the Battle.

BB_1961_title_recto: Schizzo per il corpo nudo di un fanciullo che si volta a destra, con la gamba sinistra piegata al ginocchio
BB_1961_text_recto: Risale al tempo della «Madonna con Sant'Anna» (Louvre n. 1598) del 1501 e potrebbe essere uno studio per il Bambino Gesù in quella composizione. Esso è, però, quasi identico al fanciullo nella «Sacra Famiglia» dipinta dal Melzi, già nella Collezione Nemes, a Monaco, e non mi sorprenderebbe se risultasse della stessa mano, cosi scaltramente affine a quella di Leonardo.
BB_1938_title_recto: Sketch for the naked body of a child turning to right with the Ieft leg bent at the knee.
BB_1938_text_recto: Period of Madonna with St. Anne, for the Child in which it may be a study. It is, however, almost identical with the Child in the Holy Family by Melzi in the former Nemes Collection and it would not overwhelm me with surprise if it turned out to be by the same hand - so trickily close to Leonardo's.

BB_1961_title_recto: Uomo iscritto entro un circolo
BB_1961_text_recto: È uno studio per le proporzioni del corpo umano.
BB_1938_title_recto: Man within a circle. Study for the proportions of the human figure.
BB_1903_title_recto: A Man within a circle. Study for the proportions of the human figure.

BB_1961_title_recto: Profilo a destra di un vecchio con la bocca aperta ed un'espressione intensa
BB_1961_text_recto: Sembra uno studio per la testa fra i due cavalieri che si azzuffano nella «Battaglia di Anghiari» (1503-5).
BB_1938_title_recto: Profile to right of old man with open mouth and intense expression.
BB_1938_text_recto: Looks like a study for the head between two rideril who brandish swords in the Battle of the Standard.
BB_1903_title_recto: Profile to right, of Old Man. In every likelihood authentic, although not perfectly satisfactory.
BB_1903_text_recto: It may have been a study for the head between the two riders who brandish swords in the Battle of the Standard.

BB_1961_title_recto: Due giovani donne che ballano insieme; a sinistra, un'altra figura che fa ondeggiare uno scialle e, all'estrema destra, testa in profilo a sinistra
BB_1938_title_recto: Two young women dancing together and another figure fluttering a shawl.
BB_1938_text_recto: A late drawing, a conclusion at which I arrived independently, confirming both Seidlitz and Bodmer. The latter's suggestion that Leonardo may have been inspired by Mantegna's Parnassus is not at all improbable.
BB_1903_title_recto: Two \'oung \Vomen dancing together and another fluttering a shawl.

BB_1961_title_recto: Schizzo per la «Madonna con Sant'Anna» al Louvre (n 1598) del 1501
BB_1938_title_recto: Sketch for the Louvre version of the Madonna with St. Anne.
BB_1903_title_recto: Sketch for the Louvre version of the Madonna with St. Anne.

BB_1961_title_recto: Testa del Salvatore, forse per un Cristo portacroce
BB_1938_title_recto: Head of the Saviour (perhap!! for a Christ bearing the Cross).
BB_1903_title_recto: Head of the Saviour-perhaps for a Christ bearing the Cross.

BB_1961_title_recto: Cavalleria che attacca la Fanteria; in basso, una messe di lance
BB_1961_title_verso: Macchine per assediare una fortezza.
BB_1938_title_recto: Large sheet with cav.alry charging at infantry; below a harvest of lances.
BB_1938_title_verso: Machines for besieging a fortress.
BB_1903_title_recto: Large sheet with cavalry charging at infantry; below a harvest of lance points-for the Battle of the Standard.

BB_1961_title_recto: Studi di fiori
BB_1938_title_recto: Studies of flowers.
BB_1903_title_recto: Studies of flowers.

BB_1961_title_recto: Busto di vecchio calvo, in profilo a destra, a carboncino ripassato a penna, con la faccia quadrettata; in basso, un giovane galoppante ed un nudo in atteggiamento di cavalcare, a sanguigna
BB_1961_title_verso: Profilo a sinistra, quadrettato.
BB_1961_text_recto: Il giovane galoppante è quasi identico ad un cavaliere a Windsor, BB n. 1224, che quasi certamente è uno studio per la «Battaglia di Anghiari» (1503-5).
BB_1938_title_recto: Sheet containing profiles to right of bald-headed old man in black chalk, gone over with ink and squared (perhaps of earlier date), and in red chalk a youth galloping and a nude in attitude of riding. The youth galloping is nearly identical with one at Windsor (my 1224), almost certainly for the Battle of the Standard.
BB_1938_title_verso: Profile to left, squared.
BB_1903_title_recto: A sheet containing the profiles to right of a bald-headed Old Man in black chalk, and in red chalk a Youth galloping and a Nude in attitude of riding. The youth galloping is nearly identical with one at Windsor, almost certainly for the Battle of the Standard.
BB_1903_title_verso: A profile to left, squared.

BB_1961_title_recto: Studio per l'«Ultima Cena» del 1495-97
BB_1938_title_recto: Large sheet containing a study for the Last Supper.
BB_1903_title_recto: Large sheet containing a study for the Last Supper.

BB_1961_title_recto: Cavaliere
BB_1961_text_recto: È uno schizzo di poco conto.
BB_1938_title_recto: Horseman - a slight sketch.
BB_1903_title_recto: A Horseman - a slight sketch.

BB_1961_title_recto: Schizzo per una Natività, con un cerchio di Angeli danzanti in alto
BB_1938_title_recto: Sketch for a Nativity with angels in the air.
BB_1938_text_recto: Charming.
BB_1903_title_recto: Sketch for a Nativity with Angels in the air.

BB_1961_title_recto: Studi per il Bambino Gesù e per la «Madonna con Sant'Anna» (Louvre n 1598) del 1501
BB_1961_text_recto: Come per BB n. 1098 A, c'è una scarsa probabilità che si tratti di una imitazione del Melzi. Un'arida copia di ambedue (BB nn. 1098 A e 1109 A) esiste nel Museo Condé a Chantilly.
BB_1938_title_recto: Studies for the Child and the Virgin's torso in the Madonna with St. Anne.
BB_1938_text_recto: As in my 1098A there is the barest chance of it's being an imitation by Melzi. A dry copy of both 1098A and 1109A, but leaving out the two torsos for the Madonna exists in the Musee Conde at Chantilly.
BB_1903_title_recto: Studies after an original drawing for the Child and the Virgin's torso in the Madonna with St. Anne.

BB_1961_title_recto: Nudo virile genuflesso a destra, angioletto che vola e quattro studi di putti
BB_1961_text_recto: Forse per la medesima Natività di BB n. 1109.
BB_1938_title_recto: A Youth kneeling, a Putto, and an Angel flying. Perhaps for the same Nativity.
BB_1903_title_recto: A Youth kneeling, a Putto, and an Angel flying. Perhaps for the same Nativity.

BB_1961_title_recto: Studio per la «Battaglia di Anghiari» (1503-4)
BB_1938_title_recto: Study for Battle of Standard.
BB_1938_text_recto: Looks more like a close imitation by Cesare da Sesto.
BB_1903_title_recto: Small study for Battle of Standard.

BB_1961_title_recto: Profilo a destra di un vecchio, un po' simile ad una statua antica
BB_1938_title_recto: Profile to right of old man of rather antique style.
BB_1903_title_recto: Profile to right of an Old Man of rather antique style.

BB_1961_title_recto: Testa caricaturale di uomo dal naso adunco, con il labbro inferiore proteso e gli occhi infossati
BB_1961_text_recto: Risale alla fine del primo periodo milanese (1482-99).
BB_1938_title_recto: Caricatured head of man with hooked nose, protruding lower lip, and deeply sunk eyes.
BB_1938_text_recto: Milanese period.

BB_1961_title_recto: Piccolo schizzo per un putto inginocchiato
BB_1961_text_recto: Studio per un San Giovannino in un'Adorazione del Bambino Gesù e probabilmente del primo periodo milanese (1482-99). Forse non di Leonardo, ma di uno dei suoi seguaci più stretti, come Ambrogio de Predis.
BB_1938_title_recto: Tiny sketch for kneeling putto.
BB_1938_text_recto: For infant Baptist in a Nativity and probably of the first Milanese period. Perhaps not by Leonardo but by one of his most cringing followers, say Ambrogio de Predis.

BB_1961_title_recto: Un cavallo impennato; in basso, due figure femminili danzanti
BB_1961_text_recto: Riferibile, con ogni probabilità, alla «Battaglia di Anghiari» (1503-5).

BB_1961_title_recto: Mezza figura di Apostolo
BB_1961_text_recto: È una prima idea per il San Pietro nell'«Ultima Cena» (1495-97).
BB_1938_title_recto: Bust of apostle - early idea for Peter in the Last Supper.
BB_1938_text_recto: Not far removed in style from the sketches for the Adoration, although the hatohing is already distinctly Milanese.
BB_1903_title_recto: Bust of an Apostle-study, perhaps, for Peter in the Last Supper.

BB_1961_title_recto: Foglio montato dal Vasari, contenente sei teste, principalmente caricature, dei primi anni di Leonardo
BB_1961_text_recto: Sono schizzi leggeri di non grande qualità, ma genuini.
BB_1938_title_recto: Sheet mounted by Vasari, containing six: heads, chiefly caricatures, slightly drawn, of no great quality, but genuine sketches, dating from Leonardo's earlier years.
BB_1903_title_recto: A sheet mounted by Vasari, containing six heads, chiefly caricatures, slightly drawn, of no great quality, but probably genuine sketches, dating from Leonardo's early years.

BB_1961_title_recto: Profilo a sinistra di un negro e piccola testa grottesca a sinistra
BB_1961_text_recto: È uno studio, in direzione opposta, dello stesso zingaro Scaramuccia di cui esiste un profilo a destra nella Christ Church Library a Oxford, BB n. 1050. La data è la stessa (ca. 1503-4).
BB_1938_title_recto: Head of a blackmoor in profile to left, a study in reversed direction for the Scaramuccia at the Christ Church, Oxford, and of the same date. Small grotesque head to Ieft.
BB_1903_title_recto: Head of a Blackamoor in profile to right, a study in reversed direction for the head at Christ Church, Oxford.

BB_1961_title_recto: Testa di giovane donna
BB_1961_text_recto: Questa testa è stata considerevolmente ritoccata, in modo che uno scettico facilone, potrebbe sbagliarla per una copia. Ma con tutte le sue pecche non è né una copia né un'imitazione. Sembra uno studio per la testa della Vergine nel cartone con la Madonna e Sant'Anna a Londra (BB n. 1039) e, tenuto conto dei restauri subiti, essa ha la stessa precisa qualità di due altre teste (BB nn. 1151 e 1152) per la stessa opera.
BB_1938_title_recto: Head of young woman. Study probably for the Virgin in the Royal Academy cartoon for a Madonna with St. Anne.
BB_1938_text_recto: This head has been considerably retouched, so that a facile sceptic might easily mistake it for a copy. But with all its faults it is neither copy nor imitation, but, allowing for restoration, of the exact quality and kind of two other heads (my 1151 and 1152) for the same work.
BB_1903_title_recto: Head of a Young \ Voman. A study probably for the Virgin in the Royal Academy cartoon for a Madonna with St. Anne.
BB_1903_text_recto: This head has been considerably retouched, so that a facile sceptic might easily mistake it for a copy. But with all its faults it is neither copy nor imitation, but, allowing for restoration, of the exact quality and kind of two other heads (Windsor, Nos. 1151 and 1152) for the same work.
Cataloguer's Comments: Former at Wilton House.

BB_1961_title_recto: Nettuno che guida i suoi cavalli marini
BB_1961_text_recto: Con ogni probabilità si tratta di uno studio per il cartone disegnato, secondo il Vasari, per Antonio Segni.
BB_1938_title_recto: Neptune guiding his sea-horses.
BB_1938_text_recto: In every probability a study for the cartoon which Vasari says was designed for Antonio Segni. As a very early idea for this is found in my 1189 done after 1500 this design may be of the same date.
BB_1903_title_recto: Neptune guiding his Sea-horses.
BB_1903_text_recto: In every probability a study for the cartoon which Vasari says was designed for Antonio Segni.

BB_1961_title_recto: Un lupo accucciato a poppa di una barca, che egli pilota verso un'aquila appollaiata su un globo
BB_1938_title_recto: Wolf sitting in the stern of a boat steers it towards an eagle resting on a globe.
BB_1938_text_recto: Dated according to Bodmer 1516, which would make it refer to the Meeting in Bologna between Leo X and Francis I.
BB_1903_title_recto: A Wolf sitting in the stern of a boat steers it towards an Eagle resting on a globe.

BB_1961_title_recto: Allegoria di cui mi sfugge il significato
BB_1938_title_recto: Allegory, the purpose of which I do not begin to understand.
BB_1903_title_recto: An Allegory, the purpose of which I do not begin to understand.

BB_1961_title_recto: Un aratro, un timone ed una lanterna meticolosamente disegnati entro circoli ed ovali
BB_1938_title_recto: Very meticulously drawn devices.
BB_1903_title_recto: Emblems.

BB_1961_title_recto: Figure geometriche, diagrammi di cammei con emblemi e singole figure; molte linee di scrittura
BB_1961_title_verso: Figure geometriche, diagrammi di cammei con emblemi e singole figure; molte linee di scrittura.
BB_1938_title_recto: On recto and verso various devices, diagrams of cameos containing emblems and single figures; also a good deal of writing.
BB_1938_title_verso: On recto and verso various devices, diagrams of cameos containing emblems and single figures; also a good deal of writing.
BB_1938_text_recto: Two at least of the cameos directly inspired by the antique.
BB_1903_title_recto: A sheet with various cameos containing emblems and other single figures.

BB_1961_title_recto: Essere demoniaco col grugno di cinghiale, che cavalca suonando un corno
BB_1961_title_verso: Disegni geometrici ed architettonici, linee di scrittura.
BB_1961_text_recto: sembra un progetto per una maschera, forse quella di Galeazzo da San Severino nel Gennaio 1491.
BB_1938_title_recto: Boar-headed man on horseback, playing on a horn probably for a masquerade and possibly the one of Galeazzo da San Severino in January, 1491.
BB_1938_title_verso: Geometrical and architectural drawings in ink.
BB_1938_text_recto: Clark disputes the date because the writing on the verso seems to him later. But recto and verso need not be contemporary.
BB_1903_title_recto: Elephant-headed Man on horseback, playing on his trunk as if it were a flute.

BB_1961_title_recto: Due studi di donna nuda semigenuflessa, con un bambino (probabilmente una Leda), iscritti in rettangoli; nell'angolo superiore destro, un cavallo impennato; sotto al cavallo, rapido schizzo di nudo femminile
BB_1961_title_verso: Mortai che sparano su una città.
BB_1961_text_recto: i contorni ed il tratteggio accennano agli ultimi anni di Leonardo. La Leda, vista frontalmente, è già dolce e femminea come il Correggio in San Paolo a Parma.
BB_1938_title_recto: Each in a rectangle, two studies for a nude woman kneeling with an infant, probably for a Leda. In upper Ieft-hand corner a galloping horse. Below, rougher sketch of nude female.
BB_1938_title_verso: Mortars firing into a town.
BB_1938_text_recto: The outline and the strokes point to Leonardo's last years. The fullface Leda is already as soft and feminine as is Correggio in the Convent of S. Paolo at Parma.
BB_1903_title_recto: Each in a rectangle, two studies for a Nude Woman kneeling with an Infant, probably for a Leda. In upper left-hand corner a galloping Horse. Below, rougher sketch of Nude Female. The outline and the strokes point to Leonardo's last years.

BB_1961_title_recto: Figura intera di un giovane Battista nudo che regge un'asta nella mano sinistra e accenna con la destra
BB_1961_text_recto: Schizzo piuttosto timido e forse giovanile; in tal caso è possibile che il modello per questa figura giovanile fosse Jacopo Salterello, e la data sarebbe 1476.
BB_1938_title_recto: Nude St. John with staff in left hand, pointing with right.
BB_1938_text_recto: A rather timid and perhaps early sketch. If early it is possible that tho model for this youthful figure was Jacopo Salterello, in which case the date would be 1476. The hatching, as Bodmer remarks, points to a later period.
BB_1903_title_recto: The nude St. John with a staff in his left hand, pointing with his right.
BB_1903_text_recto: A rather timid and perhaps early sketch. If early it is possible that the model for this youthful figure was Jacopo Salterello, in which case the date would be 1476.

BB_1961_title_recto: Giovane in abito corto e maniche fluttuanti, con un'asta nella destra ed il braccio sinistro sul fianco
BB_1938_title_recto: Youth in short coat and fluttering sleeves, spear in hand and arm akimbo.
BB_1938_text_recto: Second Milanese period.
BB_1903_title_recto: A Youth in short coat and fluttering sleeves, spear in hand and arm akimbo.

BB_1961_title_recto: Giovane donna, armata di una corazza, col braccio sinistro sull'anca
BB_1938_title_recto: Young woman in cuirass, Ieft arm akimbo, right hand spread out.
BB_1938_text_recto: Companion to the next and same date as my 1125.
BB_1903_title_recto: A Young Woman in cuirass, left arm akimbo, right hand spread out. Companion to the next.

BB_1961_title_recto: Giovane donna in maglia di ferro e lunga sottana fluttuante, con piedi divaricati, col braccio sinistro sull'anca ed una palma nella mano destra
BB_1938_title_recto: Young woman in coat of mail and long skirt, standing with feet wide apart, with Ieft arm akimbo and palm in her right hand.
BB_1938_text_recto: Same date as my 1125.
BB_1903_title_recto: A Young Woman in coat of mail and long skirt, standing with her feet wide apart, with arm akimbo and palm in her hand.

BB_1961_title_recto: Giovane donna in abiti fluttuanti che accenna verso destra
BB_1961_text_recto: È una visione di gioventù e di salute, databile verso la fine del secondo periodo milanese (1508-13).
BB_1938_title_recto: Young woman in fluttering robes pointing-a vision of youthful health and action.
BB_1938_text_recto: End of second Milanese period.
BB_1903_title_recto: A Young Woman in fluttering robes pointing-a vision of youthful health and action.

BB_1961_title_recto: Testa di leone vista di fronte ed un'altra in profilo a destra, con le fauci spalancate
BB_1961_title_verso: Schizzi geometrici, cinque linee di scrittura, un piede e il profilo di un vecchio volto verso destra.
BB_1938_title_recto: Lion's head facing front and another in profile to right with jaw stretched open.
BB_1938_title_verso: Geometrical sketches, five lines of writing, a foot and the profile of an old man facing right.
BB_1938_text_recto: End of first Milanese period.

BB_1961_title_recto: Leggero schizzo di un fanciullo
BB_1961_text_recto: Da riferirsi alla «Madonna con Sant'Anna» (Louvre n. 1598).
BB_1938_title_recto: Slight sketch of child. Connected with the Virgin and St. Anne.
BB_1903_title_recto: Slight sketch of a Child seated.

BB_1961_title_recto: Corpo acefalo di bambino, in profilo a sinistra sorretto da un braccio e da due mani riunite
BB_1961_text_recto: Libero, agile e maturo - quasi come un Rubens - ma forse eseguito prima che Leonardo lasciasse Firenze per Milano (1482). Il motivo è cosi raffaellesco che si è sorpresi di non trovarlo nelle opere del Sanzio.
BB_1938_title_recto: Headless nude body of baby in profile to left supported by an arm and two clasped hands.
BB_1938_text_recto: Free, supple, and mature-almost like a Rubens-yet probably done before Leonardo left Florence for Milan. The motive is so much one that Raphael should have used that one is surprised not to find it in his works.

BB_1961_title_recto: Bambini nudi
BB_1961_text_recto: Il bimbo all'estrema sinistra, di cui è appena accennato il torso, poté essere uno studio per una composizione ricordata nella «Madonna» riprodotta da W. Suida come n. 226; il bambino all'estrema destra (schizzato a carboncino) si gira verso destra, appoggiandosi ad una figura seduta che guarda in basso verso di lui e ricorda singolarmente Michelangelo; nel mezzo è un putto rifinito a penna, che si volge a sinistra col corpo, ma guarda indietro verso destra; sotto i suoi piedi è la testa di un fanciullo che guarda in basso a destra. Prima parte del secondo periodo milanese (1506-7).
BB_1938_title_recto: Studies for nude babies.
BB_1938_text_recto: On extreme Ieft the child-a torso only-may have been for a composition recorded in the Madonna reproduced by Suida as No. 226. On extreme right the child twists to right against the lap of a seated figure looking down on him. This in black chalk singularly like Michelangelo's. Another child elaborately finished in ink, twisting to Ieft and looking to right. Under its feet a child's head looking down to right. Early in second Milanese period.

BB_1961_title_recto: Studi per il torace e le spalle di un mabino
BB_1938_title_recto: Studies of a baby's chest and back.
BB_1938_text_recto: Same date as my 1129B.

BB_1961_title_recto: Cinque studi di fanciulli: due (uno dei quali acefalo) semisdraiati in profilo a sinistra, come se attaccati al seno materno; quindi una mano; un corpicino acefalo in profilo a destra, e, infine, un ventre con la gamba sinistra ripiegata ed una mano che regge l'inguine
BB_1938_title_recto: Studies for three or four children in different attitudes, one only with a head, two in profile left reclining as if at the mother's breast, and of the two others we see one in profile to right, and above, a child's hand, and of the other the belly and Ieft leg bent at the knee with a hand supporting the groin.

BB_1961_title_recto: Studi per fanciulli nudi in diversi atteggiamenti, uno solo con la testa visibile, alcuni come se fossero giacenti nel grembo della madre o appesi al suo seno, altri come se camminassero, inoltre gambine e braccia e singole mani
BB_1961_text_recto: Questo foglio ed il precedente, risalgono alla fine degli anni fiorentini e contengono, fra l'altro, studi per una Madonna che fu dipinta nella sua bottega vari anni dopo, durante il secondo periodo milanese del maestro (1506-13), ed è ora nota come la «Madonna Litta» dell'Hermitage. Non conoscendo l'originale non posso nemmeno speculare su quanto in quest'opera sia di mano di Leonardo. Per una semplice copia, non importa quando compiuta, sembra troppo buona.
BB_1938_title_recto: Studies for naked children in various attitudes, only one with head visible, some as if at the breast or lying in a lap, others as if walking, and separate legs and arms and hands.
BB_1938_text_recto: This and the last sheet dating from the end of the Florentine years contain, among others, studies for a Madonna which years later, in fact during the master's second Milanese period, was painted in his studio and is now known as the Madonna Litta of the Hermitage. Having no acquaintance with the orignal I cannot even speculate as to how much of this work is from Leonardo's own hand. For a mere copy, no matter how accomplished, it seems too good.

BB_1961_title_recto: Giovane azzimato che cavalca, la lancia in mano
BB_1938_title_recto: Youth, lance in hand, riding.
BB_1903_title_recto: A Youth, lance in hand, riding.

BB_1961_title_recto: Vecchio barbuto che si piega in avanti verso un'altra figura appena accennata
BB_1938_title_recto: Bearded old man bending forward, towards another barely indicated figure.

BB_1961_title_recto: Vecchio meditabondo seduto in profilo a destra su una roccia, presso un alberello; in basso dieci linee di scrittura; a destra, quattro studi di vortici d'acqua che sembrano avvolgimenti di capelli
BB_1961_title_verso: Disegni architettonici.
BB_1938_title_recto: Old man wrapped in gown, seated meditating, in profile to right. Also studies for swirls more likely of water than of hair.
BB_1938_title_verso: Studies of architecture in red chalk.
BB_1938_text_recto: First Milanese period.
BB_1903_title_recto: An Old Man wrapped in a gown, seated meditating, in profile to right. Also locks of hair.

BB_1961_title_recto: Prigioniero in catene implorante
BB_1938_title_recto: Prisoner in chains begging.
BB_1938_text_recto: Same date as my 1125.
BB_1903_title_recto: A Prisoner in chains begging.

BB_1961_title_recto: Giovane nudo che siede in profilo verso destra, appoggiandosi sulla mano destra ed additando con l'altra il cielo; in basso, un bambino che accarezza un agnellino
BB_1938_title_recto: Nude youth seated in profile, resting on his right hand. Below, a child fondling a lamb.
BB_1938_text_recto: Perhaps both studies for the Baptist at different ages. The nude youth not impossibly a first idea for the unfinished so-called Bacchus in the Louvre which was really meant to be a Baptist.
BB_1903_title_recto: A nude Youth seated, resting on his right hand. Below, a Child fondling a lamb.

BB_1961_title_recto: Attore in atteggiamento tragico
BB_1938_title_recto: Actor in tragic attitude.
BB_1938_text_recto: Same date as my 1125.
BB_1903_title_recto: An Actor in tragic attitude.

BB_1961_title_recto: Testa di vecchio dai capelli arruffati, vista frontalmente; in basso testa di leone
BB_1961_text_recto: Il volto del vecchio è ritoccato.
BB_1938_title_recto: Shaggy-haired old man. Below, sketch for lion's head.
BB_1938_text_recto: The man's face retouched.
BB_1903_title_recto: A shaggy-haired Old Man with a Lion.

BB_1961_title_recto: San Sebastiano con le braccia legate attorno ad una colonna
BB_1938_title_recto: St. Sebastian, with his arms twisted around the column to which he is bound.
BB_1938_text_recto: Late like the other drawings of this subject. Cf. my 1010E and 1022. Must have inspired his Milanese followers.
BB_1903_title_recto: St. Sebastian, with his arm twisted around the column to which it is bound.

BB_1961_title_recto: Caricatura di un vecchio camuso, in profilo a destra, con i lunghi capelli al vento ed un tonacone fino ai piedi
BB_1938_title_recto: Caricature of old man, with hair erect, in long coat, standing in profile to right.
BB_1938_text_recto: Second milanese period.
BB_1903_title_recto: Caricature of an Old Man, with hair erect, in long coat, standing in profile to right.
Cataloguer's Comments: Only one star but no item in BB1938.

BB_1961_title_recto: Profilo virile a destra, con elmo dalla visiera rialzata
BB_1938_title_recto: Profile to right wearing lifted helmet.
BB_1938_text_recto: Two larger profiles to right both wearing lifted helmets.

BB_1961_title_recto: Due profili virili a destra, ambedue con elmi dalla visiera rialzata
Gruppo di figurine in piedi
BB_1938_title_recto: Group of tiny figures belonging to Leonardo's first Milanese period.

BB_1961_title_recto: Piccola figura drappeggiata, vista da tergo e studio di un'ampia manica destra
BB_1938_title_recto: Small draped figure seen from behind and study for a right sleeve of a draped figure.
BB_1903_title_recto: A small draped figure, seen from behind.

BB_1961_title_recto: Una Ninfa, un lupo, un putto in corsa, un sacco, due macchine e una lunga frase cancellata
BB_1961_text_recto: Contemporaneo al disegno precedente, BB n. 1138.
BB_1938_title_recto: Various pen scribbles: a nymph, a wolf, two machines, etc. etc. Some writing according to Clark not by Leonardo.

BB_1961_title_recto: Tre figure, due stanti, una genuflessa
BB_1961_title_verso: Linee di scrittura.
BB_1938_title_recto: Three tiny figures, two standing, one kneeling.
BB_1938_title_verso: Some lines of writing on the verso.

BB_1961_title_recto: Ritagli con nudi, due profili di cani, un putto, scritte, macchine
BB_1961_text_recto: Tutti autografi, discussi e datati da Cark.
BB_1938_title_recto: Series of pen-sketches, all autograph and discussed and dated by Clark.

BB_1961_title_recto: Busto di fanciullo in profilo a sinistra
BB_1961_text_recto: Ha forma di placchetta e può essere uno studio per il Bambino Gesù nella «Vergine delle Rocce» (Louvre n. 1599) (1483-85).
BB_1938_title_recto: Plaquette-like bust of child in profile to Ieft - study, perhaps, for the Infant in the Virgin of the Rooks, but turned the other way.
BB_1903_title_recto: Bust of a Child in profile to left-study, perhaps, for the Infant in the "Vierge aux Rochers," but turned the other way.

BB_1961_title_recto: Profilo a destra di uomo anziano
BB_1938_title_recto: Study for head, perhaps of Matthew, in the Last Supper.
BB_1938_text_recto: Regarded now generally as a sketch for Bartholomew.
BB_1903_title_recto: Study for the head, perhaps of Matthew, in the Last Supper.

BB_1961_title_recto: Testa di giovinetto quasi in profilo verso destra
BB_1961_text_recto: Studio per San Filippo nella «Ultima Cena» del 1495-7.
BB_1938_title_recto: Study for head of Philip in same.
BB_1903_title_recto: Study for the head of Philip in the same (No. 27).

BB_1961_title_recto: Busto di uomo grifagno in profilo a destra
BB_1961_text_recto: Studio per Giuda nella «Ultima Cena» del 1495-7.
BB_1938_title_recto: Study for Judas in same. Slightly retouched.
BB_1903_title_recto: Study for the Judas in the same. Unhappily re-touched.

BB_1961_title_recto: Poderosa testa in profilo a destra
BB_1961_title_verso: La testa del recto ricalcata attraverso il foglio e munita di una barbetta e, di fronte ad essa a sinistra, un profilo grottesco.
BB_1961_text_recto: il Richter vi riconobbe, credo correttamente, uno studio per il Giuda, probabilmente uno dei primissimi studi di Leonardo per l'«Ultima Cena» del 1495-7.
BB_1938_title_recto: Powerful head in profile to right indicated by Dr. Richter, and I believe correctly, as a study for the Judas, probably !rom the very earliest phase of Leonardo's studies for the fresco.
BB_1938_title_verso: The same head traced through and given a short beard; on the I. half a small grotesque head.
BB_1903_title_recto: The head of a Criminal, indicated by Dr. Richter - and, I believe correctly - as a study for the Judas.

BB_1961_title_recto: Profilo a destra di uomo ricciuto con la barba corta
BB_1961_text_recto: Studio dall'antico, forse ispirato dal busto di Lucio Vero, per il San Matteo nella «Ultima Cena» del 1495-7.
BB_1938_title_recto: Study from antique for Matthew in the Last Supper perhaps inspired by the busts of Lucius Verus.
BB_1903_title_recto: Study from the antique for the Matthew in the Last Supper.

BB_1961_title_recto: Profilo a destra di giovane ricciuto (la riproduzione è invertita)
BB_1961_text_recto: Altro studio dall'antico, probabilmente per il San Matteo nella «Ultima Cena» del 1495-7.
BB_1938_title_recto: Another study from antique, probably for last figure on Ieft in same composition.
BB_1903_title_recto: Another study from the antique, probably for the last figure on the left in the same composition.

BB_1961_title_recto: Torso nudo di uomo anziano in profilo a sinistra
BB_1938_title_recto: Nude torso of elderly man in profile to Ieft.
BB_1938_text_recto: Perhaps from the same model as my 1142.
BB_1903_title_recto: Nude bust of Elderly Man in profile to left (No. 10).

BB_1961_title_recto: Busto di uomo anziano, ricciuto, in profilo a destra
BB_1938_title_recto: Bust of oldish man in profile to right, with massive hair.
BB_1903_title_recto: Bust of Oldish Man in profile to right, with massive hair. Vigorous.

BB_1961_title_recto: Testa e spalle di un uomo calvo in profilo a destra
BB_1938_title_recto: Head and shoulders of bald man in profile to right.
BB_1938_text_recto: Inspired by the antique and in turn the inspiration of all of Leonardo's Milanese followers so that they seem more often than not carrying out posthypnotic suggestions of the Great Magician.
BB_1903_title_recto: Head and shoulders of bald Man in profile to right.

BB_1961_title_recto: Profilo a sinistra di giovane dai capelli ricciuti
BB_1938_title_recto: Profile to Ieft of curly-headed youth.
BB_1938_text_recto: Same type as my 1145.
BB_1903_title_recto: Bust of pretty Youth of antique type in profile to left.

BB_1961_title_recto: Testa di giovane quasi in profilo a sinistra leggermente caricaturale e, in direzione capovolta, un nudo, visto da tergo, volto verso l'alto
BB_1961_title_verso: Schizzo di macchine.
BB_1938_title_recto: Head of youth in profile to Ieft - a caricatured profile - and in obverse direction a nude, seen from behind, looking up.
BB_1938_title_verso: Sketch of machinery.
BB_1903_title_recto: Head of a Youth in profile to right -a caricatured profile; and a Nude, seen from behind, looking up.

BB_1961_title_recto: Testa di matrona, ad occhi bassi, coperta da un velo che scende lungo il collo
BB_1938_title_recto: Head of matron, looking through half-closed eyes, wearing a kerchief, which falls down to her neck.
BB_1938_text_recto: See my 1152.
BB_1903_title_recto: Head of a Matron, looking through half-closed eyes, wearing a kerchief, which falls down to her neck.

BB_1961_title_recto: Testa femminile avvolta in un velo, con gli occhi abbassati verso destra
BB_1961_text_recto: Questo schizzo e il precedente erano passati quasi inosservati fino a quando questo scritto fu pubblicato la prima volta (1903); invece meritano attenzione, poiché sono ambedue studi per la Sant'Anna nel gruppo della «Madonna con Sant'Anna» (Louvre n. 1598) del 1501. La loro autenticità è provata dal modellato, dai contorni, dalla qualità. La testa a sanguigna (BB n. 1151) è ovviamente per la Sant'Anna, ma non come appare nel quadro del Louvre, bensì come la mostra il cartone di Londra. Però il disegno non presenta una corrispondenza assoluta nemmeno con il cartone londinese. Si direbbe che Leonardo abbia giudicato l'espressione troppo calma, e nel cartone la testa della Santa ha più movimento, il suo viso è illuminato da un gaudio più scoperto. Il foglio (BB n. 1151) ci riporta dunque un passo ancora più indietro nella gestazione di questo capolavoro. La testa a carboncino (BB n. 1152) ci mostra invece una persona giovane e vivace. Mettendola a sinistra dell'altra, le due teste assumono le stesse posizioni relative che si vedono nel cartone di Londra. È quindi possibile che la testa a carboncino sia uno studio per la Vergine: ma purtroppo essa non presenta nessuna somiglianza facciale con la Vergine né del dipinto né del cartone: essa presenta, al contrario, una somiglianza più che notevole con la testa della Sant'Anna nel dipinto. Con tutta probabilità, il nostro studio a carboncino era quindi pensato per la Sant'Anna nell'edizione definitiva; questa volta, però, Leonardo deve aver pensato che l'azione e l'espressione della testa avevano bisogno, per una Sant'Anna, di un po' più di calma e di mistero; ed egli la trasformò quindi in una testa più composta, quale vediamo appunto nel quadro del Louvre. Un'altra testa che merita attenzione a questo riguardo, si trova a Wilton House (BB n. 1116 A).
BB_1938_title_recto: Head of woman with kerchief wound about her, looking down to the right.
BB_1938_text_recto: This and the last sketch, both of which had passed almost unnoticed (when this was first published merit attention. They are authentic, as the modelling, the outlines, the folds, and the quality prove; and both are studies for the heads in the Madonna with St. Anne. The one in red chalk is obviously for St. Anne herself, not, however, as we see her in the Louvre picture, but as in the cartoon at the Royal Academy. But even with the last the identity is not absolute. Leonardo seems to have found the expression too calm, and in the cartoon the head has more movement, and the face is lit up with more visible delight. This sketch, then, takes us a stage further back in Leonardo's conception. The drawing in black chalk is of a younger and livelier person. Placing it alongside of the one in red chalk, their relative positions are nearly the same as that of the two heads in the cartoon. It is therefore possible that the sketch in back chalk is a study for the Virgin. But there is no facial resemblance with the Virgin in either the cartoon or the painting. On the other hand, there is more than considerable likeness to the head of St. Anne in the picture, and in all probability our sketch was a study for this, so to speak, definitive edition of the masterpiece. But Leonardo seems this time to have found the action and the expression lacking just a trifle in subtlety and calm; wherefore he changed it to a head more sedate, as we find it in the picture. (At Wilton House there is another head (my 1116A) that deserves notice in this connection.)
BB_1903_title_recto: Head of Woman with kerchief wound about her, looking down to the right.
BB_1903_text_recto: This and the last sketch, both of which have hitherto passed almost unnoticed, merit attention. They are authentic, as the modelling, the outlines, the folds, and the quality prove; and both are studies for the  eads in the Madonna with St. Anne. The one in red chalk is obviously for St. Anne herself, not, however, as we see her in the Louvre picture, but as in the cartoon at the Royal Academy. But even with this last the identity is not absolute. Leonardo seems to have found the expression too calm, and in the cartoon the head has more movement, and the face is lit up with more visible delight. This sketch, then,  akes us a stage further back in Leonardo·s conception. The drawing in black chalk is of a younger and livelier person. Placing it alongside of the one in red chalk, their relative positions are nearly the same as that of the two heads in the cartoon. It is therefore possible that the sketch in black chalk is a study for the Virgin. But there is no facial resemblance with the Virgin in either the cartoon or the painting. On the other hand, there is more than considerable likeness to the head of St. Anne in the picture, and in all probability our sketch was a study for this, so to speak, definite edi tion of the masterpiece. But Leonardo seems this time to have found the action and the express ion lacking just a little in subtlety and calm; wherefore he changed it to a head more sedate, as we find it in the picture. (At Wilton House there is another head (No. 1116A) that deserves notice in this connection.)

BB_1961_title_recto: Busto di giovinetto quasi in profilo a sinistra, con la bocca semiaperta e un'espressione intensa negli occhi fissi (a sanguigna) e, in basso (a penna), quattro schizzi per la torre angolare di un castello
BB_1938_title_recto: Bust of youngish man nearly in profile, with open mouth and expression of great effort.
BB_1938_text_recto: I used to regard this as a study for the standard bearer but the position of the Ieft hand which somehow had escaped my notice proves that it was instead, as indeed is now universally believed, a study for the St. James in the Last Supper.
BB_1903_title_recto: Bust of a Youngish Man nearly in profile, with open mouth and expression of great effort.
BB_1903_text_recto: A study probably for a figure-the Standard Bearer-in the cartoon of the Battle of Anghiari. Below, a castle.

BB_1961_title_recto: Busto di dama con la testa girata in profilo verso destra
BB_1938_title_recto: Bust of lady with head in profile.
BB_1938_text_recto: Study for a portrait. Beginning of first Milanese period.
BB_1903_title_recto: Bust of a Lady with the head in profile.

BB_1961_title_recto: Quattro studi di elaborate acconciature di capelli, uno dei quali su scala maggiore, indubbiamente per la Leda
BB_1961_text_recto: Morelli, come ben si sa, credeva che questo foglio fosse del Sodoma, ma io non riesco ad indovinare il motivo della sua attribuzione.
BB_1938_title_recto: Four studies of heads with hair fancifully arranged, doubtless for Leda.
BB_1938_text_recto: Morelli, as is well known, believed this sheet to be Sodoma's, but I cannot even guess his reason.
BB_1903_title_recto: Four studies of heads with the hair fancifully arranged, doubtless for the Leda.
BB_1903_text_recto: The pose and coiffure of the largest head vividly remind one of Verrocchio's splendid head in the Malcolm Collection. Morelli, as is well known, believed this sheet to be Sodoma's, but I cannot even guess his reason.
