BB_1961_title_recto: Studio di capigliatura a treccioline, simile a quella della testa più grande del foglio precedente
BB_1938_title_recto: Another head for the same, almost identical with the largest one on the last sheet.
BB_1903_title_recto: Another head for the same, almost identical with the largest one on the last sheet.

BB_1961_title_recto: Altro studio di capigliatura per la Leda, in cui il volto ha un'espressione più bizzarra, e parecchie parole scritte da Leonardo
BB_1938_title_recto: Another head for the same but of more bizarre expression, and several words of Leonardo's writing.
BB_1903_title_recto: Another head for the same but of more bizarre expression, and several words of Leonardo's writing.

BB_1961_title_recto: Altro studio di capigliatura per la Leda con i capelli legati ad intrecci, quasi altrettanto complessi come quelli della sua famosa «Accademia»
BB_1938_title_recto: Another head for the same, with hair tied in knots almost as complicated as in his famous'" Academy".
BB_1903_title_recto: Another head for the same, with hair tied in knots almost as complicated as in his famous "Academy."

BB_1961_title_recto: Profilo a destra di vecchio dalla barba fluente, con i capelli intrecciati sulla nuca
BB_1961_text_recto: Le fattezze assomigliano a quelle di Leonardo.
BB_1938_title_recto: Head of elderly man in profile to right. He wears a flowing beard, and has his hair braided on the back.
BB_1938_text_recto: The features have considerable resemblance to Leonardo's own. Looks like a slight idealization of the head on my 1166, which bears every trace of having been done directly from the life.
BB_1903_title_recto: Head of an Old Man in profile to right. He wears a flowing beard, and has his hair braided on the back.
BB_1903_text_recto: The features have considerable resemblance to Leonardo's own.

BB_1961_title_recto: Profilo a destra di giovane donna a più di mezza figura
BB_1938_title_recto: More than half-length profile of youngish woman.
BB_1938_text_recto: Second Milanese period.
BB_1903_title_recto: More than half-length profile of a Youngish Woman.

BB_1961_title_recto: Busto di vecchio in profilo a sinistra, rassomigliante allo stesso Leonardo, in un costume singolarmente profetico dell'anglo-indiano d'oggidì
BB_1938_title_recto: Bust of old man in profile to left, resembling Leonardo himself, in a costume singularly prophetic of the Anglo-Indian of today.
BB_1903_title_recto: Various fragments containing profiles, busts, and heads, dating from various times. Among them is the profile of an old man resembling Leonardo himself, in a costume singularly prophetic of the Anglo-Indian of to-day.

BB_1961_title_recto: Nudo maschile, a metà drappeggiato, in profilo verso destra e vari diagrammi geometrici
BB_1961_text_recto: Forse dell'inizio del primo periodo milanese (1482-99).
BB_1938_title_recto: Half-draped male nude in profile to right and various geometrical diagrams.
BB_1938_text_recto: Perhaps early in first Milanese period.

BB_1961_title_recto: Busto di giovane uomo in profilo a destra, col lucco in testa
BB_1961_text_recto: Medesimo stile e medesima data dei profili BB n. 1170 verso. Possibilmente derivato da Domenico Veneziano o dal Castagno.
BB_1938_title_recto: Bust of young man in profile to right wearing lucco.
BB_1938_text_recto: Possibly after Domenico Veneziano or Castagno.

BB_1961_title_recto: Busto di giovane dai capelli ricciuti, in profilo a destra
BB_1961_text_recto: Medesimo stile e medesima data dei profili in BB n. 1170 verso.
BB_1938_title_recto: Bust of curly-headed youth in profile to right.
BB_1938_text_recto: Same style and date as the profiles on my 1170 verso.

BB_1961_title_recto: Profilo a destra di giovane dai capelli ricciuti
BB_1961_title_verso: Studio per la mano di un bimbo.
BB_1961_text_recto: Stesso stile e stessa data di BB n. 1170.
BB_1938_title_recto: Profile of curly-headed youth to right.
BB_1938_title_verso: Study for a baby's hand.
BB_1938_text_recto: Same style and date as my 1170 verso.

BB_1961_title_recto: Profilo a sinistra di giovane con l'orecchio e la parte posteriore della testa tagliati via
BB_1961_title_verso: Leggero schizzo di macchine.
BB_1961_text_recto: medesimo stile emedesima tecnica data dei profili in BB n. 1170.
BB_1938_title_recto: Profile of curly-headed youth to right.
BB_1938_title_verso: Slight sketch for machinery.
BB_1938_text_recto: same style and date as the profiles of my 1170 verso.

BB_1961_title_recto: Due profili giovanili che si guardano: quello volto a destra con i capelli ricciuti, quello volto a sinistra appena indicato
BB_1961_text_recto: Sembra molto posteriore ai numeri precedenti e forse appartiene al secondo periodo milanese (1506-13).
BB_1938_title_recto: Two youthful profiles, facing each other, the one towards right with curly hair, the one towards left barely indicated.
BB_1938_text_recto: Looks much later than the preceding numbers and may have been done during the second Milanese period.

BB_1961_title_recto: Mezza figura di uomo togato in profilo a destra; sotto ad esso una collinetta in miniatura sulla quale cresce un alberello; a sinistra un cavaliere al galoppo ed un nudo con uno scudo al fianco; monti, nuvole,  macchine, figure geometriche e fiori accuratamente disegnati
BB_1938_title_recto: Man in profile to right, visible to below waist, standing on a miniature hill on which grows a miniature tree. Below at left a careering horseman, and a nude with shield at his side. The rest of the sheet taken up by geometrical figures, also very carefully drawn flowers.
BB_1903_title_recto: A Man in profile to right, visible to below waist, standing on a miniature hill on which grows a miniature tree. In lower left-hand corner a careering horseman, and a Nude with shield at his side.

BB_1961_title_recto: Profilo a destra di un giovane ricciuto, sopra un foglio contenente appunti di fisiologia
BB_1961_title_verso: Disegni anatomici e scritti.
BB_1938_title_recto: Profile to right of a curly-headed youth, on a sheet containing notes on physiology.
BB_1903_title_recto: Profile to right of a Youth, on a sheet containing notes on physiology.
Cataloguer's Comments: Note to inventory number: In Manuscript on the Anatomy of the heart (C. II. 23).

BB_1961_title_recto: Serie di schizzi di teste, in prevalenza maschili, quasi tutte di profilo e di carattere grottesco
BB_1961_text_recto: Sebbene alcune di esse siano di qualità inferiore o siano state magari ripassate da scolari, specialmente dal Melzi, questa non è una ragione per scartarle tutte.
BB_1938_title_recto: Series of pen-sketches for male heads, a few female, almost all in profile and most of them grotesque.
BB_1938_text_recto: Although some of them are of poorer quality or may have been gon~ over by pupils, Melzi in particular, there is no reason for discarding them altogether.

BB_1961_title_recto: Busto di vecchio calvo, incoronato di querce, in profilo a destra, circondato da quattro teste caricaturali
BB_1961_title_verso: Linee di scrittura.
BB_1938_title_recto: Profile of old man weating oak wreath, in midst of four caricatured heads.
BB_1938_text_recto: End of first Milanese period.
BB_1903_title_recto: Profile of an Old Man wearing an oak wreath, in the midst of four caricatured heads.

BB_1961_title_recto: Profilo a sinistra di uomo anziano glabro, con la testa coperta da una calotta di feltro
BB_1961_text_recto: Le fattezze ricordano Ludovico il Moro, ma sembrano di persona più anziana, più smunta, più triste. Il tratto ed i capelli sbandati potrebbero passare facilmente per copia di Leonardo, ma le linee del profilo e l'occhio sono duri ed insieme al modellato del volto debbono essere state completamente rifatte, forse dal Melzi.
BB_1938_title_recto: Profile to Ieft of smooth-faced, middle-aged man wearing low felt hat.
BB_1938_text_recto: The features recall Lodovico il Moro but seem older, thinner, and sadder. The stroke and the straggling hair might easily pass for Leonardo's, but the lines of the profile and the eye are hard and along with the modelling of the face must have been entirely made over, perhaps by Melzi.

BB_1961_title_recto: Profilo a sinistra di un vecchio calvo, da cui parte un tracciato ottico a raggiera che indica l'illuminazione del volto, e molti appunti sulla pittura
BB_1961_title_verso: Finestra.
BB_1938_title_recto: Profile to Ieft of a bald-headed old man with indications for the lighting of the face. Some manuscript notes on painting.
BB_1938_title_verso: Window in a mount.
BB_1903_title_recto: Profile to left of a bald-headed Old Man. Some manuscript notes on painting.

BB_1961_title_recto: Profilo a sinistra di un vecchio dal naso adunco e dalla barba fluente
BB_1938_title_recto: Profile to Ieft of old man with hooked nose and long beard.
BB_1903_title_recto: Profile to left of an Old Man with hooked nose and long beard (No. 47).

BB_1961_title_recto: Torso di un nudo maschile visto da tergo e profilo a destra di un uomo vecchissimo appoggiato ad un bastone
BB_1961_text_recto: Le fattezze suggeriscono la possibilità che si tratti di un documento ironico e malinconico di come il grande artista vedeva se stesso nei suoi ultimi giorni.
BB_1938_title_recto: Torso of male nude seen from back, and profile to right of very old man leaning on stick.
BB_1938_text_recto: The features suggest a possibility that this may be an ironical and half-pitying record of the way the great master saw himself in his last days.

BB_1961_title_recto: Testa di uomo vista di fronte
BB_1938_title_recto: Head of man, seen full face.
BB_1903_title_recto: Head of a Man seen full face.

BB_1961_title_recto: Busti di donne in atteggiamenti diversi
BB_1961_text_recto: Sono rapidi schizzi, posteriori alla incompiuta «Epifania» degli Uffizi (n. 1594) del1481. In nessun'altra opera Leonardo è così specificamente, localmente fiorentino, tanto simile al Botticelli nei suoi momenti più prosaici, come per esempio, nella «Bella Simonetta», e al Ghirlandajo degli affreschi di Santa Trinita e Santa Maria Novella. Ci si può chiedere, perfino, se Domenico non fu influenzato da disegni di questa natura.
BB_1938_title_recto: Rapid sketches for busts of women in various attitudes.
BB_1938_text_recto: After Adoration. Now here else is Leonardo so specifically, locally Florentine, so much like Bottioelli in his most prosaic moods, as for instance in the Bella Simonetta, so much like Ghirlandajo at S. Trinita and S. Maria Novella. Indeed, one may ask whether the last-named artist was not influenced by drawings of this nature.

BB_1961_title_recto: Busto di donna, con la testa appena indicata, ma lo scollo modellato con cura
BB_1938_title_recto: Bust of woman, the head barely indicated, but the throat elaborately modelled.
BB_1938_text_recto: Although the drawing seems close to my 1167 A, the contrapposto and the features point to a later date and remind us of the Cecilia Gallerani at Cracow. It may be even later and would seem like the sketch that inspired Raphael for his Madonna del Prato. Andrea del Sarto in his fresco for the Birth of the Virgin at the Annunziata dated 1514 may have had it in mind when he was designing the seated woman looking straight out at us.
BB_1903_title_recto: Bust of Woman, the head barely indicated, but the throat elaborately modelled.

BB_1961_title_recto: Orribile mostro alato, cornuto, con due gozzi pendenti sotto il mento ed il petto prominente
BB_1938_title_recto: Female monster, winged, horned, and tusked with two goitres like pendant udders.
BB_1938_text_recto: Probably an original. The contours in particular of the face meticulously retouched.
BB_1903_title_recto: Female Monster, winged, horned, and tusked with two goitres like pendant udders.

BB_1961_title_recto: Teste di animali grotteschi (due per foglio)
BB_1961_text_recto: Non del tutto soddisfacenti, ma, come un certo numero di teste umane caricaturali non è il caso di prenderle alla leggera, anche se dovessero risultare imitazioni o copie del Melzi.
BB_1938_title_recto: Four heads of grotesque animals.
BB_1938_text_recto: Not quite satisfactory but, like a certain number of the grotesque human heads, cannot be dismissed lightly. They may turn out to be imitations or copies by Melzi.

BB_1961_title_recto: Creatura simile ad un drago
BB_1961_text_recto: Eseguito forse in rapporto alla composizione della quale esiste una copia accurata agli Uffizi, BB n. 1261 A.
BB_1938_title_recto: Sketoh for a dragon-like creature.
BB_1938_text_recto: Done perhaps in connection with design of which there is a careful copy in the Uffizi (my 1261 A).

BB_1961_title_recto: Tre studi per draghi, due dei quali pronti a colpire ed il terzo meno combattivo; sopra a questo, deboli tracce di un quarto
BB_1961_text_recto: Sebbene certamente anteriori alla partenza di Leonardo da Firenze (1482) possono essere serviti per la composizione testimoniata dalla copia degli Uffizi BB n. 1261 A.
BB_1938_title_recto: Three studies for dragons, two of them ready to strike, and the third less combative. Above the last,, faint traces of a fourth. Style, the first two finished with ink.
BB_1938_text_recto: Although almost pertainly done before Leonardo left Florence it may have served for the design of which my 1261 A is the copy.

BB_1961_title_recto: Madonna che allatta il Bambino, con San Giovannino adorante; tredici profili umani; tre profili di fiere; un piccolo nudo virile e il San Giovannino ripetuto su scala minore, nell'angolo superiore destro
BB_1961_title_verso: Undici profili maschili e femminili.
BB_1961_text_recto: I profili sul recto e sul verso hanno lo stesso stile di quelli del foglio datato 1478 (BB n. 1016 recto) e sono circa della stessa data. Lo stabilire la data di questo foglio ha una certa importanza perché se la Vergine seduta col Bambino al seno e il San Giovannino sul recto risalgono alla fine dell'ottavo decennio, allora la Madonna His de La Salle al Louvre (BB n. 1069) non può essere più tarda, e quella bella Madonna non può essere uscita dalle mani di Leonardo molto prima di quella nella incompiuta «Epifania» degli Uffizi (n. 1594) del 1481. Ne consegue che l'«Epifania» fu eseguita assai presto, relativamente molto prima della partenza di Leonardo da Firenze (1482). Mi sorprenderebbe assai, se alcuno dimostrasse che Raffaello, quando concepì la sua «Bella Giardiniera» o la sua «Madonna del Prato», non sapeva nulla di questo disegno. La composizione era nota, senza dubbio, al Brescianino, quando dipingeva la sua «Madonna con San Giovannino» ora a Napoli nella Galleria Nazionale a Capodimonte.
BB_1938_title_recto: Madonna nursing the Child, with infant John; profiles of  heads; nude male figure.
BB_1938_title_verso: Eleven profiles, male and female, in the exact style of the pen-drawing in the Uffizi dated 1478, and of about the same date.
BB_1938_text_recto: The fixing of the date is a matter of some importance, for the recto of this sheet contains besides a further number of profiles, the study for, a Virgin seated with the Child at her breast, and the infant John nestling up to her. (If Raphael, by the way, when doing his Belle Jardiniere or his Madonna del Prato, knew nothing of this design it would greatly surprise me. Bresoianino in his Naples Madonna with the Infant John was doubtless acquainted with this composition). If this sketch is of about 1478, then the Madonna in the His de la Salle Collection at the Louvre need not be any later; and that fine Madonna cannot have left Leonardo's hand much earlier than the one in the Adoration of the Magi. It would thus follow that the last-named work was early, relatively much earlier at all events than Leonardo's departure from Florence.
BB_1903_title_recto: Large sheet with eleven profiles, male and female, in the exact style of the pen-drawing in the Uffizi dated 1478, and of about the same date.
BB_1903_title_verso: The fixing of this point is a matter of some importance, for the Verso of the sheet contains besides a further number of profiles, the study for a Virgin seated with the Child at her breast, and the infant John nestling up to her. (If Raphael, by the way, when doing his "Belle Jardiniere" or his Madonna" del Prato," knew nothing of this design it would greatly surprise me.) If this sketch is of about 1478, then the Madonna in the His de Ia Salle Collection at the Louvre need not be any later; and that fine Madonna cannot have left Leonardo's hand much earlier than the one in the Adoration of the Magi. It would thus follow that the last-named work was relatively early, earlier at all events than Leonardo's departure from Florence.

BB_1961_title_recto: Madonna inginocchiata in mezzo ad un paesaggio, in adorazione del Bambino; a sinistra profilo di uomo calvo ed un altro studio per il Bambino; il resto del foglio è occupato da vari schizzi di macchinari, finestre ecc
BB_1961_text_recto: Lo schizzo della Vergine, benché leggero, è importante.
BB_1938_title_recto: Madonna kneeling in landscape adoring Infant. Slight but important sketch. To left profile of bald man and another study for the Child. The rest of the sheet is taken up by various sketches for machinery, windows, etc.
BB_1903_title_recto: Madonna kneeling in a landscape adoring the Infant. Slight but important sketch.

BB_1961_title_recto: Tre studi per le proporzioni di una testa di uomo, uno di profilo e due di fronte
BB_1961_title_verso: Prospettive di blocchi e di scale.
BB_1938_title_recto: Three studies for proportions of man's head, one in profile and two frontal.
BB_1938_title_verso: Perspective studies of blocks and stairs.
BB_1938_text_recto: Clark believes these sketches are copies. They do Leonardo no credit, certainly.
BB_1903_title_recto: Three male heads.

BB_1961_title_recto: Studio di due mani posate in grembo, l'una dentro l'altra ed una mano posata sul petto, che tiene un fiore
BB_1961_text_recto: Studi molto accurati non per la «Monna Lisa».
BB_1938_title_recto: Hand laid on a wrist, another hand.
BB_1938_text_recto: Very careful studies, not for the Monna Lisa. Usually now connected with the Liechtenstein portrait, which it is assumed had hands in this position. It seems unlikely that Leonardo could have drawn hands like this at the same time that he was doing the Uffizi Annunciation. The period of the Virgin of the Rocks would suit better as a date.
BB_1903_title_recto: A wrist laid in a hand. Another hand.
BB_1903_text_recto: Very careful studies, not for the "Mona Lisa."

BB_1961_title_recto: Studio di mani, per l'incompiuta «Epifania» degli Uffizi (n 1594) del 1481
BB_1938_title_recto: Hands for Adoration of Magi.
BB_1903_title_recto: A hand.

BB_1961_title_recto: Studio di panni che avvolgono la parte inferiore di una figura inginocchiata verso sinistra
BB_1961_text_recto: Questo studio di panni viene convenzionalmente riferito, dato il sistema delle pieghe, all'Angelo inginocchiato nella «Vergine delle Rocce»: ma non già nella versione del Louvre, bensi in quella ora nella National Gallery di Londra (n. 1093) eseguita vari anni dopo (1506-8) da un suo allievo milanese, forse A. de Predis.
BB_1938_title_recto: Drapery for figure kneeling towards left.
BB_1938_text_recto: This drapery is conventionally accepted as being for the kneeling angel in the Virgin of the Rocks, as the crinkliness of the folds tends to witness. It is for the Milanese version of it now in the National Gallery, executed a number of years after the autograph one in the Louvre.
BB_1903_title_recto: Drapery for a figure kneeling towards the left, probably for the Angel in the "Vierge aux Rochers ".

BB_1961_title_recto: Studio per il braccio destro di San Pietro nella «Ultima Cena» del 1495-7
BB_1938_title_recto: Study for Peter's right arm in the Last Supper.
BB_1903_title_recto: Study for Peter's right arm in the Last Supper.

BB_1961_title_recto: Due studi di panni che avvolgono ginocchi accavallati
BB_1961_text_recto: Probabilmente per la «Madonna con Sant'Anna» del 1501 (Louvre n. 1598).
BB_1938_title_recto: Study for drapery over knees, probably for the Madonna with St. Anne.
BB_1903_title_recto: Study for drapery over knees, probably for the Madonna with St. Anne (No. 225).

BB_1961_title_recto: Variante del disegno precedente
BB_1938_title_recto: Variation of same.
BB_1903_title_recto: Variation of same.

BB_1961_title_recto: Studio di panni che avvolgono il ginocchio destro di una figura che sporge verso destra
BB_1961_text_recto: Studio per la «Madonna con Sant'Anna» (Louvre n. 1598) del 1501.
BB_1938_title_recto: Study for drapery over right knee, for the same.
BB_1903_title_recto: Study for drapery over right knee, for the same (No. 219).

BB_1961_title_recto: Studio di panno che gira intorno alla cintola, di una figura volta a destra
BB_1961_text_recto: Studio per la «Madonna con Sant'Anna» (Louvre n. 1598) del 1501.
BB_1938_title_recto: Study for drapery about the waist, for the same.
BB_1903_title_recto: Study for drapery about the waist, for the same (No. 221).

BB_1961_title_recto: Panneggio che avvolge una gamba destra
BB_1961_text_recto: Studio per la «Madonna con Sant'Anna» (Louvre n. 1598) del 1501.
BB_1938_title_recto: Study for drapery over right leg, for the same.
BB_1903_title_recto: Study for drapery over right leg, for the same.

BB_1961_title_recto: Studio per il panneggio di un braccio destro
BB_1938_title_recto: Study for drapery of right arm.
BB_1903_title_recto: Study for drapery of a right arm.

BB_1961_title_recto: Studio per una manica
BB_1938_title_recto: Study for sleeve.
BB_1903_title_recto: Study for a sleeve.

BB_1961_title_recto: Studio di panni che avvolgono una spalla ed un polso
BB_1938_title_recto: Study for drapery over shoulder and around wrist.
BB_1903_title_recto: Study for drapery over the shoulder and around the wrist.

BB_1961_title_recto: Torso di Bambino nudo con le braccia protese
BB_1961_text_recto: Studio per la «Madonna con Sant'Anna» (Louvre n. 1598).
BB_1938_title_recto: Study for the Child with arms stretched out, in the Louvre Madonna with St. Anne.
BB_1903_title_recto: Torso of a Child with the arms stretched out, study for the Infant in the Madonna with St. Anne.

BB_1961_title_recto: Piccolo nudo con accenni ad un mantello svolazzante dietro il suo dorso
BB_1938_title_recto: Small nude with bit of drapery fluttering behind.
BB_1903_title_recto: Small Nude with a bit of drapery fluttering behind.

BB_1961_title_recto: Nudi virili seduti a conversare
BB_1961_text_recto: Probabilmente uno studio per l'incompiuta «Epifania» degli Uffizi (n. 1594) del 1481.
BB_1938_title_recto: Lightly seated nudes conversing, a group probably for the Adoration of the Magi.
BB_1903_title_recto: Nudes, a group probably for the Adoration of the Magi.

BB_1961_title_recto: Due figure in conversazione, l'una seduta verso sinistra, ma volta verso destra, l'altra inginocchiata o accoccolata con la testa appoggiata sulla mano sinistra
BB_1938_title_recto: Two figures in conversation, one seated towards left and turned towards right, the other kneeling or crouching with head resting on left hand.

BB_1961_title_recto: Due studi per l'«Ultima Cena», con arco, figure geometriche, numeri incolonnati per una somma
BB_1938_title_recto: Two studies for the Last Supper. Important for the slight indication of the architecture.
BB_1903_title_recto: Two studies for the Last Supper.

BB_1961_title_recto: Studio per un David, somigliantissimo allo studio di Michelangelo per la sua statua; ai suoi piedi, rapido appunto per un Nettuno auriga (vedi BB n 1117); in basso, un altro studio più abbozzato del David stesso; a sinistra, schizzi architettonici; varie linee di scrittura
BB_1938_title_recto: Study for a David, bearing the strongest resemblance to Michelangelo's study for same. Below, a less finished study for same. Sketches for architecture. At the feet of the more finished David a rapid notation for the Neptune, my 1117.
BB_1938_text_recto: Done perhaps in competition for the David ordered in 1501. It is not to be off hand assumed that the older was copying the younger master.
BB_1903_title_recto: Study for a David, bearing the strongest resemblance to Michelangelo's, but probably of earlier date. A less defined study for the same. Sketches for architecture.

BB_1961_title_recto: A sinistra un piccolo nudo semiappoggiato ad un parapetto, in posa michelangiolesca, con una gamba ritratta ed un braccio teso come se pescasse con una canna; a destra la stessa figura vista da tergo; in basso, una donna genuflessa su dei gradini e piegata in avanti come se stesse lavando in una zangola
BB_1961_title_verso: Nudi che lavorano ad un mortaio.
BB_1938_title_recto: Two small naked figures seated in Michelangelesque attitude with one leg drawn up, the one on the left holding out a rod as if fishing. Below, a female figure mounting steps and leaning over as if to wash in a tub.
BB_1938_title_verso: Nudes working a mortar.
BB_1938_text_recto: Jottings like those on the recto make one wonder just what were the relations of Michelangelo to Leonardo. Was the younger in youth acquainted with sketches by the elder? His dislike of the older may have been an offensive-defensive on the part of one who hated to take anything from the other but could not help himself.
BB_1903_title_recto: Nudes working a mortar.

BB_1961_title_recto: Buoi che arano e gruppi di seminatori
BB_1938_title_recto: Oxen ploughing and groups of sowers.
BB_1938_text_recto: About 1500.
BB_1903_title_recto: Oxen ploughing and groups of sowers.

BB_1961_title_recto: Tre fogli della medesima qualità contenenti, su ambo le facce, numerose figurine in azione, variamente dedite ad occupazioni rurali
BB_1938_title_recto: Three sheets of the same quality having on both sides numerous small figures in action, apparently studies of agricultural occupations.

BB_1961_title_recto: Quattro studi di armi
BB_1938_title_recto: Sketches for various weapons.
BB_1938_text_recto: Early in first Milanese period.

BB_1961_title_recto: Posamine manovrata da un uomo, altra macchina simile ed altri modelli di fucili e di cannoni
BB_1961_title_verso: Fortezze che saltano in aria.
BB_1938_title_recto: Mine layer steered by a man, another similar machine and various models of guns or canons.
BB_1938_title_verso: Town on a hill being blown up into the air.
BB_1938_text_recto: Early in first Milanese period.

BB_1961_title_recto: Groviglio di nudi in lotta e vari schizzi geometrici
BB_1938_title_recto: Nude figures in combat and various geometrical sketches.
BB_1938_text_recto: Probably for Battle of Anghiari.

BB_1961_title_recto: Appunti di ottica
BB_1961_title_verso: Piccole figure nude che manovrano scuri; appunti e diagrammi sulla teoria della luce e delle ombre.
BB_1961_text_verso: Versperpendicolarmente ad essi, e a sanguigna, una figura nuda in atto di piegarsi verso il basso, non di Leonardo, come Clark giustamente afferma.
BB_1938_title_verso: Small nude figures swinging axes; notes and diagrams on the theory of light and shade.
BB_1938_text_recto: Vertically to them in red chalk a nude seated figure bending down, not by Leonardo as Clark correctly affirms.
BB_1903_title_recto: Small figures swinging axes. Some manuscript notes.

BB_1961_title_recto: Studi delle proporzioni della figura umana, alcuni di qualità squisita
BB_1938_title_recto: Various studies for human proportions, some of them exquisite in quality and of great beauty.
BB_1903_title_recto: Various studies for human proportions, some of them exquisite in quality and of great beauty.

BB_1961_title_recto: Due nudi virili acefali, l'uno in profilo a sinistra; l'altro visto da tergo
BB_1961_text_recto: Appartengono ad un momento avanzato del primo periodo milanese (1482-99).
BB_1938_title_recto: Two nude male figures, one in profile to Ieft the other seen from the back.
BB_1938_text_recto: Well on in first Milanese period.

BB_1961_title_recto: Due nudi virili in profilo a destra e l'abbozzo di un terzo su scala maggiore, una gamba, a sanguigna; in basso un cavaliere e due combattenti, a penna
BB_1938_title_recto: Two male figures in profile, and on larger scale a leg, in red chalk. Tiny figures, with the pen, of a horseman and two combatants.
BB_1938_text_recto: Studies for the Battle as Bodmer suggests.
BB_1903_title_recto: Two male figures in profile, and on larger scale a leg, in red chalk. Tiny figures with the pen of a Horseman and two Combatants.

BB_1961_title_recto: Una gamba scorticata, un nudo acefalo in profilo a destra, un occhio e due minuscole figurine di uomini che vanno su e giù per una collina e varie linee di scrittura
BB_1961_title_verso: Testa femminile.
BB_1961_text_verso: Versnon di Leonardo.
BB_1938_title_recto: Studies for a leg ecorche; for a nude male figure in profile to right, for an eye and for tiny figures of men walking uphill and downhill.
BB_1938_title_verso: Female head not by Leonardo.
BB_1903_title_recto: Small figures in action.

BB_1961_title_recto: Uomo e donna nudi in atto di abbracciarsi, parte inferiore di nudo maschile con le gambe incrociate, due schizzi di un paesaggio montagnoso, altri leggeri schizzi e molte linee di scrittura
BB_1961_title_verso: Studi di nudo in movimento, molti oggetti e molti appunti.
BB_1961_text_recto: lo scritto è autografo, ma gli schizzi non lo sono.
BB_1938_title_recto: Nude male and female about to embrace, lower part of male nude with legs crossed, two sketches for a mountain landscape, other slight sketches. None of these by Leonardo. A good deal of writing.
BB_1938_title_verso: Studies of the nude in action and some writing.
BB_1903_title_recto: Studies of the Nude in action.

BB_1961_title_recto: Due minuscole figurine che si rincorrono in un campo di battaglia
BB_1938_title_recto: Two tiny figures chasing one another, in a battlefield.
BB_1903_title_recto: Two tiny figures chasing one another.

BB_1961_title_recto: Disegni per una fontana
BB_1938_title_recto: Designs for a fountain.
BB_1903_title_recto: Design for a fountain.

BB_1961_title_recto: Nudo virile acefalo in profilo a sinistra e disegno di macchina
BB_1938_title_recto: Profile of lower half of male figure. A fine anatomical study.
BB_1903_title_recto: Profile of lower half of male figure. A fine anatomical study.

BB_1961_title_recto: Nudo virile con braccia e gambe divaricate, visto da tergo
BB_1938_title_recto: Nude male with arms held out, seen from behind. A beautifully finished anatomy.
BB_1903_title_recto: Nude Male with arms held out, seen from behind. A beautifully finished anatomy.

BB_1961_title_recto: Nudo virile identico al precedente, ma visto di fronte
BB_1938_title_recto: Nude male in same attitude as last, but facing front and of same quality.
BB_1938_text_recto: Clark takes this for a copy of my 1202. The shading from Ieft to right favours his opinion and yet I find it hard to agree.
BB_1903_title_recto: Nude Male, in same attitude as last, but facing front and of same quality.

BB_1961_title_recto: Nudo virile visto di fronte nello stesso atteggiamento del precedente ma più piccolo e meno  rifinito
BB_1961_text_recto: Nel disegno dei piedi e delle gambe c'è una certa reminiscenza del Pollajuolo.
BB_1938_title_recto: Nude male in same attitude as last, but smaller and less finished. In the drawing of the feet and legs there is a certain reminder of Pollajuolo.
BB_1903_title_recto: Nude Male, in same attitude as last, but smaller and Jess fini shed. In the drawing of the feet and legs there is a certain reminder of Pollajuolo.

BB_1961_title_recto: Mezza figura di nudo virile in profilo a sinistra, con la testa quadrettata da diagrammi ed un'annotazione sulle proporzioni della testa; a destra un nudo virile a figura intera in profilo a sinistra
BB_1938_title_recto: Nude man seen to below waist in profile to Ieft, the head squared for proportion and a note on the proportions of the head. To the right full-length figure of nude man in profile to Ieft.

BB_1961_title_recto: Nudo virile visto dalla cintola in giù con le gambe molto divaricate
BB_1961_text_recto: Il fianco destro e la gamba ripassati a penna, la gamba sinistra appena indicata. Simile per qualità a BB nn. 1200 e 1202.
BB_1938_title_recto: Nude male seen from waist down with legs wide apart.
BB_1938_text_recto: The right hip and leg gone over with ink, the Ieft leg barely indicated. Similar in quality to my 1200 and 1202.

BB_1961_title_recto: Poderoso nudo virile visto dalla cintola in giù con le gambe molto divaricate, la destra più rifinita
BB_1938_title_recto: Powerful nude seen from waist down with torso bent back, legs wide apart, the right more highly finished.

BB_1961_title_recto: Nudo virile visto di fronte con il braccio sinistro sull'anca e l'altro appoggiato ad un'asta
BB_1961_text_recto: Il braccio sinistro ripassato a penna. Primo periodo milanese (1482-99) e singolarmente simile agli eroi del Perugino nella Sala del Cambio a Perugia. Giovanni Santi nomina insieme Leonardo e il Perugino come i migliori allievi del Verrocchio e non solo è probabile che essi si conoscessero nella bottega del Verrocchio, ma sappiamo che si incontrarono ripetutamente in seguito.
BB_1938_title_recto: Nude male facing front with left arm akimbo and the other resting on staff.
BB_1938_text_recto: Left arm gone over with ink. First Milanese period, and singularly like Perugino's heroes in the Cambio at Perugia. Coupled together by Giovanni Santi as Verrocchio's best pupils it is not only likely that Leonardo and Perugino knew each other in Verrocchio's studio but met repeatedly in later life.

BB_1961_title_recto: Nudo virile a gambe divaricate, visibile dal torace in giù
BB_1961_title_verso: Due leggeri schizzi di un nudo virile, col braccio sinistro sul fianco, visto di fronte e di dietro nella medesima posa.
BB_1961_text_recto: le gambe e l'addome sono molto rifiniti, e forse superiori, per modellato, ad ogni disegno del genere eseguito da Michelangelo. Il disegno dei ginocchi e dei piedi è singolarmente uguale a quello del Pollajuolo.
BB_1938_title_recto: Legs with abdomen, highly finished, in modelling perhaps better than any kindred effort of Michelangelo's. The drawing of the knees and the feet is singularly like Pollajuolo's.
BB_1938_title_verso: Two slight sketches of nude men seen back and front in same position.
BB_1903_title_recto: Legs with the abdomen, highly finished, in modelling perhaps better than any kindred effort of Michelangelo's. The drawing of the knees and the feet is singularly like Pollajuolo's.

BB_1961_title_recto: Nove studi anatomici sugli organi e le funzioni della generazione e della gestazione degli esseri umani
BB_1938_title_recto: Small book of size and aspect of the one published by M. Sabachnikoff on The Flight of Birds on generation and gestation, with dainty sketches.
BB_1903_title_recto: A small book of the size and aspect of the one published by M. Sabachnikoff on "The Flight of Birds" on generation and gestation, with dainty sketches.

BB_1961_title_recto: È una serie di anatomie a penna della massima bellezza come disegno e come modellato Non tenterò di enumerarle, essendo esse state riprodotte in un facsimile quasi perfetto da M Sabachnikoff nel suo «Dell'Anatomia», fogli A , fogli B
BB_1938_title_recto: A series of anatomies in pen and ink, of the highest beauty both as drawing and modelling. I will not attempt to enumerate them, as they have been reproduced in almost perfect facsimile by M. Sabachnikoff in his Dell'Anatomia, Fogli A, and Fogli B.
BB_1903_title_recto: A series of anatomies in pen and ink, of the highest beauty both as drawing and modelling. I will not attempt to enumerate them, as they have been reproduced in almost perfect facsimile by M. Sabachnikoff in his "Dell' Anatomia, Fogli A" and "Fogli B ".

BB_1961_title_recto: Vari piccoli schizzi per il «Monumento Trivulzio», 1511-12 (non come solevo credere per il «Monumento Sforza»), con una base architettonica elaborata
BB_1938_title_recto: Various small sketches for the Trivulzio, not as I used to think the Sforza monument, with an elaborate architectural base.
BB_1903_title_recto: Various small sketches for the Sforza monument, with an elaborate architectural base.

BB_1961_title_recto: Francesco Sforza sopra un cavallo al galoppo
BB_1938_title_recto: Sforza on a careering horse.
BB_1903_title_recto: Sforza on a careering horse.

BB_1961_title_recto: Condottiero a cavallo e tre schizzi per una statua equestre posta su un arco trionfale
BB_1938_title_recto: Sketches for an equestrian statue standing on a triumphal arch.
BB_1938_text_recto: Now accepted as being for the Trivulzio monument.
BB_1903_title_recto: Sketches for the Sforza group standing on a triumphal arch.

BB_1961_title_recto: Due cavalli in profilo a sinistra, l'uno fermo e l'altro che cammina, un cavaliere che galoppa e gambe di cavalli
BB_1961_title_verso: Leggero schizzo di una testa umana.
BB_1961_text_recto: Probabilmene studi per l'incompiuta «Epifania» degli Uffizi (n. 1594) del 1481.
BB_1938_title_recto: Two horses in profile, one standing and the other walking. In silver point alone a rider on a galloping horse and studies of horses' legs, probably for the Adoration.
BB_1938_title_verso: Slight sketch of a human head in black chalk.

BB_1961_title_recto: Nudo a cavallo che irrompe verso sinistra, calpestando un nemico prostrato
BB_1938_title_recto: Nude on horseback trampling a prostrate foe.
BB_1938_text_recto: Study for the Sforza monument. This drawing seems to go with my 1044A and indeed it would be easy enough to bring both in relation with the two horsemen tilting against each other in the background of the Adoration who so prophetically anticipate the group of the Battle of the Standard, if the hatching in both would not seem of later date. I am inclined to agree with Malaguzzi Valeri, who calls it "un motivo classico caro all'artista;" he certainly was partial to this motive throughout his whole career. Clark thinks, as I used to do and still do, that this particular study was intended for the Sforza monument.
BB_1903_title_recto: A Nude on horseback trampling a prostrate foe.

BB_1961_title_recto: Sopra un arco trionfale, un nudo a cavallo che calpesta un nemico prostrato
BB_1938_title_recto: Over a triumphal arch a nude on horseback trampling a prostrate foe.
BB_1938_text_recto: Very likely one of the later drawings for the Trivulzio monument.
BB_1903_title_recto: Over a triumphal arch a Nude on horseback trampling a prostrate foe.

BB_1961_title_recto: Cinque studi per un monumento equestre: due sono di nudi a cavallo che calpestano un nemico abbattuto; gli altri tre sono di cavalli che avanzano calmi e solenni, uno con cavaliere ben rifinito, gli altri due solo accennati
BB_1938_title_recto: Sheet of studies for a monument. Two sketches are of nudes on horseback trampling on a prostrate figure; the other three are of horses walking quietly.
BB_1938_text_recto: Late enough to be connected with the Trivulzio monument.
BB_1903_title_recto: A sheet of studies for the Sforza monument. Two sketches are of Nudes on horseback trampling on a prostrate figure; the other three are of horses walking quietly.

BB_1961_title_recto: Tre cavalli al passo, sul terzo un cavaliere
BB_1961_text_recto: Apparentemente a punta d'argento. Ispirato dall'antico. Contemporaneo a BB n. 1216.
BB_1938_title_recto: Two horses walking, on third a rider.
BB_1938_text_recto: Looks like black chalk, but may be lead. Inspired by the antique. Same date as my 1216.
BB_1903_title_recto: Two horses walking; on one a rider. Study for the same.

BB_1961_title_recto: Condottiero a cavallo
BB_1938_title_recto: Man on horseback with staff held out.
BB_1938_text_recto: Same date as my 1216.
BB_1903_title_recto: A man on horseback with staff held out. Study for same.

BB_1938_title_recto: Sketches of horses walking, and riders.
BB_1903_title_recto: Sketches of horses walking, and riders.

BB_1961_title_recto: Schizzi ed istruzioni per la fusione del cavallo
BB_1938_title_recto: Sketches and instructions for the casting of the horse.

BB_1961_title_recto: Condottiero a cavallo sopra un alto piedistallo, sotto al quale si vede un sarcofago con una figura giacente
BB_1961_title_verso: Ricalco di cavallo e cavaliere.
BB_1938_title_recto: Study for monument of equestrian group, with recumbent figure, on top of high pedestal-perhaps for the Trivulzio monument.

BB_1903_title_recto: Study for monument consisting of an equestrian group on top of a high pedestal containing a recumbent statue-perhaps for the Trivulzio monument.

BB_1961_title_recto: Tre cavalli al passo, visti da tergo ed in profilo a destra

BB_1938_text_recto: Including former 1218. Probably late.
BB_1903_title_recto: Horses walking , for an equestrian monument.
