BB_1938_title_recto: Horse walking, and two studies for chest and foreleg of horse, seen full face.
BB_1938_text_recto: First Milanese period.
BB_1903_title_recto: A horse walking, and another, but headless, seen full face. For same.

BB_1961_title_recto: Tre studi di cavalli, montati insieme, ma di date diverse
BB_1938_title_recto: Three pen-studies for horses mounted together but of different dates.

BB_1961_title_recto: Due nudi virili su cavalli al galoppo ed altri che li seguono
BB_1961_text_recto: Molto probabilmente studi per la «Battaglia di Anghiari» (1503-5).
BB_1938_title_recto: Nudes on rapidly galloping horses, and others pursuing, most probably for the Battle of the Standard.
BB_1903_title_recto: Nudes on rapidly galloping horses, and others pu rsu ing, most probably for the Battle of the Standard.

BB_1961_title_recto: Cavallo che cammina in profilo a destra e testa di altro cavallo visto di fronte
BB_1938_title_recto: Horse walking in profile to right and head of another horse facing front.

BB_1961_title_recto: Cavallo impennato, cinque teste in profilo di cavalli sbuffanti, una testa di leone ruggente e, sotto ad essa, il profilo leonino di un guerriero pollajuolesco-verrocchiesco a bocca aperta
BB_1961_title_verso: Diagrammi geometrici, appunti e testa di cavallo.
BB_1938_title_recto: Highly spirited horse prancing, and heads of others snorting. Also head of roaring lion and, below, profile of an open-mouthed "Pollajuolo-Verrocchiesque" warrior.
BB_1938_title_verso: Manuscript notes and head of horse.
BB_1938_text_recto: Generally connected with the Battle and yet how close to the unfinished background of the Adoration and the drawings related to it.
BB_1903_title_recto: A horse prancing, and heads of others snorting. Highly spirited.
BB_1903_title_verso: Manuscript notes, and head of a horse.

BB_1961_title_recto: Testa di cavallo
BB_1961_text_recto: Montato insieme al n. 1225. Probabilmente uno studio per la «Battaglia di Anghiari» (1503-5). Il modellato ha qui una vigoria ed una plasticità insoliti perfino in Leonardo. Si noti come la criniera, vista da sola, potrebbe passare per un lussureggiante ciuffo di canne e di giunchi.
BB_1938_title_recto: Head of horse.
BB_1938_text_recto: Mounted together with 1225. Probably connected with Battle. Carried out with a vigour and plasticity more than ordinary in Leonardo even. Note how the mane seen by itself may be read off as a generous growth of reeds and rushes.

BB_1961_title_recto: Due teste di cavalli, l'una frontale e l'altra in profilo a destra, un cavallo che si impenna in profilo a destra, un cavallo visto da tergo e la mano di un bimbo
BB_1938_title_recto: Heads of horses. A prancing horse in profile to right. Faint sketch of a standing horse seen from the back and a child's hand.
BB_1938_text_recto: In every probability first Milanese period, although the horse in profile seems almost later. The decision of the question may come from a closer study of the hand and forearm of the child. Bodmer connects it with the Madonna of the Rocks. To me it seems held out as in an Adoration, although not at all necessarily for that particular picture.
BB_1903_title_recto: Head of horses.

BB_1961_title_recto: Minuscoli schizzi di nudi, cavalli, macchine e profili umani; su scala molto maggiore, mezza figura di Angelo che accenna in alto
BB_1961_title_verso: Cavalli ed un piccolo profilo a medaglione.
BB_1961_text_recto: L'azione dell'Angelo ricorda il «San Giovanni» al Louvre (n. 1597), opera degli ultimi anni di Leonardo.
BB_1938_title_recto: Sheet with various tiny pen-sketches of nudes, horses, and horsemen. In black chalk, on a much larger scale, an angel pointing upward, with the action of the half-length St. John of the Louvre - a work of Leonardo's latest years.
BB_1938_title_verso: Horses, and a small medallion-like profile.
BB_1903_title_recto: A sheet with various tiny sketches of nudes, horses, and horsemen, in pen and ink. In black chat<, on a much larger scale, an Angel pointing upward, with the action of the half-length St. John of the Louvre - a work of Leonardo's studio.
BB_1903_title_verso: Horses, and a small medallion-like profile.

BB_1961_title_recto: Uomo su cavallo impennato che si abbatte sopra un cavallo senza cavaliere e due gruppi di cavalli in lotta; in basso due nudi virili forse studi per soldati a piedi
BB_1961_title_verso: Il verso di altra mano.
BB_1938_title_recto: Man on prancing horse bearing down on riderless horse, and two groups of fighting horses. Nudes, probably studies for foot soldiers.
BB_1938_title_verso: Verso by another hand.
BB_1938_text_recto: For Battle of Anghiari.

BB_1961_title_recto: Sette studi di cavalli in varie pose, un gatto e cinque studi di un San Giorgio che uccide il drago
BB_1938_title_recto: Large sheet with sketches for careering and gambolling horses for a kitten and five studies, as Clark suggests.
BB_1938_text_recto: Probably later than the studies for the Battle, which would make it almost contemporary with Raphael's St. George painted for Urbino, formerly in the Hermitage, and now in the Mellon Collection, Washington, D. C.
BB_1903_title_recto: A large sheet with studies of horses in various attitudes, and of men fighting dragons.

BB_1961_title_recto: Tre studi per cavalli impennati, due a carboncino ed uno a sanguigna
BB_1961_text_recto: Probabilmente per la «Battaglia di Anghiari» (1503-5). Quello a sanguigna è modellato come un bronzo.
BB_1938_title_recto: Three studies, two in black chalk and one in red chalk for horses rearing.
BB_1938_text_recto: Probably for the Battle. The one in red chalk modelled like a bronze.

BB_1961_title_recto: Cerchio di cavalieri in lotta
BB_1961_title_verso: Stesso soggetto del recto.
BB_1961_text_recto: Forse da riferirsi alla «Battaglia di Anghiari» (1503-5).
BB_1938_title_recto: Horsemen in a circle, probably drawn in connection with the Battle of the Standard.
BB_1938_title_verso: The same.
BB_1903_title_recto: Horsemen in a circle (No. 31), probably drawn in con nection with the Battle of the Standard.
BB_1903_title_verso: The same.

BB_1961_title_recto: Carica di cavalleria e, su scala maggiore, cavalli irrompenti, di proporzioni gigantesche, uno dei quali reca sul dorso una piattaforma con dei combattenti
BB_1938_title_recto: Fantastically gigantic quadrupeds charging over a battlefield, one of them carrying a platform with fighting men on the back.
BB_1938_text_recto: Late.
BB_1903_title_recto: Mounted battery on battlefield.

BB_1961_title_recto: Arciere e cavaliere, con armi speciali e due macchine belliche
BB_1938_title_recto: Batteries and horseman, and archer charging at them.
BB_1903_title_recto: Batteries and horseman, and archer charging at them.

BB_1961_title_recto: Serie di studi, la maggior parte a punta d'argento, per l'anatomia, le proporzioni ed i movimenti del cavallo
BB_1961_text_recto: La loro data ed il loro scopo, se per la «Epifania» degli Uffizi (n. 1594, del 1481) o la «Battaglia di Anghiari» (1503-05) o uno dei monumenti equestri sono cosi esaurientemente discussi da Clark e più recentemente dal Bovi, che mi dispenso dal darne una più dettagliata descrizione.
BB_1938_title_recto: Series of studies, most of them in silver point, for the anatomy, proportions and movement of the horse.
BB_1938_text_recto: Their date and purpose, whether for the Adoration or the Battle or one of the monuments, are so exhaustively discussed by Clark that I dispense therefore with a more detailed description of each number here.
BB_1903_title_recto: A series of small studies, most of them in silver-point, for the Anatomy of the Horse. But note that Nos. 116, 11 7, heads in red chalk, are by Cesare da Sesto.
Cataloguer's Question: Inventory number correction not well legible.

BB_1961_title_recto: Una figura che aiuta un'altra a smontare da cavallo, un asino sdraiato presso un bove e due asini che brucano l'erba
BB_1961_text_recto: Probabilmente per un'Adorazione dei Pastori come suggerisce il Clark.
BB_1938_title_recto: Studies for domestic animals, a cow, a donkey lying down, and two donkeys grazing. Above, a human figure being helped down from a donkey by a man.
BB_1938_text_recto: Probably for an Adoration of the Shepherds as Clark suggests.

BB_1961_title_recto: Studi di gatti, cani, draghi e pantere
BB_1938_title_recto: Studies for kittens and dogs and dragons and panthers.
BB_1938_text_recto: Probably as late as my 1228 . May have been gone over by a pupil.
BB_1903_title_recto: Kittens and dogs.

BB_1961_title_recto: Piccolo studio di due vecchi alberi su una scarpata, con le radici in vista
BB_1938_title_recto: Small study of two old trees.
BB_1938_text_recto: Late.
BB_1903_title_recto: Small study of two old trees.

BB_1961_title_recto: Quattordici studi botanici, sette a sanguigna, gli altri a penna
BB_1938_title_recto: Fourteen botanical studies, seven in red chalk, the rest with the pen.
BB_1938_text_recto: Including former 1235.
BB_1903_title_recto: 13 botanical studies, 7 in red chalk, the rest with the pen.

BB_1961_title_recto: Un albero
BB_1961_text_recto: La leggera indicazione a carboncino probabilmente autografa fu poi rifinita a penna da un allievo.
BB_1938_title_recto: A tree. The slight indication in black chalk was probably by Leonardo. It was then elaborately finished with the pen by a pupil.
BB_1938_text_recto: Frizzoni ascribed this sheet to Cesare da Sesto, because that master when he did draw trees, drew them in this fashion. On the same principle this great critic ascribed to various pupils works of Bellini himself because they were of the kind which these same pupils repeated continually. To my eye the foliage has the airy lightness of the best Sung masters.
BB_1903_title_recto: A tree. The s light indication in black chalk was probably by Leonardo. It was then elaborately finished with the pen by a pupil.

BB_1961_title_recto: Studio in miniatura di un boschetto
BB_1961_title_verso: Un albero e nove linee di scrittura.
BB_1938_title_recto: Study in miniature of a wood.
BB_1938_title_verso: A tree, some notes.
BB_1903_title_recto: Study in miniature of a wood.
BB_1903_title_verso: A tree, some notes.

BB_1961_title_recto: Paesaggio con grande fiume ed una chiatta che traghetta
BB_1938_title_recto: Landscape in miniature with ferry.
BB_1903_title_recto: A landscape in miniature with ferry.

BB_1961_title_recto: Bufera su una città incassata in una valle
BB_1938_title_recto: Storm over town lying in deep valley.
BB_1903_title_recto: Storm over town lying in deep valley.

BB_1961_title_recto: Castello sul mare investito dalle onde
BB_1938_title_recto: Castle by sea half swept over by waves.

BB_1961_title_recto: Quattro studi di monti e di nubi
BB_1938_title_recto: Four studies of mountainous landscapes and cloud effects.
BB_1903_title_recto: Study of rock strata. Valley seen from heights in foreground.

BB_1961_title_recto: Stratificazioni rocciose, precipizi e gole montane
BB_1938_title_recto: Four studies of rock strata, precipices, and defiles.
BB_1903_title_recto: Study of a defile.

BB_1961_title_recto: Due paesaggi fluviali
BB_1938_title_recto: Two river landscapes.

BB_1961_title_recto: Il cortile di un Arsenale
BB_1938_title_recto: The courtyard of an arsenal.
BB_1903_title_recto: The courtyard of an arsenal.

BB_1961_title_recto: Drago che combatte un leone; negli angoli, due copie, a semplice contorno, della Madonna col gatto (cfr BB n 1015), una terza copia di una Madonna accoccolata per terra e teste di bambini
BB_1961_text_recto: L'originale dovette essere un'opera in cui l'artista poté mostrare liberamente la sua geniale capacità di rendere la forma ed il movimento associandoli in un modo che in arte conosce ben pochi rivali. La  composizione è compatta come se fosse destinata ad un intaglio e non è facile concepire un'azione più violenta, più veemente e tuttavia così concentrata, cosi conchiusa. Il modellato, come perfino questa copia mediocre non può fare a meno di rivelare, dovette essere di fermezza e delicatezza di gemma. Le copie a soli contorni delle Madonne giovanili che accompagnano questa zuffa d'animali non debbono pregiudicarci sulla data di quest'ultima composizione. La sua plasticità indicherebbe un momento avanzato, ma non ultimo, dello stile milanese di Leonardo. Draghi e combattimenti con 'essi erano temi continuamente ripresi da Leonardo durante la sua carriera. Abbiamo a Windsor (BB n. 1169 C) un foglio del periodo fiorentino, con tre draghi molto più mansueti del nostro. Un altro foglio di Windsor (BB n. 1169 B) con una creatura mezzo leone e mezzo drago, posteriore al precedente, può essere stato schizzato in rapporto con quello che discutiamo. Ma non starò a citare gli studi ancor più tardi, di draghi in lotta con cavalieri, come BB n. 1228. In quanto alla data della nostra copia, se è della medesima mano che delineò le Madonne, allora è una copia cinquecentesca, eseguita dal Sogliani o da un eclettico altrettanto arcaicizzante.
BB_1938_title_recto: Dragon fighting lion. In the corners, with pen alone, two outline copies of sketches for Madonna with cat (cf.my 1015), a third for a Madonna crouching on ground and of children's heads.
BB_1938_text_recto: The original must have been a work that gave the artist full scope for his gifts of conveying form and movement combined in a way that art has seldom rivalled. The composition is as compact as if intended for an intaglio, and it is not easy to conceive of action more vehement, more violent, and yet so concentrated, so undispersed. The modelling, as this indifferent copy cannot help showing, must have been of gemlike firmness and delicacy. The accompanying outline copies of early Madonnas must not prejudice us too greatly about the date of the design. Plastically it seems to belong to Leonardo's advanced Milanese style, although scarcely so late as its last phase. Dragons and combats with them were among the score or more of subjects that kept turning up in the course of Leonardo's career. We have a Florentine sheet at Windsor with three dragons tamer by far than ours. A later sheet there (my 1169B) of a creature half lion, half dragon may possibly have been sketched in connection with ours. One need scarcely refer to the drawings much later still of dragons fighting horsemen (e. g. my 1228). As for the date of our copy, if by the same hand that did the outline Madonnas then it is of the 16th century made by Sogliani or an equally archaizing eclectic.

BB_1961_title_recto: Madonna seduta per terra con San Giovannino ed un'altra figura appena visibile dietro a lui, forse una Sant'Elisabetta od un Angelo
BB_1961_text_recto: Vedi BB n. 1059 che tratta questa composizione.
BB_1938_title_recto: Half-finished sketch in pen and bistre for a Madonna seated on the ground with the infant Baptist and another barely visible figure behind him, either a St. Elizabeth or an angel.
BB_1938_text_recto: See my 1059, which deals with this composition.

BB_1961_title_recto: Copia fedele di uno schizzo perduto per il panneggio del Cristo nella «Resurrezione» di Berlino (Museo n 90 B)
BB_1961_text_recto: Opera milanese del Salaino o del Melzi, sebbene l'originale debba risalire al periodo fra la «Epifania» degli Uffizi (n. 1594) del 1481 e la «Vergine delle Rocce» al Louvre (n. 1599) del 1483.
BB_1938_title_recto: Faith(ul copy of a lost sketch for drapery of Christ in the Berlin Resurrection.
BB_1938_text_recto: Milanese, by Salai or Melzi, although the original can have been no later than the period between the Adoration and the Virgin of the Rocks.

BB_1961_title_recto: Testa e spalle di un bambino che poppa, quasi in profilo a destra
BB_1961_text_recto: La corrispondenza col Bambino della «Madonna Litta» (Leningrado, Hermitage, n. 13 A) è molto stretta, ma non assoluta. Si può sospettare che sia una perfetta imitazione od una copia del Melzi o possibilmente del Salaino da un altro originale di Leonardo. Questa copia solleva inoltre la questione se l'uno o l'altro allievo non possa avere aiutato Leonardo nell'esecuzione del dipinto. Cfr. BB n. 1027 verso e n. 1038.
BB_1938_title_recto: Study for head and shoulder of child almost in profile to right sucking.
BB_1938_text_recto: The correspondence with the Child in the Madonna Litta is very close and yet not quite identical. One may suspect that it was done by Melzi or possibly Salai as either an extra copy of an original Leonardo or as a perfect imitation. The question is raised whether the one or the other of these two painters may not have assisted Leonardo in execution of the painting. See my 1027 verso, and 1038.
Cataloguer's Comments: No stars but no item in BB1903.

BB_1961_title_recto: Profilo a destra di vecchio seduto che accenna
BB_1938_title_recto: Profile to right of old man seated and pointing.
BB_1938_text_recto: Very careful copy.
BB_1903_title_recto: Profile to right of an Old Man seated and pointing.

BB_1961_title_recto: Ercole visto da tergo, con le gambe divaricate, la clava nella mano destra ed il leone ai piedi
BB_1961_text_recto: Sembra una copia dell'uomo con sciabola in BB n. 1089, ma eseguita in una maniera quasi michelangiolesca.
BB_1938_title_recto: Study for Hercules seen from back with legs wide apart holding club in right hand, lion at his feet.
BB_1938_text_recto: Looks like copy of the man with sword in my 1089, but done in an almost Michelangelesque way.

BB_1961_title_recto: Cinque teste caricaturali
BB_1938_title_recto: Five caricatured heads.
BB_1938_text_recto: Very close imitation.
BB_1903_title_recto: Five caricatured heads.

BB_1961_title_recto: Sette teste grottesche
BB_1961_text_recto: Arido di fattura e forse un'imitazione del Melzi.
BB_1938_title_recto: Seven grotesque heads.
BB_1938_text_recto: Dry, conceivably an imitation by Melzi.

BB_1961_title_recto: Testa di donna con i capelli a trecce e gli occhi abbassati
BB_1961_text_recto: Da uno schizzo originale per la «Vergine e Sant'Anna» oppure per la Leda. Potrebbe essere del Melzi o forse del Salaino.
BB_1938_title_recto: Head of woman with plaited hair and eyes cast down. From an original sketch for the Virgin and St. Anne or for the Leda.
BB_1938_text_recto: Possibly by Melzi or perhaps Salai.

BB_1961_title_recto: Imitazione degli schizzi di Leonardo per una Madonna del gatto, con la differenza che qui la Vergine siede per terra
BB_1938_title_recto: Imitation of studies for a Madonna del Gatto), with the difference that here the Virgin reclines on the ground.
BB_1903_title_recto: Imitation of studies for a Madonna del Gatto.

BB_1961_title_recto: Profilo a destra di un vecchio
BB_1938_title_recto: Profile to right of old man.
BB_1903_title_recto: Profile to right of Old Man.

BB_1961_title_recto: Giovane seduto sopra una balaustra, appoggiato al braccio destro, mentre col sinistro accenna verso il basso
BB_1961_title_verso: Figura seduta in atto di disegnare, vista da tergo.
BB_1938_title_recto: Youth seated on balustrade, leaning on right arm, pointing downward with left.
BB_1938_title_verso: Seated figure seen from behind in attitude of sketching.

BB_1961_title_recto: Giovane ammantato, seduto in profilo a sinsitra
BB_1938_title_recto: Figure of draped young man seated in profile to Ieft.

BB_1961_title_recto: Giovane seduto
BB_1961_title_verso: Giovane martire.
BB_1938_title_recto: Young man seated.
BB_1938_title_verso: Young martyr.
BB_1938_text_recto: Variant of my 1266B.
BB_1903_title_recto: A Young Man seated.
BB_1903_title_verso: A Young Martyr.

BB_1961_title_recto: Giovane donna volta verso sinistra, ma col viso girato verso lo spettatore, che raccoglie la veste con la mano sinistra
BB_1938_title_recto: Youngish female standing to left but facing front, holding up her draperies with left hand.
BB_1938_text_recto: Cf. my 1329B.
BB_1903_title_recto: Youngish female standing to left but facing front, holding up her draperies with her left hand.

BB_1961_title_recto: Allegoria della Musica (la riproduzione è invertita)
BB_1961_text_recto: Piuttosto che al contemporaneo dipinto nel Museo di Berlino (n. 78 A) questo rapido schizzo mi sembra da riferirsi al gruppo della Musa Partenice, circondata da putti, negli affreschi ornamentali della cappella Strozzi in Santa Maria Novella a Firenze (ca. 1502).
BB_1938_title_recto: Allegory of Music.
BB_1903_title_recto: Allegory of Music.

BB_1961_title_recto: Testa di uomo in profilo a destra, come per una figura inginocchiata in un'Adorazione
BB_1961_text_recto: Non appare nella «Epifania» degli Uffizi (n. 1566) del 1496, ma è degli stessi anni. Può essere anche uno studio per un donatore in una pala d'altare.
BB_1938_title_recto: Head of man in profile right as if for kneeling figure in an Adoration.
BB_1938_text_recto: It does not occur in the Uffizi .Adoration but is of the same years and may possibly have been instead the study for a donor in an altar-piece.

BB_1961_title_recto: Giovane che tiene il mantello con la mano sinistra ed una penna nella destra
BB_1961_title_verso: Nudo seduto.
BB_1961_text_recto: la forma delle mani dimostra che è un disegno giovanile. Uno schizzo affine deve aver servito per il San Sebastiano nella pala d'altare della scuola di Filippino a Berlino (Museo n. 98) del quale si è discusso a lungo nel testo.
BB_1938_title_recto: Young man holding left hand to his mantle, and in his right a pen.
BB_1938_title_verso: Nude lightly seated.
BB_1938_text_recto: An early drawing, as is testified by the form of the hands. A kindred sketch must have served for the Sebastian in the altar-piece of Filippino's school at Berlin (No. 98), which has been discussed at length in the text.
BB_1903_title_recto: A Young Man holding his left hand to his mantle, and in his right a pen.
BB_1903_title_verso: A Nude lightly seated.
BB_1903_text_recto: An early drawing, as is testified by the form of the hands. A kindred sketch must have served for the Sebastian in the altar-piece of Filippino's school at Berlin (No. 98), which has been discussed at length in the text.

BB_1961_title_recto: Giovane uomo in atto di ricevere una persona più anziana, a lui inferiore di rango
BB_1961_text_recto: Disegno giovanile, amabile come sentimento e delicato di fattura.
BB_1938_title_recto: Young man receiving an older person, his inferior in rank.
BB_1938_text_recto: An early drawing, charming in feeling, and delicately done.
BB_1903_title_recto: A Young Man receiving an older person, his inferior in rank.
BB_1903_text_recto: An early drawing, charming in feeling, and delicately done.

BB_1961_title_recto: Testa di giovane
BB_1961_text_recto: Si noti la rassomiglianza dei capelli col Tobiolo nel «Tobiolo e l'Arcangelo» già Benson, ora nella National Gallery di Washington (n. 340) e, meglio ancora, nei «Tre Arcangeli con Tobiolo» a Torino (Museo n. 113).
BB_1938_title_recto: Head of youth.
BB_1938_text_recto: Note likeness of hair with the head of Tobias in former Benson Tobias and Angel and better still in the Turin Tobias and the Archangels.
BB_1903_title_recto: Head of a Youth.

BB_1961_title_recto: Madonna col Bambino sul ginocchio Iscritto in un tondo
BB_1961_text_recto: Identica, per carattere e qualità, a BB n. 1333 A recto e verso.
BB_1938_title_recto: Madonna in roundel with Child on her left knee. Of exact kind and quality as my 1333A recto and verso.

BB_1961_title_recto: Testa di giovane donna, in un medaglione
BB_1961_text_recto: Attribuita al Franciabigio, ma certamente di Filippino. Cfr. BB nn. 1326 F, 1326 G e 1330.
BB_1938_title_recto: Head of youngish woman in medallion. Ascribed to Franciabigio but certainly Filippino's. Cf. my 1326F, 1326G, and 1330.

BB_1961_title_recto: Il Bambino Gesù e San Giovannino in atto di abbracciarsi
BB_1938_title_recto: Boy Christ and youthful Baptist meeting and embracing.
BB_1903_title_recto: The Boy Christ and the youthful Baptist meeting and embracing.

BB_1961_title_recto: Due Angeli musicanti, in profilo a destra, inginocchiati ai piedi di una Madonna della quale appaiono soltanto la gonna ed una gambina del Bambino
BB_1938_title_recto: Two angels in profile right making music while kneeling at feet of Madonna, of whom only the skirts and one leg of the Child appear.
BB_1938_text_recto: Probably by Filippino.

BB_1961_title_recto: Uomo ammantato genuflesso verso destra e, dietro a lui, una donna anch'essa in profilo, che si curva tendendo le braccia
BB_1938_title_recto: Draped male kneeling to right and behind him female also in profile bending over with arms extended.
BB_1938_text_recto: Almost as early as Esther panels, and of same kind and quality.
BB_1903_title_recto: A draped male figure kneeling in profile to right, and bending over, at some distance behind him a tall, draped female holding out her hands.

BB_1961_title_recto: Madonna col Cristo morto sul grembo, assistita da due Angeli e, ai lati, genuflessi in adorazione, Paolo Eremita e Antonio Abate; nello sfondo architettonico qualcosa come la scalinata di un palazzo
BB_1961_title_verso: Madonna col Cristo morto sul grembo, assistita da due Angeli e, ai lati, in piedi, Paolo Eremita ed Antonio Abate che si appoggiano sui loro bastoni; in alto, due Angeli che volteggiano.
BB_1961_text_recto: Cfr. BB n. 1360 che è un terzo studio per la stessa pala e notare come in due di questi tre disegni l'azione della Vergine e del Cristo morto anticipi la Pietà di Michelangelo fatta quattro anni dopo.
BB_1938_title_recto: Two studies, front and back, for altarpiece representing Madonna sitting high with the Dead Christ in her lap. She is assisted by two angels. The difference is that on one side Paul Hermit and Anthony Abbot  kneel in adoration and the entire group appears against architectural setting, something like a palatial staircase, and in the other the saints lean on their staffs in contemplation and two angels with crowns float on high.
BB_1938_text_recto: For the same work as indicated in my 1360. Note how the action of the Virgin and the Dead Christ in two of these three designs anticipates Michelangiolo's Pietà of St. Peter's done four years later.

BB_1961_title_recto: Mosè fa scaturire l'acqua da una rupe
BB_1961_title_verso: Prova di Mosè.
BB_1961_text_recto: studio per il Cassone eseguito, pare, nel 1488 per Mattia Corvino, ora nella National Gallery di Londra (n. 4904). Cfr. BB n. 1382 A.
BB_1961_text_verso: Schizzo per un altro Cassone della medesima serie del precedente, del quale sfortunatamente non si conosce la presente ubicazione.
BB_1938_title_recto: Moses striking Rock.
BB_1938_title_verso: Trial of Moses.
BB_1938_text_recto: study for cassone panel done for Matthias Corvinus and now in Collection of Sir Henry Bernhard Samuelson, Bart., London. Apparently done in 1488. (See also my 1382A).
BB_1938_text_verso: sketch for another cassone panel of same series as last, but, unfortunately, its present whereabouts is unknown.
Cataloguer's Comments: Sold in 1899.

BB_1961_title_recto: Testa di ragazzo quasi in profilo verso destra, con lo sguardo vòlto in alto ed un berretto sui capelli lunghi e fini
BB_1961_text_recto: Attribuito al Credi, ma ovviamente di Filippino, come dimostrano tutte le fattezze e la tecnica. Questa testa, od un'altra simile, può aver servito a Filippino Lippi di modello per l'Angelo che guarda in alto, sotto la mano destra della Vergine, nella «Visione di San Bernardo» alla Badia di Firenze.
BB_1938_title_recto: Head of boy nearly in profile to right, wearing cap over his long thin hair.
BB_1938_text_recto: Ascribed to Credi, but obviously by Filippino, as is proved by every feature and the technique. This or a similar head may have served Filippino as a model for the angel peeping out under the Madonna's right hand in the Vision of St. Bernard.
BB_1903_title_recto: The head of a Boy nearly in profile to right, wearing a cap over his long thin hair.
BB_1903_text_recto: Ascribed to Credi, but obviously by Filippino, as is proved by every feature and the technique. This or a similar head may have served Filippi no as a model for the Angel peeping out under the Madonna's right hand in the Vision of St. Bernard.

BB_1961_title_recto: Testa di uomo glabro con lo sguardo leggermente abbassato verso sinistra ed i capelli che gli escono da sotto il berretto
BB_1961_text_recto: Uno schizzo caratteristico che Filippino può avere eseguito per un ritratto negli affreschi sia di Santa Maria sopra Minerva a Roma (1488-93) sia di Santa Maria Novella a Firenze (1502).
BB_1938_title_recto: Head of smooth-faced man looking down slightly to Ieft, his hair straggling out from under cap.
BB_1938_text_recto: A characteristic sketch, which Filippino may have done for a portrait either in the Minerva or in the Strozzi Chapel frescoes.
BB_1903_title_recto: Head of a smooth-faced Man looking down slightly to left, his hair straggling out from under his cap.
BB_1903_text_recto: A very characteristic sketch, which Filippino may have done for a portrait either in the Minerva or in the Strozzi Chapel frescoes.

BB_1961_title_recto: Figura drappeggiata di uomo barbuto
BB_1961_text_recto: Contemporaneo agli affreschi del Carmine, Firenze (ca. I185), ma reminiscente tanto del Botticelli quanto di Filippo Lippi.
BB_1938_title_recto: Draped figure of bearded man.
BB_1938_text_recto: Of Carmine period but reminiscent of both Filippo and Botticelli.

BB_1961_title_recto: Testa di vecchio in un ovale
BB_1961_text_recto: Giovanni Morelli, il quale credette di scoprire in questo disegno, allora ascritto a Daniele da Volterra, la mano del Credi, lo giudicò un ritratto di Mino da Fiesole. Ciò. non è affatto improbabile e, supponendo che sia vero, permetterebbe di datare il disegno a prima del 1484, che è l'anno di morte dello scultore fiesolano. Siccome però la persona raffigurata sembra almeno cinquantenne, e Mino nacque nel 1431, la data non potrebbe essere anticipata a molto prima del 1484.
BB_1938_title_recto: Head of old man in an oval.
BB_1938_text_recto: Morelli, who thought he discerned Credi's hand in this drawing, ascribed to Daniele da Volterra, believed it to be a portrait of Mino da Fiesole. This is far from improbable, and assuming it to be true, Credi could have made it no later than 1484, the date of Mino's death. As the person represented looks fifty years old at least, a date much earlier than 1484 is not to be thought of, for Mino was born in 1431. But the author of this sketch cannot be Credi as I too used to think. The system of planes is not his, the concept is not his, nor is the light and shade or the stroke. Not even the ear is his. All are characteristic of Filippino, to whom we now must attribute this study.
BB_1903_title_recto: Head of an Old Man in an oval.
BB_1903_text_recto: Morelli, who first discerned Credi's hand in this drawing ascribed to Daniele da Volterra, believed it to be a portrait of Mino da Fiesole. This is far from improbable, and assum ing it to be true, Credi could have made it no later than 1484, the date of Mino's death. As the person represented looks fifty years old at least, a date much earlier than 1484 is not to be thought of, for Mino was born in 1431.

BB_1961_title_recto: Cinque schizzi montati insieme dal Vasari: Musa appoggiata ad un'erma e un'altra figura femminile drappeggiata vista da tergo; Santa che prega; putto che corre e due Angeli o Vittorie I primi due a punta d'argento con lumi di biacca su fondo grigio, gli altri tre a penna
BB_1961_title_verso: Vedi BB nn. 760 recto, 1276, 1276 A e 1276 B.
BB_1961_text_recto: Sono tutti contemporanei agli affreschi della cappella Strozzi in Santa Maria Novella a Firenze (1502). Per un altro disegno su questo lato del foglio vedi BB n. 760 verso.
BB_1938_title_recto: Female saint praying.
BB_1938_title_verso: For the other side see my 760 recto, 1276, 1276A, and 1276H.
BB_1938_text_recto: On the same side of the sheet framed in by Vasari are four more sketches by Filippino, three in pen representing a running putto and two angels or Victories and one in silver point and white chalk representing a muse leaning against a herme and another draped female figure seen from behind. All are of the Strozzi Chapel period. For another drawing on this side of the sheet see my 760 verso.
BB_1903_title_recto: Female Saint praying.

BB_1961_title_recto: Giovane re; dietro a lui parti di figure nude ed una figura avvolta in un panneggio roteante
BB_1961_title_verso: Per il verso vedi BB nn. 760 verso e 127S·
BB_1961_text_recto: Incorniciato dal Vasari con BB nn. 760, 1276A e 1276B.
BB_1938_title_recto: Young king with parts of nude figures behind him, and one with whirling drapery.
BB_1938_title_verso: For verso see my 760 verso and 1275.
BB_1938_text_recto: Framed in by Vasari together with my 760, 1276A, and 1276B.
BB_1903_title_recto: A nude Young King with figures bending over him, one of them in whirling drapery.

BB_1961_title_recto: Mendicante seminudo appoggiato ad un'asta
BB_1961_text_recto: Nella stessa cornice con BB nn. 760, 1276 e 1276 B.
BB_1938_title_recto: Study for half-nude beggar leaning on staff.
BB_1938_text_recto: In same frame as my 700, 1276, and 1276B.

BB_1961_title_recto: Giovane nudo virile che volge la testa a destra, protende la mano destra e si tocca la coscia con la sinistra come se fosse un San Rocco
BB_1961_text_recto: Nella stessa cornice con BB nn. 760, 1276 e 1276 A.
BB_1938_title_recto: Youthful nude with head turned tor., right hand held out and Ieft touching thigh as for a St. Roch.
BB_1938_text_recto: In same frame as my 700, 1276, and 1276A.

BB_1961_title_recto: Testa glabra di uomo anziano, in costume fiorentino, vòlto di tre quarti verso sinistra
BB_1961_text_recto: Malgrado la sua attribuzione al Ghirlandajo, questo vigoroso ritratto dal naso aquilino e sensitivo, la bocca ferma, lo sguardo diretto, non può essere che di Filippino Lippi al tempo dei suoi affreschi nella cappella Brancacci al Carmine, a Firenze (1484-5).
BB_1938_title_recto: Head of smooth-faced elderly man in Florentine costume. He turns somewhat to Ieft. Nose aquiline and sensitive, mouth firm, look direct.
BB_1938_text_recto: This spirited, vigorous sketch can be by no other than Filippino, but of his prime while he was painting works of such relative excellence as the frescoes at the Brancacci Chapel. I would beg the student to compare this drawing with the portraits in those frescoes. That the conception is either too realistic or too powerful for Filippino will scarcely be said by any one who has in mind the donors in the Badia or the S. Spirito altar-pieces. The ear is certainly Filippino's and not Ghirlandajo's. No less characteristic of Filippino is the rapid delicate technique. Let the sceptic compare the stroke, the hatching, and the way the white is applied with what he will find in typical drawings by Filippino like those at Dresden, or my 1286, 1295, 1296.
BB_1903_title_recto: Head of a smooth-faced elderly man in Florentine costume. He faces somewhat to left. Nose aquiline and fine, mouth firm, look direct.
BB_1903_text_recto: This spirited vigorous sketch can be by no other than Filippino, but of his prime while he was painting works of such relative excellence as the frescoes at the Brancacci Chapel I would beg the student to compare this drawing with the portraits in those frescoes. That the conception is neither too realistic nor too powerful for Filippi no will scarcely be said by any one who has in mind the donors in the Badia or S. Spirito altar-pieces. The ear is certainly Filippino's and not Ghirlandajo's. No less characteristic of Filippino is the rapid delicate technique. Let the sceptic compare the stroke, the hatching, and the way the white is applied with what he will find in such typical drawings by Filippi no as those at Dresden, or Nos. 1286, 1295, 1296.
Cataloguer's Comments: Handwritten note in BB1961: Christie Sale, July 6, 1967 Cat 7.

BB_1961_title_recto: San Girolamo seduto alla sua scrivania, con un leone accucciato ai suoi piedi
BB_1961_text_recto: Attribuito nell'Ottocento al Ghirlandajo. Contemporaneo agli affreschi nella Cappella Carafa in Santa Maria sopra Minerva a Roma (1489-93). Servì per il dipinto ora nel Metropolitan Museum di New York (n. 14.40.641) e fu copiato da un incisore del tempo.
BB_1938_title_recto: Study for St. Jerome seated at desk.
BB_1938_text_recto: Ascribed to Ghirlandajo in nineteenth century handwriting. Dating from the time when Filippino was painting in the Carafa Chapel, S. Maria Sopra Minerva. (Used by contemporary engraver.)

BB_1961_title_recto: A destra Sant'Andrea in piedi che legge e, a sinistra, un giovane seduto presso una tavola
BB_1961_title_verso: Due Santi, uno dei quali con mazza e turbante.
BB_1961_text_recto: Questo schizzo, così caratteristico della fase giovanile di Filippino nei tipi, nelle forme, nel segno, nel tratteggio e nella qualità, fu tolto tempo fa al maestro al quale l'aveva correttamente restituito Giovanni Morelli e fu attribuito a Raffaellino del Garbo sull'autorità di H. Ulmann. Questo scrittore partendo dalla base poco sicura che la «Madonna con i Santi Andrea e Sebastiano» nel Museo di Berlino fosse di Raffaellino, saltò alla conclusione che questo disegno, per la somiglianza del Sant'Andrea in ambedue le opere, doveva essere della stessa mano e che quella mano doveva essere di Raffaellino. Ma il Sant'Andrea del dipinto non è che una caricatura di quello nello schizzo. Com'è grandioso ed animato l'uno, com'è fratesco e goffo l'altro! Nel nostro disegno il movimento dei panni ed il sistema delle pieghe hanno uno scopo, mentre il dipinto ci dà soltanto una copia senz'anima.
BB_1938_title_recto: St. Andrew standing and reading, and another saint seated facing him.
BB_1938_title_verso: Two male saints, one of them with mace and turban.
BB_1938_text_recto: This sketch, so singularly characteristic of Filippino, and of Filippino's youth, in the types, in the forms, and in the draperies, not to speak of the technique, of the stroke, of the hatching, and of the quality, was some time ago taken away from Filippino, to whom it was correctly attributed by Morelli, and ascribed on the authority of Dr. Ullman to Raffaellino del Garbo. This writer, starting from the unsound basis that the Madonna with Sts. Andrew and Sebastian was by Raffaellino, jumped to the conclusion that this drawing, because of the resemblance of the Andrew in both, must be by the same hand, and that hand Raffaellino's. But the Andrew in the painting is no more than a caricature of the drawing. How grand and spiritecl is the one, how monkish and uncouth· the other! In the sketch the draperies have a swing and a cast which are to some purpose, while in the painting we have but a spiritless copy.
BB_1903_title_recto: St. Andrew standing and reading, and another Saint seated beside him.
BB_1903_title_verso: Two male Saints, one of them with mace and turban.
BB_1903_text_recto: This sketch, so singularly characteristic of Filippi no, and of Filippino's youth, in the types, in the forms, and in the draperies, not to speak of the technique, of the stroke, of the hatching and of the quality, has recently been taken away from Lippi, to whom it was correctly attributed by Morelli, and ascribed, on the recommendation of a writer as industrious as he was incompetent, to Raffaellino del Garbo. This writer, Dr. Ullmann; starting from the unsound basis that the Madonna with SS. Andrew and Sebastian (Berlin No. 98) was by Raffaellino, jumped without further thought to the conclusion that this drawing, because of the resemblance of the Andrew in both, must needs therefore be by the same hand, and that hand, of course, Raffaellino's. But a little real looking should convince the competent student that the figure of Andrew in the painting is no more than a caricature of the drawing. How grand and spirited is the one, how monkish and uncouth the other! In the sketch the draperies have a swing and a cast which are to some purpose, while in the painting we have but the painstaking copy of an imbecile. It is nonsense to say that they can be by the same hand - but even per impossibile if they were, that would not make the drawing Garbo's. Utterly absurd as Dr. Ullmann was on this point (as, alas I on most which he touched), he yet has found acceptance - a fine comment on the earnestness and fitness of the mass of those who take up with these our unhappy studies.

BB_1961_title_recto: Giovane pensoso seduto
BB_1961_title_verso: Nudo con asta in atto di camminare.
BB_1961_text_recto: Anche questi sono stati attribuiti a Raffaellino del Garbo, ma sono inconfondibilmente di Filippino. Si noti anzi che la testa del nudo, alquanto verrocchiesca, non si riscontra più nei dipinti di Filippino posteriori al tondo della Galleria Corsini a Firenze - un'opera che risale ad un tempo, quando Raffaellino non aveva forse nemmeno incominciato a dipingere.
BB_1938_title_recto: Youth pensive, seated.
BB_1938_title_verso: Nude with staff, walking.
BB_1938_text_recto: These also have been ascribed to Garbo. But they are highly characteristic and most unmistakable products of Filippino's hand. The head of the nude, it should be noted, is still somewhat Verrocchiesque, a type which in Filippino's paintings never occurs after the Corsini tondo - a work dating from a time before Raffaellino had perhaps as much as begun to paint.
BB_1903_title_recto: A Youth pensive, seated.
BB_1903_title_verso: A Nude with staff, walking.
BB_1903_text_recto: These also by the same writer, for reasons even flimsier, have been ascribed to Garbo. But they are highly characteristic and most unmistakable products of Filippino's hand. The head of the nude, it should be  noted, is still somewhat Verrocchiesque, a type which in Filippino's paintings never occurs after the Corsini tondo - a work dating from a time before Raffaellino had perhaps as much as begun to paint.

BB_1961_title_recto: Giovane che cammina muovendo le braccia
BB_1961_title_verso: Figura drappeggiata, seduta sopra un alto parapetto, piegata in avanti e vista da tergo.
BB_1961_text_recto: Attribuito dal Morelli al Ghirlandajo, col quale ha rapporti superficiali, particolarmente nel tocco della penna, ma il tipo, le pieghe e soprattutto la forma delle mani sono di Filippino. Cfr. la mano sinistra, per  wsempio, con quella della «Madonna» a Luton Hoo e l'azione con quella della figura che porta uno sgabello in BB n. 1286.
BB_1938_title_recto: Youth walking away with r. hand held out, and I. down balancing it.
BB_1938_title_verso: Back view of draped figure bending over, seated on high parapet.
BB_1938_text_recto: Ascribed by Morelli to Ghirlandajo, with whom it shows superficial relations, particularly in the pen-stroke; but even this is really Filippino's; the type is his, the folds are his, and, above all, the form of the hands is his. Cf. Ieft hand here with, for instance, hand of Madonna in Lady Ludlow's picture, and the action with that of the figure carrying a stool in my 1286.
BB_1903_title_recto: A Youth walking away with his right hand held out, and his left down balancing it.
BB_1903_title_verso: Back view of draped figure bending over, seated on high parapet.
BB_1903_text_recto: Ascribed by Morelli to Ghirlandajo, t with whom it shows superficial relations, particularly in the pen-stroke; but even this is really Filippino's: the type is his, the folds are his, and above all the form of the hands are most certainly his. Cf. right hand here with, for instance, hand of Madonna in Mr. Wernher's picture (London), and the action with that of the figure carrying a stool in No. 1286.

BB_1961_title_recto: Vecchio ammantato, genuflesso in profilo a sinistra, che benedice con la mano destra, mentre tiene nella sinistra un vaso d'incenso
BB_1961_title_verso: Frate seduto che mpstra un libro aperto allo spettatore.
BB_1961_text_verso: Versstudio per il «Trionfo di San Tommaso» affrescato nella Cappella Carafa in Santa Maria sopra Minerva a Roma (1489-93).
BB_1938_title_recto: Old man, elaborately draped, kneeling ih profile left, blessing with right hand and holding an incense box with Ieft.
BB_1938_title_verso: Sketch for St. Thomas in the fresco at S. Maria sopra Minerva.
BB_1938_text_recto: Although the folds are still so Botticellian and the head as well as the action of the right hand different, it is probable that the kneeling figure was an idea for the one in the foreground of the Uffizi Adoration. The presence on the back, of a sketch for the Thomas at S. Maria sopra Minerva, Rome, renders this probability more likely as both these works must have absorbed the mind if not the hand of Filippino at about the same time.
BB_1903_title_recto: An Old Man, elaborately draped, kneeling in profile to left. The folds on the ground are closer to Botticelli's than will be found elsewhere in Filippino. This and other traits make it highly probable that it is a very early sketch for some Adoration of the Magi unknown to me.

BB_1961_title_recto: San Bernardo seduto ad un leggio che alza gli occhi e le mani in estatica contemplazione
BB_1961_text_recto: Studio per la «Visione di San Bernardo» nella chiesa di Badia a Firenze, commessa nel 1486. Cfr. BB n. 1285.
BB_1938_title_recto: Sketch for St. Bernard in the Badia altar-piece.
BB_1903_title_recto: Rapid sketch for the St. Bernard in the Badia altar-piece. Somewhat doubtful, but probably Filippino's.

BB_1961_title_recto: Figura ammantata, seduta sopra uno sgabello
BB_1938_title_recto: Draped figure sitting on stool.
BB_1903_title_recto: Draped figure sitting on stool.

BB_1961_title_recto: Tre figure drappeggiate distese per terra
BB_1961_text_recto: Opera giovanile, probabilmente per Evangelisti in un soffitto.
BB_1938_title_recto: Three draped figures squatting on ground.
BB_1938_text_recto: Early, probably for evangelists in a ceiling.
BB_1903_title_recto: Three draped figures squatting on the ground. Hasty and somewhat effaced.

BB_1961_title_recto: Testa femminile in profilo verso destra
BB_1961_text_recto: Studio per la Madonna nella «Visione di San Bernardo» commessa nel 1486 da Piero di Francesco del Pugliese per il Convento delle Campora fuori Porta Romana ed ora nella Chiesa di Badia, a Firenze.
BB_1938_title_recto: Study for head of the Madonna in the Vision of St. Bernard.
BB_1903_title_recto: Study for the head of the Madonna in the Vision of St. Bernard.

BB_1961_title_recto: Tre figure: quella nel mezzo volge la testa, appoggiando goffamente il piede destro su uno sgabello; quella a destra porta uno sgabello, la terza guarda con aria di stupore
BB_1961_title_verso: Giovane seduto che tiene una canna e uomo più anziano che dorme con la testa sopra una tavola.
BB_1961_text_recto: uno dei migliori disegni di Filippino e molto tipico. Cfr. la mano destra dell'uomo a sinistra, con l'identica mano, del giovane a Berlino (BB n. 1270). Il tratto e la tecnica sono quanto mai caratteristici; e notate come siano vicini al Ghirlandajo, ma quanto più animati.
BB_1961_text_verso: medesima tecnica e qualità del recto.
BB_1938_title_recto: Three figures. The one in the middle turned away with right foot awkwardly resting on stool, the one to the right carrying a stool, the other looking on as if surprised.
BB_1938_title_verso: Youth seated holding a reed, and a somewhat older man asleep with his head on table.
BB_1938_text_recto: A drawing of Filippino's best quality, and most typical. With the right hand of the man to Ieft cf. the identical hand in the Berlin sketch of a young man (my 1270). The stroke and technique are most characteristic, and it should be noted how close they are to Ghirlandajo's, but how much more spirited.
BB_1938_text_verso: same qualities as last, and same technique. Both possibly done with reference to S. Maria Novella frescoes.
BB_1903_title_recto: Three figures. The one in the middle turned away with his right foot awkwardly resting on a stool, the one to the right carrying a stool, the other looking on as if surprised.
BB_1903_title_verso: A Youth seated holding a reed, and a somewhat older Man asleep with his head on a table.
BB_1903_text_recto: A drawing of Filippino's best quality, and most typical. \Vith the right hand of the man to right if the identical hand in Herr von Beckerath's sketch of a Young Man. The stroke and technique are most characteristic, and it should be noted how close they are to Ghirlandajo's, but how much more spirited. Silver-point and white, on pale buff ground.
BB_1903_text_verso: same qualities as last, and same technique.

BB_1961_title_recto: Madonna in trono fra i Santi Nicola e Pietro Martire e due Sante
BB_1961_text_recto: Cfr. le due Sante con le donne nel disegno per la Resurrezione di Drusiana (BB n. 1298), la Madonna con la pala di Tanai de' Nerli a Santo Spirito, l'azione del Bambino col tondo Sant'Angelo, poi Warren, ora nel Museo di Cleveland. I contorni ci permettono di datare questo schizzo con sicurezza intorno al 1490.
BB_1938_title_recto: Sketch for altar-piece representing Madonna enthroned between Sts. Nicholas and Peter Martyr, and two female saints.
BB_1938_text_recto: With the women compare the drawing for the Raising of Drusiana (my 1298). With the Madonna and Child, those in the S. Spirito picture. The action of the Child is identical with that of the one in the S. Angelo tondo. We may safely place this sketch in the nineties.
BB_1903_title_recto: Sketch for an altar-piece representing the Madonna enthroned between SS. Nicholas and Peter Martyr, and two female Saints.
BB_1903_text_recto: With the women compare the drawing for the Raising of Drusiana (No. 1298). With the Madonna and Child, those in the S. Spirito picture. The action of the Child is identical with that of the one in the S. Angelo tondo. We may safely place this sketch in the nineties.

BB_1961_title_recto: Due studi pe run Arcangelo Gabriele in un'Annunciazione
BB_1938_title_recto: Two studies for angel in an Annunciation.

BB_1961_title_recto: Cristo fra i Dottori, a destra due minuscoli schizzi della stessa qualità e tecnica
BB_1961_title_verso: Sul verso iscritto in grafia del XVI secolo «filippo di fra filippo».
BB_1938_title_recto: Study for Christ among the Doctors; affixed to right two tiny sketches of same quality and technique.
BB_1938_text_recto: Rapid, late. Figure extreme right almost Pontormesque.
BB_1903_title_recto: Study for a Christ among the Doctors.

BB_1961_title_recto: Figura drappeggiata, inginocchiata verso destra, con le mani incrociate sul petto
BB_1961_text_recto: Con ogni probabilità uno studio per l'«Adorazione dei Magi» del 1496 agli Uffizi (n. 1566).
BB_1938_title_recto: Kneeling draped figure to right with hands crossed on breast, in every probability for Uffizi Adoration of Magi.

BB_1961_title_recto: Schizzo leggero e frettoloso dall'affresco del Botticelli nella Cappella Sistina, rappresentante la «Distruzione dei Figli di Cora»
BB_1961_text_recto: Attribuito al Botticelli ma giustamente restituito dal Morelli a Filippino. Non dobbiamo però eccedere con le nostre speculazioni insensate ed immaginare che, siccome questo schizzo è di Filippino, l'esecuzione dell'affresco debba spettare in massima parte a lui. Nel 1482, quando quell'affresco fu dipinto, Filippino si era già affermato come maestro indipendente ed aveva altro da fare che seguire Sandro a Roma in qualità di aiuto. Indubbiamente egli prese questo appunto frettoloso durante una sua visita alla Cappella Sistina, negli anni in cui era occupato a decorare la Cappella Carafa in Santa Maria sopra Minerva (1488-93).
BB_1938_title_recto: S!ight and hasty sketch after Botticelli's fresco in the Sixtine Chapel, representing the Destruction of the Children of Korah.
BB_1938_text_recto: Ascribed to Botticelli, but correctly attributed by Morelli to Filippino. We need not, however, go further and conjure up from the nether regions of nonsense the inference that because this sketch is by Filippino, he therefore must have had the chief part in painting Botticelli's fresco. When that was painted Filippino must certainly have been well established as an independent master, with better to do than to follow Sandro to Rome in the capacity of assistant. The sketch doubtless was done by Filippino in haste during a visit to the Sixtine Chapel in the years while he was painting in the Minerva.
BB_1903_title_recto: Slight and hasty sketch after Botticelli's fresco in the Sixtine Chapel, representing the Destruction of the Children of Korah.
BB_1903_text_recto: Ascribed to Botticelli, but correctly attributed by Morelli to Filippino. We need not, however, go further and conjure up from the nether regions of nonsense the inference that because this sketch is by Filippino, he therefore must have had the chief part in painting Botticelli's fresco. When that was painted Filippi no must certainly have been well established as an independent master, with better to do than to follow Sandra to Rome, in the capacity of assistant. The sketch doubtless was done by Filippino in haste during a visit to the Sixtine Chapel in the years while he was painting his frescoes in the Minerva.

BB_1961_title_recto: La Vergine seduta sopra uno sgabello alza gli occhi dal suo cucito verso il Bambino, che Sant'Anna inginocchiata tiene ritto sul terreno; a sinistra San Giovannino osserva, inginocchiato presso una sedia sulla quale c'è un libro aperto ch'egli stava leggendo
BB_1961_text_recto: Un'incantevole scena di genere, ma di tocco ineguale, a volte trito, pur essendo cosa dell'ultimo periodo.
BB_1938_title_recto: T'he Virgin seated on a stool looks up from her sewing to the Child, Who is held erect on the ground by the kneeling St. Anne. On the left the young Baptist looks on, kneeling by a chair on which stands an open book in which he has been reading.
BB_1938_text_recto: A charming bit of genre, but of unequal, in places mincing, touch, although of his later period.
BB_1903_title_recto: The Virgin seated on a stool looks up from her sewing to the Child, who is held erect on the ground by the kneeling St. Anne. On the left the young Baptist looks on, kneeling by a chair on which stands an open book in which he has been reading.
BB_1903_text_recto: A channing bit of genre, but of unequal, in places mincing, touch.

BB_1961_title_recto: Cristo morto sorretto da due Angeli, mentre altri due Angeli, a braccia conserte, piangono ed adorano
BB_1938_title_recto: Youthful dead Christ sustained by two angels while two others with arms crossed on breast mourn and worship.
BB_1938_text_recto: By Filippo himself and for a predella - not, however, for the former Benson one.
BB_1903_title_recto: "Ecce Homo" in the midst of Angels.
BB_1903_text_recto: Pretty, and almost worthy of Filippino.

BB_1961_title_recto: Studio per una Madonna inginocchiata in una Natività
BB_1938_title_recto: Study for kneeling Madonna in a Nativity.

BB_1961_title_recto: Figura con una torcia ed un paniere
BB_1961_title_verso: Due bucrani e lo scheletro di una mano.
BB_1938_title_recto: Figure with torch and basket. Slight and rather late.
BB_1938_title_verso: Skulls of deer and skeleton of a hand.
BB_1903_title_recto: Figure with torch and basket.

BB_1961_title_recto: Santo inginocchiato con un pastorale, presso un uomo in piedi
BB_1961_title_verso: Due uomini seduti.
BB_1961_text_verso: Verstipici disegni giovanili.
BB_1938_title_recto: Saint kneeling, with a crozier, and a man standing close to him.
BB_1938_title_verso: Two men seated.
BB_1938_text_recto: Earlyish and typical drawings.
BB_1903_title_recto: A Saint kneeling, with a crozier, and a man standing close to him.
BB_1903_title_verso: Two Men seated.

BB_1961_title_recto: Un uomo inginocchiato davanti ad un altro, ed un terzo che volge lo sguardo altrove
BB_1961_title_verso: Tre uomini in conversazione.
BB_1961_text_verso: Verssimile al recto ma forse un po' anteriore. I tipi sono tuttora quelli del periodo giovanile. Le mani sono quanto mai caratteristiche.
BB_1938_title_recto: One man kneeling before another, and a third looking away.
BB_1938_title_verso: Three men in conversation.
BB_1938_text_verso: same character as last, but perhaps a trifle earlier. The types are still early. The hands are most typical.
BB_1903_title_recto: One Man kneeling before another, and a third turned away.
BB_1903_title_verso: Three Men in conversation.
BB_1903_text_verso: Same character as last, but perhaps a trifle earlier. The types are close to Amico's. The hands are most typical.

BB_1961_title_recto: Due portatori di barella e disegno di una gamba su scala maggiore
BB_1961_text_recto: Studio per la «Resurrezione di Drusiana» affrescata nella Cappella Strozzi in Santa Maria Novella a Firenze, circa 1502.
BB_1938_title_recto: Two litter-bearers, study for the fresco of Raising of Drusiana.
BB_1903_title_recto: Two Litter-bearers, study for the fresco of the Raising of Drusiana.

BB_1961_title_recto: Resurrezione di Drusiana
BB_1961_title_verso: Donna seduta in una barella con la mano destra alzata (a carboncino) ed una colonna di numeri arabi (a penna).
BB_1961_text_recto: Ambedue studi per l'affresco della Cappella Strozzi in Santa Maria Novella, circa 1502.
BB_1938_title_recto: Study for the Raising of Drusiana.

BB_1961_title_recto: Nudo che spinge con un'asta
BB_1961_text_recto: Attribuito al Botticelli ma restituito dal Morelli a Filippino. È uno studio per l'uomo che attizza il fuoco nel «Martirio di San Giovanni Evangelista» nella Cappella Strozzi in Santa Maria Novella (ca. 1502) .
BB_1938_title_recto: Nude pushing with staff.
BB_1938_text_recto: Ascribed to Botticelli, but recognized by Morelli as Filippino's, and, as has been said in the text, it is a study for a figure in the Martyrdom of St. John the Evangelist in the Strozzi Chapel at S. Maria Novella.
BB_1903_title_recto: A Nude pushing with a staff.
BB_1903_text_recto: Ascribed to Botticelli, but recognised by Morelli as Filippino's, and, as has been said in the text, it is a study for a figure in the Martyrdom of St. John the Evangelist in the Strozzi Chapel at S. Maria Novella.

BB_1961_title_recto: Altea ed una compagna gettano il tizzone in un braciere
BB_1938_title_recto: Two witches stirring the magic cauldron.
BB_1938_text_recto: Ascribed to Botticelli, but, as Morelli recognized, indisputably by Filippino. It is of his Strozzi Chapel period. The figure to the right here should be compared for the action with the two muses to the right of the window in that chapel. Turns out to be for a Death of Meleager in the Fenwick Collection, Cheltenham. See my 1277C.
BB_1903_title_recto: Two Witches stirring the magic cauldron.
BB_1903_text_recto: Ascribed to Botticelli, but, as Morelli recognised, indisputably by Filippino. It is of his Strozzi Chapel period. The figure to the right here should be compared for the action with the two muses to the right of the window in that chapel.
Cataloguer's Comments: Handwritten note in BB1961: "202.E s Botticelli!!!".

BB_1961_title_recto: Uomo ammantato che siede brandendo una spada nella mano sinistra
BB_1938_title_recto: Draped male figure seated, with sword erect in Ieft hand. Rough.
BB_1903_title_recto: Draped male figures seated, with sword erect in left hand. Rough.

BB_1961_title_recto: Tre figure maschili drappeggiate
BB_1961_text_recto: Di qualità inferiore e in povere condizioni, ma probabilmente di Filippino.
BB_1938_title_recto: Threo draped male figures, of inferior quality and poor condition, but probably Filippino's.
BB_1903_title_recto: Three draped male figures, of inferior quality and poor condition, but probably Filippi no's.

BB_1961_title_recto: Schizzo affrettato di una figura maschile drappeggiata seduta sopra uno sgabello
BB_1938_title_recto: Hasty sketch of draped male figure seated on a stool.
BB_1903_title_recto: Draped male figure seated on a stool. Hasty.

BB_1961_title_recto: Epifania
BB_1938_title_recto: Study for oblong Epiphany.
BB_1903_title_recto: Adoration of Magi.

BB_1961_title_recto: Studio incantevole per una Natività La Madonna è inginocchiata in primo piano, quasi di fronte, in adorazione del Bambino; a destra, San Giuseppe addormentato e, a sinistra, due Angeli; nello sfondo delle rovine ed una capanna
BB_1961_title_verso: Busto di un giovane dagli occhi grandi e dall'aspetto alquanto timido.
BB_1961_text_recto: trattamento libero, ma delicato. Sentimento delizioso, Appartiene agli ultimi anni di Filippino.
BB_1938_title_recto: Charming study for Nativity. The Madonna kneels in the foreground, almost facing us, adoring the Child. To right St. Joseph asleep, and to Ieft two angels. Background, a ruin and a shed.
BB_1938_title_verso: Portrait bust of a somewhat timid, large-eyed youth.
BB_1938_text_recto: handling free, but delicate. Delightful feeling.
BB_1903_title_recto: Charming study for a Nativity. The Madonna kneels in the foreground, almost facing us, adoring the Child. To right St. Joseph asleep, and to left two Angels. Background, a ruin and a shed.
BB_1903_title_verso: Portrait bust of a somewhat timid, large-eyed Youth.
BB_1903_text_recto: handling free, but of great daintiness. Delightful feeling. From Filippino's last years.

BB_1961_title_recto: Rappresentazione mistica del Cristo sulla Croce, indossante la Sua tunica e la triplice tiara; la croce è sostenuta da due Angeli e, ai suoi piedi, un calice; il Battista ed un altro Santo sono inginocchiati; il tutto iscritto in una cornice
BB_1961_text_recto: Già attribuito a Piero di Cosimo, questo incantevole disegno è stato correttamente attribuito dal Morelli a Filippino. Gli Angeli dovrebbero essere paragonati con quelli monoçromi che sovrastano la tomba nella Cappella Strozzi in Santa Maria Novella. La cornice è pure di Filippino e lo schizzo era forse inteso per una pala destinata a Lucca, dove il Salvatore veniva frequentemente rappresentato con questi attributi, con i quali è noto come il «Sacro Volto», il «Saint Voult» del favorito giuramento di Re Guglielmo Rufus.
BB_1938_title_recto: Mystical representation of Christ on the cross, wearing His seamless coat and triple tiara. The cross is upheld by two angels, and at its foot stands a chalice. The Baptist and another saint kneeling.
BB_1938_text_recto: Ascribed to Piero di Cosimo, this charming drawing has been correctly attributed by Morelli to Filippino. The angels should be compared with those in monochrome over the tomb in the Strozzi Chapel. The study is enclosed in a frame by Filippino also, and the whole may have served for an altar-piece to be painted for Lucca, where the Saviour was frequently represented as He is here [and known as the "Sacro Volto," the "Saint Vault" of King William Rufus' favourite oath.
BB_1903_title_recto: Mystical representation of Christ on the Cross, wearing His seamless coat and a triple tiara. The Cross is upheld by two Angels, and at its foot stands a chalice. The Baptist and another Saint kneeling.
BB_1903_text_recto: Ascribed to Pier di Cosimo, this charming drawing has been attributed by Morelli to Filippino, and he must be right, although here I am led to wonder whether we may not perhaps be in the presence rather of Raffaellino del Garbo. The hands are singularly like those in the latter's Iondo belonging to Herr Simon. I make but do not accept this suggestion. The Angels should be compared with those in monochrome over the tomb in the Strozzi Chapel. The study is enclosed in a frame by Filippino also, and the whole may have served for an altar-piece to be painted for Lucca, where the Saviour was frequently represented as He is here.

BB_1961_title_recto: Re David come Salmista
BB_1961_title_verso: San Domenico che benedice e studio di panneggio.
BB_1938_title_recto: King David as Psalmist: rough and effaced, but masterly.
BB_1938_title_verso: St. Dominic blessing and a study of drapery.
BB_1903_title_recto: King David as Psalmist. Rough and effaced, but authentic.

BB_1961_title_recto: Uomo ammantato seduto in profilo a destra
BB_1961_text_recto: Medesimo modello della persona seduta in BB n. 1347. Attribuito a David Ghirlandajo. Giovanile.

BB_1903_text_recto: Same model as seated person in the Malcolm sketch of two draped figures. Early. This and the three following are ascribed to David Ghirlandajo.

BB_1938_title_recto: Youngish man seated in profile to Ieft, leaning forward with chin in right hand.
BB_1938_text_recto: Same as last.

BB_1961_title_recto: Giovane paludato che si piega, in profilo verso sinistra, ed alza gli occhi con aria sentimentale reggendosi il mento con la mano destra
BB_1961_text_recto: Attribuito a David Ghirlandajo, ma non potrebbe essere più caratteristico di Filippino.
BB_1938_title_recto: Youth heavily draped, leans forward in profile to left, and looks up sentimentally, while supporting his chin on right hand.
BB_1938_text_recto: Same as last. Nothing could be more characterisitcally Filippino's.
BB_1903_title_recto: A Youth heavily draped, Jeans forward in profile to left, and looks up sentimentally, while supporting his chin on his right hand.

BB_1961_title_recto: Giovane con un'asta in mano che sembra colpito durante un incontro di scherma
BB_1961_text_recto: Eccellente come azione, dal tocco vigoroso, uno dei migliori di Filippino. Forse da riferirsi agli affreschi della Cappella Strozzi in Santa Maria Novella .
BB_1938_title_recto: Youthful figure with staff in hand, in attitude of falling out for fencing, but possibly for Strozzi Chapel.
BB_1938_text_recto: Excellent in action, vigorous touch, altogether one of Filippino's best.
BB_1903_title_recto: Youthful figure with a staff in hand, in attitude of falling out for  fencing.
BB_1903_text_recto: Excellent in action, vigorous touch, altogether one of Filippino's best.

BB_1961_title_recto: Figura avvolta in mantello e cappuccio, seduta verso destra, con la mano sopra un libro
BB_1938_title_recto: Figure in cloak and hood seated looking to right with hand on book.

BB_1961_title_recto: Sei o sette cavalieri - forse in relazione con una Adorazione dei Magi
BB_1938_title_recto: Six or seven horsemen - perhaps in connection with an Adoration of Magi.
BB_1938_text_recto: I used to ascribe this spirited sketch to David Ghirlandajo for reasons which now escape me.
BB_1903_title_recto: Cavalcade, perhaps of Magi.
BB_1903_text_recto: The types and the pen stroke recall both Filippi no (to whom it is ascribed) and Ghirlandajo. But this mixed character, and the fact that the head turning to right on the extreme right is so singularly like the middle head in No. 826, make an attribution to David not improbable.

BB_1961_title_recto: Leone alato con la zampa appoggiata sopra un elmo; alla sua destra parte di una finestra circolare alla quale aderisce un putto alato
BB_1938_title_recto: Winged lion with paw resting on helmet. To his right appears part of circular window with winged putto clinging to its side.

BB_1961_title_recto: Tondo: Testa di giovane uomo, in profilo perduto verso sinistra
BB_1961_text_recto: Studio per la testa del terzo Apostolo da destra nell'«Assunzione» affrescata da Filippino in Santa Maria sopra Minerva a Roma (1489-93); oppure studio per la testa del re inginocchiato, con un vaso in mano, nella «Epifania» del 1496 (Uffizi n. 1566). Attribuito al Botticelli.
BB_1938_title_recto: Study for head of apostle in Filippino's fresco of the Assumption at S. Maria sopra Minerva Rome, or, but less likely] of the king kneeling with vase in hand in the Uffizi Epiphany.
BB_1938_text_recto: Acribed to Botticelli.
BB_1903_title_recto: Study for the head of the King kneeling with a vase in his hand in the Uffizi Epiphany.

BB_1961_title_recto: Testa di donna
BB_1961_text_recto: Sembra uno studio per una Madonna in una Natività.
BB_1938_title_recto: Head of woman. Study perhaps for Madonna in a Nativity.
BB_1938_text_recto: A fairly early work.
BB_1903_title_recto: Head of a Woman-Study perhaps for a Madonna in a Nativity.

BB_1961_title_recto: Testa di giovane donna
BB_1938_title_recto: Head of young woman.
BB_1938_text_recto: Rather early, and companion to my 1313A.
BB_1903_title_recto: Head of Young Woman.

BB_1961_title_recto: Donna seduta verso destra, che protende le braccia e busto di giovane
BB_1938_title_recto: Seated female figure to left with arms extended and the bust of a young person.
BB_1903_title_recto: A kneeling figure and the bust of a Youth.

BB_1961_title_recto: Europa
BB_1961_text_recto: Più interessante che eccellente. Tarda. Cfr. con la donna distesa, dei primi anni del periodo mediano, all'Ambrosiana, BB n. 1352.
BB_1938_title_recto: Europa.
BB_1938_text_recto: More interesting than excellent. Cf. much earlier reclining figure in Abrosiana. Late.
BB_1903_title_recto: Europa.
BB_1903_text_recto: More interesting than excellent. Cf. reclining figure in Ambrosiana. Late.

BB_1961_title_recto: San Martino ed il mendico in una nicchia sotto la quale due tritoni accoccolati sorreggono lo stemma di Tanai de' Nerli
BB_1961_text_recto: La forma allungatissima della composizione e lo stemma di Tanai de' Nerli rendono, a dir poco, molto probabile, che sia uno studio per la vetrata della stretta finestra della Cappella Tanai de' Nerli in Santo Spirito, alla quale Filippino fornì la pala d'altare. Le forme sono caratteristiche e il tocco della penna è certamente di Filippino. Ciò nonostante il Morelli si affannò a dimostrare che questo è un tipico disegno di Raffaellino del Garbo ma i tritoni sono quasi identici a quelli di BB n. 1322 che lo stesso Morelli accetta come di Filippino. E finalmente, alcuni anni dopo che avevo scritto quanto sopra, mi è capitato sott'occhi il seguente passaggio di Antonio Billi che mette fine a questa controversia attributiva: «Fecie (F. L.) una tauola a Tanai de Nerli in Santo Spirito et il disegnio della finestra di uetro di Santo Martino».
BB_1938_title_recto: In a niche St. Martin on horseback divides his cloak with a naked beggar. Under the niche, two squatting tritons hold up the arms of Tanai di Nerli.
BB_1938_text_recto: The shape of the composition and the Nerli arms make it, to say the least, highly probable that the study in question was intended for stained glass to fill the window in Tanai's Chapel, above Filippino's picture, in S. Spirito. The forms are most characteristic, and the pen-stroke is certainly Filippino's. Nevertheless, Morelli was at great pains to tell us that this is a typical drawing by Raffaellino del Garbo. Yet the tritons are almost identical with thotle in my 1322 which Morelli accepts as Filippino's. Years after writing the above I came across the following passage in "Antonio Billi," which must put an end to controversy on this point. Speaking of Filippino he says: "Fecie una tauola a Tanai de Nerli in Santo Spirito et il disegnio della finestra di uetro di Santo Martino."
BB_1903_title_recto: In a niche St. Martin on horseback divides his cloak with a naked beggar. Under the niche, two squatting centaurs hold up the arms of Tanai di Nerli.
BB_1903_text_recto: This fact and the shape of the composition make it, to say the least, highly probable that the study in question was intended for stained glass to fill the window in Tanai's Chapel, above Filippino's picture in S. Spirito. The forms are most characteristic, and the pen-stroke is most certainly Filippino's. Nevertheless, Morelli is at great pains to tell us that this is a typical drawing by Raffaelli no del Garbo. But the centaurs arc almost identical with those in No. 1322 which Morelli accepts as Filippino's.

BB_1961_title_recto: Carro di Fetonte
BB_1938_title_recto: Chariot of Phaeton.
BB_1938_text_recto: Dainty and charming drawing.
BB_1903_title_recto: The Chariot of Apollo.

BB_1961_title_recto: Un uomo in piedi ed un altro inginocchiato al suo fianco
BB_1961_text_recto: Bel disegno giovanile, contemporaneo al tondo della Galleria Corsini a Firenze ed alla pala in San Michele di Lucca, con i Santi Rocco, Sebastiano, Girolamo ed Elena Imperatrice.
BB_1938_title_recto: One man standing and another kneeling beside him.
BB_1938_text_recto: Fine early drawing of the period of the Corsini tondo, and the Lucca altar-piece.
BB_1903_title_recto: One Man standing and another kneeling beside him.
BB_1903_text_recto: Fine early drawing of the period of the Corsini tondo, and ihe Lucca altar-piece.

BB_1961_title_recto: Busto di Minerva che tiene in mano un piccolo scudo
BB_1961_title_verso: Un'Arpia e copia, a semplice contorno, da un bassorilievo antico.
BB_1961_text_recto: uno schizzo magistrale ove la biacca è usata con grande effetto pittorico e la penna ha quasi la libertà di tratto di Leonardo. Risale al periodo romano di Filippino (1488-93) ed è il tipo sul quale formò il suo stile Raffaellino.
BB_1938_title_recto: Bust of Minerva holding shield in hand.
BB_1938_title_verso: Outline sketch after antique bas-relief, and of a harpy.
BB_1938_text_recto: a masterly sketch and the white used with great pictorial effect and the pen-stroke having almost Leonardo's freedom. Dates from Filippino's Roman period, and is the type on which Raffaellino formed his style. See, for instance, the St. Catherine in my 768.
BB_1903_title_recto: Bust of Minerva holding a shield in her hand.
BB_1903_title_verso: Outline sketch after antique bas-relief, and of a harpy.
BB_1903_text_recto: a most masterly sketch and with much charm to boot, the white used with great pictorial effect and the pen-stroke having almost Leonardo's freedom. Dates from Filippino's Roman period, and is the type on which Raffaellino formed his.

BB_1961_title_recto: Donna che cuce
BB_1961_text_recto: Piuttosto tardo, ma piacevole ed autentico.
BB_1938_title_recto: Woman sewing.

BB_1961_title_recto: Amorini che giuocano con le armi di un guerriero addormentato, a sinistra; un naviglio ed un giovane eroe che scopre una ninfa addormentata, a destra
BB_1961_text_recto: È un disegno delizioso, nel quale è evidente l'influenza di Piero di Cosimo. Sebbene Filippino fosse, dei due, l'artista più agguerrito, egli subi, infatti, la suggestione dell'opera dell'altro.
BB_1938_title_recto: Delightful design representing Cupid playing with the arms of sleeping warrior, and the same knight uncovering a sleeping nymph.
BB_1938_text_recto: No doubt it was done under Piero di Cosima's influence, for if Filippino was the stronger he nevertheless was affected by the other.
BB_1903_title_recto: Copy of delightful design by Filippino representing Cupid playing with the arms of a sleeping warrior, and the same knight uncovering a sleeping Nymph.
